translated: You see this mind, this mind stands, you see this mind, this mind stands.

original: Nathuṃsaketi kimatthaṃ? Imaṃ purisaṃ passasi. Ayaṃ puriso tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: nathuṃsaka iti kimattham imam purisam passasi ayam puriso tiṭṭhati
translated: What is the meaning of na thuṃsake? You see this man, this man stands.

analyzed: amussādum
translated: , . Amussāduṃ.

original: Sabbasseva amusaddassa savibhattissa aduṃādeso hoti aṃsisu napuṃsake vattamānassa.
analyzed: sabbassa iva amu saddassa sa vibhattissa a duṃ ādesaḥ hoti aṃsisu napuṃsake vattamānassa
translated: The affix aduṃ is added to all the indeclinables, except the indeclinables amu and asu, when they are in the feminine and neuter genders.

original: Aduṃ pupphaṃ passasi, aduṃ pupphaṃ virocati.
analyzed: adum puppham passasi adum puppham virocati
translated: You see the flower aduṃ, the flower aduṃ shines.

original: Napuṃsaketi kimatthaṃ? Amuṃ rājānaṃ passasi, asu rājā tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: napuṃsaka iti kimattham amum rājānam passasi rājā tiṭṭhati
translated: What is the purpose of (the phrase) “in the feminine and neuter genders?” You see the king amuṃ, the king asu stands.

analyzed: itthi pum a napuṃsaka saṅkhyam
translated: The feminine, masculine, and neuter genders.

analyzed: itthi puma napuṃsaka saṅkhyam icca itam adhikāra attham veditabbam
translated: It should be understood that the words “the feminine, masculine, and neuter genders” have the purpose of a general statement.

analyzed: yosu dvinnam dve ca
translated: The feminine and masculine genders of the two, and the two.

original: Dvinnaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ itthipumanapuṃsake vattamānānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ dve hoti yoiccetesu.
analyzed: dvinnam saṅkhyānam itthi puma napuṃsake vattamānānam savibhattīnam dve hoti yaḥ id ca itesu
translated: The affix dve is added to the two genders, feminine and masculine, when they are in the dual number and are in the nominative case.

original: Dve itthiyo, dve dhammā. Dve rūpāni.
analyzed: dve itthiyaḥ dve dhammāḥ dve rūpāni
translated: Two women, two dhammas, two forms.

analyzed: yo svi iti kimattham dvīsu
translated: What is the purpose of (the phrase) “in the feminine and masculine genders?” In the dual number.

original: Caggahaṇena duve dvaya ubha ubhaya duvi ca honti yonāanamiccetesu. Duve samaṇā. Duve brāhmaṇā, duve janā, dvayena, dvayaṃ, ubhinnaṃ, ubhayesaṃ duvinnaṃ.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena duve dvayaḥ ubhaḥ ubhaya duvi ca honti yonāanam icca itesu duve samaṇāḥ duve brāhmaṇāḥ duve janāḥ dvayena dvayam ubhinnam ubhayesam duvinnam
translated: By the word “two” (in the above rule), the words duve, dvaya, ubha, ubhaya, and duvi are also included in the feminine and neuter genders. Two ascetics, two brahmins, two people, by the two, the two, of the two, of the two, of the two.

original: 133, 230. Ti catunnaṃ tisso catasso tayo cattāro tīṇi cattāri.
analyzed: ti catunnam tissaḥ catasso tayo cattāro tīṇi cattāri
translated: The feminine and masculine genders of the three, the four, the three, the four, the three, the four.

original: Ticatunnaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ itthipumanapuṃsake vattamānānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tisso catasso tayo cattāro tīṇi cattāriiccete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ yoiccetesu.
analyzed: ti catunnam saṅkhyānam itthi puma napuṃsake vattamānānam savibhattīnam tissaḥ catassaḥ tayaḥ cattāraḥ tīṇi cattāri iti ete ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam yo i c ca etesu
translated: The endings ti, cattāro, tayo, cattāro are respectively the endings of the three, four, three, and four, when the feminine, masculine, and neuter are in use and have a case-ending.

original: Tisso vedanā catasso disā, tayo janā, jane, cattāro purisā, purise, tīṇi āyatanāni, cattāri ariyasaccāni.
analyzed: tissaḥ vedanā catasso disā tayaḥ janāḥ jane cattāro purisā purise tīṇi āyatanāni cattāri ariya saccāni
translated: Three feelings, four directions, three people, four men, three bases, four noble truths.

analyzed: yo svi iti kimattham tīsu catūsu
translated: What is the purpose of the words yosvīti? In three, in four.

analyzed: pañca ādīn amakāraḥ
translated: The letter a of the five and so on.

original: Pañcādīnaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ itthipumanapuṃsake vattamānānaṃ savibhattissa antassa sarassa akāro hoti yoiccetesu.
analyzed: pañca ādīnam saṅkhyānam itthi puma napuṃsake vattamānānam sa vibhattissa antassa sarassa akāraḥ hoti yaḥ i cca etesu
translated: The letter a is the ending of the five and so on, when the feminine, masculine, and neuter are in use and have a case-ending, and when the letter s is at the end of the word.

original: Pañca, pañca, cha, cha, satta, satta, aṭṭha, aṭṭha, nava, nava, dasa, dasa.
analyzed: pañca pañca cha cha satta satta aṭṭha aṭṭha nava nava dasa dasa
translated: Five, five, six, six, seven, seven, eight, eight, nine, nine, ten, ten.

analyzed: pañca ādīnam iti kimattham dve
translated: What is the purpose of the words pañcādīnam? Two, three.

analyzed: rājassa raññaḥ rājinaḥ se
translated: The se of rājassa, rañño, rājino.

original: Sabbasseva rājasaddassa savibhattissa rañño rājinoiccete ādesā honti se vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbassa iva rāja saddassa sa vibhattissa raññaḥ rājino icca ete ādesāḥ honti se vibhattimhi
translated: The endings rañño, rājino are respectively the endings of the word rājā, when it has a case-ending and the case-ending se is used.

analyzed: raññaḥ rājinaḥ
translated: Of the king, of the kings.

analyzed: sā iti kimattham raññā
translated: What is the purpose of the words se? By the king.

analyzed: raññam naṃmhi vā
translated: In the locative, of kings is either.

original: Sabbasseva rājasaddassa savibhattissa raññaṃādeso hoti vā naṃmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbassa iva rāja saddassa sa vibhattissa raññaṃ ādesaḥ hoti vā naṃmhi vibhattimhi
translated: In the locative, of all the words for king with case-ending, of kings is either.

original: Raññaṃ, rājūnaṃ idaṃ raṭṭhaṃ.🔽137, 116. Nāmhiraññā vā.🔽Sabbasseva rājasaddassa savibhattissa raññāādeso hoti vā nāmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: idam  nām hi raññā vā  sabbassa iva rāja saddassa sa vibhattissa raññā ādesaḥ hoti vā nāmhi vibhattimhi
translated: This kingdom is of the kings, of the kings.🔽In the locative, of kings is either.

original: Tena raññā kataṃ. Rājena vā kataṃ.
analyzed: tena raññā katam rājena vā katam
translated: That was done by the king, or that was done by the king.

analyzed: na amhi iti kimattham rañño santakam
translated: Why is it said ‘in the locative’? The property of the king.

analyzed: raññe rājini
translated: In the locative, of the king, of the king.

original: Sabbasseva rājasaddassa savibhattissa raññerājiniiccete ādesā honti smiṃmhivibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbassa iva rāja saddassa sa vibhattissa raññe rājini iti ca ite ādesāḥ honti smin mhi vibhattimhi
translated: In the locative, of all the words for king with case-ending, of the king, of the king are the endings.

analyzed: raññe rājini sīlam tiṭṭhati
translated: Morality stands in the king, in the king.

analyzed: tumhākam tayi mayi
translated: In the locative, in you, in me.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amha saddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tayi mayiiccete ādeso honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ smiṃmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tayi mayi it ca ite ādesaḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam smin mhi vibhattimhi
translated: In the locative, in all the words for you and for me with case-ending, in you, in me are the endings.

analyzed: tayi mayi
translated: In you, in me.

original: Smiṃmhīti kimatthaṃ? Tvaṃ bhavasi, ahaṃ bhavāmi.
analyzed: kim attham tvam bhavasi aham bhavāmi
translated: Why is it said ‘in the locative’? You are, I am.

analyzed: tvam aham simhi ca
translated: In the locative, in you, in me.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tvaṃ ahaṃiccete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ simhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tvam aham iti ca ete ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam simhi vibhattimhi
translated: Of all the words tumha and amha with case-endings, the forms tvaṃ, ahaṃ, are the designators in the locative case.

analyzed: tvam aham
translated: Tvaṃ, ahaṃ.

analyzed: simhiti kimattham tayi mayi
translated: Why is the locative case mentioned? In tayi, mayi.

original: Caggahaṇena tuvaṃ ca hoti. Tuvaṃ satthā.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena tuvam ca hoti tuvam satthā
translated: But tuvaṃ and hoti are included by the general rule. Tuvaṃ satthā.

analyzed: tava mamase
translated: , . Tava, mama.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tavamamaiccete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ se vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tava mama ai c ca ite ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam se vibhattimhi
translated: Of all the words tumha and amha with case-endings, the forms tava, mama, are the designators in the genitive case.

analyzed: tava mama
translated: Tava, mama.

analyzed: sā iti kimattham tayi mayi
translated: Why is the genitive case mentioned? In tayi, mayi.

analyzed: tuyham mayham ca
translated: , . Tuyhaṃ, mayhañca.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tuyhaṃ mayhaṃiccete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ se vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tuyham mayham iti ete ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam se vibhattimhi
translated: Of all the words tumha and amha with case-endings, the forms tuyhaṃ, mayhaṃ, are the designators in the genitive case.

analyzed: tuyham mayham dhanam dīyate
translated: Tuyhaṃ, mayhaṃ dhanaṃ dīyate.

analyzed: sā iti kim attham tayā mayā
translated: Why is the genitive case mentioned? In tayā, mayā.

analyzed: tam mamaṃmhi
translated: , . Taṃ, mamaṃmhi.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ taṃ maiccete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ aṃmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tam ma e c ca ete ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam aṃmhi vibhattimhi
translated: Of all the words tumha and amha with case-endings, the forms taṃ, maṃ, are the designators in the locative case.

analyzed: tam maṃ
translated: Taṃ, maṃ.

analyzed: ammhi iti kim attham tayā mayā
translated: Why is the locative case mentioned? In tayā, mayā.

analyzed: tavam mamañca navā
translated: Tavaṃ mamañca navā.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tavaṃ mamaṃiccete ādesā honti navā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ aṃmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tavam mamaṃ iti ete ādesāḥ honti navāḥ yathāsaṅkhyam aṃmhi vibhattimhi
translated: Tavaṃ and mamaṃ are the replacements for all the words ending in the case endings of the first declension and the second declension, respectively, in the nominative case.

analyzed: tavam mamam passati
translated: Tavaṃ, mamaṃ passati.

analyzed: navāti kimattham tam mama passati
translated: Why is navā said? Taṃ, maṃ passati.

analyzed: ca ggahaṇam anukaḍḍhana ttham
translated: In order to include the other cases.

analyzed: tayā mayā
translated: Nāmhī tayā mayā.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tayā mayāiccete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ nāmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tayā mayā i c ca ite ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam nāmhi vibhattimhi
translated: Tayā and mayā are the replacements for all the words ending in the case endings of the first declension and the second declension, respectively, in the locative case.

analyzed: tayā mayā katam
translated: Tayā, mayā kataṃ.

analyzed: na amhi iti kimattham tumhehi amhehi
translated: Why is nāmhi said? Tumhehi, amhehi.

analyzed: tumhassa tuvam
translated: Tumhassa tuvaṃ tvamaṃmhi.

original: Sabbassa tumhasaddassa savibhattissa tuvaṃ tvaṃ iccete ādesā honti aṃmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbassa tumha saddassa sa vibhattissa tuvam tvam iti ca ete ādesāḥ honti aṃmhi vibhattimhi
translated: Tuvaṃ and tvaṃ are the replacements for all the words ending in the case endings of the second declension, respectively, in the nominative case.

original: Kaliṅgarassa tuvaṃ maññe, kaṭṭhassa tvaṃ maññe.
analyzed: kaliṅgarassa tuvam maññe kaṭṭhassa tvam maññe
translated: Kaliṅgarassa tuvaṃ maññe, kaṭṭhassa tvaṃ maññe.

analyzed: padataḥ dutiyā catutthī chaṭṭhīsu vā ūnaḥ
translated: Vonu padato dutiyā catutthī chaṭṭhīsu.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yadā padasmā paresaṃ vo noādesā honti navā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ dutiyā catutthīchaṭṭhīiccetesu bahuvacanesu.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam yadā pada asmā paresam vaḥ no ādesāḥ honti navā yathāsaṅkhyam dutiyā catutthī chaṭṭhī i t ca itesu bahuvacanesu
translated: In all these cases, when the other forms of the dual, etc., are not used, the forms in -o are used in the second, fourth, sixth, etc., plural cases respectively.

original: Pahāya vo bhikkhave gamissāmi, mā no ajja vikantiṃsu, rañño sūdā mahānase, evaṃ dutiyatthe.
analyzed: pahāya vaḥ bhikkhave gamissāmi mā naḥ ajja vikantiṃsu raññaḥ sūdāḥ mahānase evam dutiya tthe
translated: “Having abandoned, monks, I will go away. Let not the people today be disappointed. In the king’s kitchen” . Thus in the second case.

original: Dhammaṃ vo bhikkhave desessāmi, saṃvibhajetha no rajjena, evaṃ catutthyatthe.
analyzed: dhammam vaḥ bhikkhave desessāmi saṃvibhajetha naḥ rajjena evam catutthī atthe
translated: “I will teach you the Dhamma, monks. Let not the people today be disappointed. In the king’s kitchen” . Thus in the fourth case.

original: Tuṭṭhosmi vo bhikkhave pakatiyā, satthā no bhagavā anuppatto, evaṃ chaṭṭhyatthe.🔽Navāti kimatthaṃ? Eso amhākaṃ satthā.
analyzed: tuṭṭhaḥ asmi vaḥ bhikkhave pakatiyā satthā naḥ bhagavā an uppattaḥ evam chaṭṭhī atthe  nava ati kimattham esaḥ amhākam satthā
translated: “I am satisfied, monks, with the natural state of things. Our Blessed Lord has come” . Thus in the sixth case.🔽Why is the word navā used? “This is our teacher” .

analyzed: tumha mhākam iti kimattham ete isayo passasi
translated: Why is the word tumhamhākam used? “You see these seers” .

analyzed: kimattham tumhākam satthā
translated: Why is the word padato used? “Your teacher” .

analyzed: etesu iti kim attham gacchatha tumhe
translated: Why is the word eteesu used? “You go” .

analyzed: tem ekavacanesu ca
translated: In the singular cases too.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yadā padasmā paresaṃ te me ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ catutthīchaṭṭhīiccetesu ekavacanesu.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam yadā pada paresam te me ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam catutthī chaṭṭhī i t ca itesu ekavacanesu
translated: Of all your and my words with case endings, when they are not followed by another word, my and my are the substitutes, in the fourth, sixth, etc., singular cases, respectively, in these:

original: Dadāmi te gāmavarāni pañca, dadāhi me gāmavaraṃ, idaṃ te raṭṭhaṃ, ayaṃ me putto.
analyzed: dadāmi te gām avarāni pañca dadāhi me gām avaram idam te raṭṭham ayam me putto
translated: I give you five choice villages, give me a choice village, this is your kingdom, this is my son.

original: Padatoti kimatthaṃ? Tava ñāti, mama ñāti.
analyzed: kimattham tava ñāti mama ñāti
translated: From a word: what is the purpose? Your kinsman, my kinsman.

analyzed: na am mhi
translated: I am not.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yadā padasmā paresaṃ te meādesā na honti aṃmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam sa vibhattīnam yadā pada paresam te me ādesāḥ na honti aṃmhi vibhattimhi
translated: Of all your and my words with case endings, when they are not followed by another word, my is the case ending when it is not.

original: Passeyya taṃ vassasataṃ arogaṃ, so maṃ bravīti.
analyzed: passeyya tam vassa satam arogam saḥ mama bravīti
translated: May you see him a hundred years in health, he speaks to me.

analyzed: vā tatiye ca
translated: Or in the third.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yadā padasmā paresaṃ temeādesā honti vā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ tatiyekavacane pare.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam yadā pada paresam honti vā yathāsaṅkhyam tatiya ekavacane pare
translated: Of all your and my words with case endings, when they are followed by another word, my and my are the substitutes, respectively, in the third, singular case, when another word follows.

original: Kataṃ te pāpaṃ, kataṃ me pāpaṃ, kataṃ tayā pāpaṃ, kataṃ mayā pāpaṃ.
analyzed: katam te pāpam katam me pāpam katam tayā pāpam katam mayā pāpam
translated: Evil has been done by you, evil has been done by me, evil has been done by you, evil has been done by me.

original: Padatoti kimatthaṃ? Tayā kataṃ, mayā kataṃ.
analyzed: kimattham tayā katam mayā katam
translated: From a word: what is the purpose? Evil has been done by you, evil has been done by me.

analyzed: bahuvacanesu va ū naḥ
translated: In the plural, the instrumental.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yadā padasmā paresaṃ vonoādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ tatiyābahuvacanesu paresu.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam yadā pada smā paresam vo no ādesāḥ honti yathāsaṅkhyam tatiyā bahuvacanesu paresu
translated: The forms of the words tumhaṃ and amhaṃ are analysed. When the endings of the third case plural are added to them, the following forms are obtained:

original: Kataṃ vo kammaṃ, kataṃ no kammaṃ.
analyzed: katam vaḥ kammam katam no kammam
translated: Kataṃ vo kammaṃ, kataṃ no kammaṃ.

original: Padatoti kimatthaṃ? Tumhehi kataṃ, amhehi kataṃ.
analyzed: kimattham tumhehi katam amhehi katam
translated: Why is the word padato mentioned? Tumhehi kataṃ, amhehi kataṃ.

original: Bahuvacanaggahaṇena yomhi paṭhame vo noādesā honti. Gāmaṃ vo gaccheyyātha, gāmaṃ no gaccheyyāma.
analyzed: bahuvacana ggahaṇena yomhi paṭhame vaḥ no ādesāḥ honti gāmam vaḥ gaccheyyātha gāmam no gaccheyyāma
translated: By mentioning the plural, the forms of the second case singular are shown: Gāmaṃ vo gaccheyyātha, gāmaṃ no gaccheyyāma.

analyzed: pum antassa simhi
translated: The form of the word pumā is shown.

original: Pumaiccevamantassa savibhattissa āādeso hoti simhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: pum a e c ca ivam antassa sa vibhattissa ā ādesaḥ hoti simhi vibhattimhi
translated: The form of the word pumā is shown when the ending si is added to the word pumā.

analyzed: pumā tiṭṭhati
translated: Pumā tiṭṭhati.

analyzed: simhi iti kimattham tiṭṭhanti
translated: Why is the word si mentioned? Pumāno tiṭṭhanti.

original: Antaggahaṇena maghava yuvaiccevamādīnamantassasavibhattissa āādeso hoti. Maghavā, yuvā.
analyzed: anta ggahaṇena maghava yuvā e cca ivamādīnam antassa sa vibhattissa ā ādesaḥ hoti maghavā yuvā
translated: By mentioning the word anta, the forms of the words maghavā and yuvā are shown. Maghavā, yuvā.

analyzed: am ālapan ekavacane
translated: The form of the word pumā is shown in the vocative singular.

original: Pumaiccevamantassa savibhattissa aṃādeso hoti ālapanekavacane pare.
analyzed: pum a i c ca evam antassa sa vibhattissa aṃ ādesaḥ hoti ā lapana ekavacane pare
translated: The form of the word pumā is shown when the ending aṃ is added to the word pumā in the vocative singular.

analyzed: he pumaṃ
translated: He pumā.

analyzed: ālapana iti kimattham pumā
translated: Why is the word ālapane mentioned? Pumā.

analyzed: ekavacanā iti kimattham he pumāno
translated: Why is the word ekavacane mentioned? He pumāno.

analyzed: samāse ca vibhāsā
translated: And in a compound, by analysis.

original: Pumaiccevamantassa samāse ca aṃādeso hoti vibhāsā samāse kate.
analyzed: samāse ca aṃ ādesaḥ hoti vibhāsā samāse kate
translated: In a compound, the vowel a of a masculine word is changed to aṃ by analysis, after the compound has been made.

original: Itthī ca pumā ca napuṃsakaṃ ca itthipumanapuṃsakāni. Itthipumanapuṃsakānaṃ samūho itthipumanapuṃsakasamūho.
analyzed: itthī ca pumā ca napuṃsakam ca itthi puma napuṃsakāni itthi puma napuṃsakānam samūhaḥ itthi puma napuṃsaka samūhaḥ
translated: Feminine, masculine, and neuter are itthī, pumā, napumsakam. The collection of feminine, masculine, and neuter is itthipumanapuṃsakasamūho.

analyzed: kimattham itthi puma napuṃsakāni
translated: By analysis: what is the purpose of that? Feminine, masculine, neuter.

analyzed: yosvānaḥ

translated: In a masculine word, the vowel a is changed to āno by analysis, in the case of the case-endings yosu.

analyzed: pumānaḥ he pumānaḥ

analyzed: yosvī iti kimattham pumā
translated: Yosu: what is the purpose of that? Masculine.

analyzed: āne smim hi vā

analyzed: pumāne pume vā

analyzed: pum ai c ca ivam antassa hi vibhattimhi ca āne ādesaḥ hoti

original: Caggahaṇena maghava yuvaiccevamādīnamantassa ānaādeso hoti si yo aṃyo iccetesu vibhattīsu,🔽pumakammathāmantassa cukāro hoti sasmā su vibhattīsu. Maghavāno, maghavānā. Maghavānaṃ,
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena maghava yuvā e t ca ivamādīnam antassa āna ādesaḥ hoti si yaḥ aṃ yaḥ iti ca etesu vibhattīsu  cukāraḥ hoti sasmā su vibhattīsu maghavānaḥ maghavānā maghavānam
translated: The vowel of the first syllable of a word is lengthened before the words maghavā, yuva, etc., in the Ablative, etc.,

original: maghavāne. Yuvāno, yuvānā, yuvānaṃ, yuvāne, pumuno, pumunā. Kammuno, kammunā, thāmuno, thāmunā.
analyzed: maghavāne yuvānaḥ yuvānā yuvānam yuvāne pumunā pumunā kammunā kammunā thāmunā thāmunā
translated: Maghavāno, maghavānā, maghavānaṃ, maghavāne, pumuno, pumunā, kammuno, kammunā, thāmuno, thāmunā.

original: 158, 143. Susmimā vā.🔽Pumaiccevamantassa suiccetasmiṃvibhattimhi āādeso hoti vā.🔽Pumāsu, pumesu vā.🔽156, 139. Unāmhi ca.
analyzed: susmimā vā  pum a e c ca ivam antassa su it ca itasmin vibhattimhi ā ādesaḥ hoti vā  pumāsu pumesu vā  u nāmhi ca
translated: Or susmimā.

original: Pumaiccevamantassa āuādesā honti vā nāmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: pum a i t ca ivam antassa ā u ādesāḥ honti vā nāmhi vibhattimhi
translated: The vowel of the first syllable of a word is lengthened before the word pumā, in the case-ending in question, optionally.

analyzed: pumānā pumunā pumena vā  ca ggahaṇam anukaḍḍhana ttham
translated: Pumāsu, pumesu, or pumāsu, pumesu.

original: 160, 167. A kammantassa ca.🔽Kammaiccevamantassa ca ua ādesā honti vā nāmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: a kammantassa ca  kamma e c ca ivam antassa ca u a ādesāḥ honti vā nāmhi vibhattimhi
translated: Or unā in the Locative.🔽The vowel of the first syllable of a word is lengthened before the word pumā, optionally, in the Locative case-ending.

analyzed: kammunā kammanā kammena vā
translated: Pumānā, pumunā, pumena, or pumānā, pumunā, pumena.

original: Caggahaṇena maghavayuvaiccevamantassa āāde so hoti kvaci nāsuiccetesu vibhattīsu. Maghavānā, maghavāsu, maghavesu, maghavena vā. Yuvānā, yuvāsu, yuvesu, yuvena vā.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena āāde saḥ hoti kvaci na āsu iti ca itesu vibhattīsu maghavānā maghavāsu maghavesu maghavena vā yuvānā yuvāsu yuvesu yuvena vā
translated: By the rule of the first, the word ā is substituted for ā in the locative case, and for ā in the instrumental case, in the following words: Maghavānā, maghavāsu, maghavesu, maghavena vā. Yuvānā, yuvāsu, yuvesu, yuvena vā.

analyzed: iti nāmakappe dutiyaḥ kaṇḍo
translated: Thus ends the second chapter in the section on nouns in the Kaccāyana grammar.

analyzed: tatiya kaṇḍa  namākam
translated: Third chapter🔽, . Tumha’mhehi namākaṃ.

analyzed: tehi tumha amhehi naṃvacanassa ākam hoti
translated: The word ākaṃ is substituted for the word naṃ of the words te, tumha, and amha, when the words tehi, tumhehi, and amhehi are used.

analyzed: tumhākam amhākam
translated: Tumhākaṃ, amhākaṃ.

analyzed: nam iti kimattham tumhehi amhehi
translated: What is the purpose of the particle naṃ? Tumhehi, amhehi.

original: 162, 237. Vā yvappaṭhamo.🔽Tehi tumhaamhehi yo appaṭhamo ākaṃhoti vā.
analyzed: vā y v ap paṭhamaḥ  tehi tumha amhehi yaḥ appaṭhamaḥ vā
translated: , . Vā yvappaṭhamo.🔽The word ākaṃ is substituted for the word yo of the words te, tumha, and amha, when the words tehi, tumhehi, and amhehi are used, and the word yo is not the first in the compound.

original: Tumhākaṃ passāmi, tumhe passāmi vā. Amhākaṃ passasi, amhe passasi vā.
analyzed: tumhākam passāmi tumhe passāmi vā amhākam passasi amhe passasi vā
translated: Tumhākaṃ passāmi, tumhe passāmi vā. Amhākaṃ passasi, amhe passasi vā.

analyzed: kimattham tumhehi amhehi
translated: What is the purpose of the particle yo? Tumhehi, amhehi.

original: Appaṭhamoti kimatthaṃ? Gacchatha tumhe, gacchāma mayaṃ.
analyzed: kimattham gacchatha tumhe gacchāma mayam
translated: What is the purpose of the particle appaṭhamo? Gacchatha tumhe, gacchāma mayaṃ.

original: Vātivikappanatthena yonaṃ aṃ ānaṃ honti. Tumhaṃ tumhānaṃ. Amhaṃ, amhānaṃ.
analyzed: vāti vikappana atthena aṃ ānam honti tumham tumhānam amham amhānam
translated: The words aṃ and ānaṃ are substituted for the words yonaṃ, when the words tehi, tumhehi, and amhehi are used, in order to avoid the fault of the words being too long. Tumhaṃ tumhānaṃ. Amhaṃ, amhānaṃ.

original: 163, 240. Sassaṃ.🔽Tehi humhaamhehi sassa vibhattissa aṃ ādeso hoti vā.
analyzed: sassam 🔽tehi humha amhehi sassa vibhattissa aṃ ādesaḥ hoti vā
translated: , . Sassaṃ.🔽The word aṃ is substituted for the word sassa of the words te, tumha, and amha, when the words tehi, tumhehi, and amhehi are used, and the word sassa is not the first in the compound.

original: Tumhaṃ dīyate, tava dīyate. Tumhaṃ pariggaho, tava pariggaho. Amhaṃ dīyate, mama dīyate. Amhaṃ pariggaho, mama pariggaho.
analyzed: tumham dīyate tava dīyate tumham pariggaho tava pariggahaḥ amham dīyate mama dīyate amham pariggahaḥ mama pariggahaḥ
translated: To you is given, to you is dedicated. Your possession, your property. To us is given, to us is dedicated. Our possession, our property.

original: Sasseti kimatthaṃ? Tumhesu, amhesu.🔽164, 200. Sabbanāma’kārate paṭhamo.
analyzed: sassa iti kimattham tumhesu amhesu  paṭhamaḥ
translated: Sasse: what is the meaning of the word sasse? To you, to us.🔽Sabbanāma’kārate paṭhamo: the first of the words of the class of all names ending in a vowel.

original: Sabbesaṃ sabbanāmānaṃ akārato yo paṭhamo ettamāpajjate.
analyzed: sabbesam sabbanāmānam akārataḥ yaḥ paṭhamaḥ āpajjate
translated: Of all the names, the first of those ending in a vowel.

original: Sabbe, ye, te, ke, tumhe, amhe, ime.
analyzed: sabbe ye te ke tumhe amhe ime
translated: All, whatever, those, which, you, we, these.

original: Sabbanāmāti kimatthaṃ? Devā, asurā, nāgā, gandhabbā, manussā.
analyzed: sabbanāmā ati kimattham devāḥ asurāḥ nāgāḥ gandhabbāḥ manussā

analyzed: kimattham amū purisā tiṭṭhanti

original: Yoti kimatthaṃ? Sabbo, yo, so, ko, ayaṃ.
analyzed: yaḥ ti kimattham sabbaḥ yaḥ saḥ kaḥ ayam
translated: Yo: what is the meaning of the word yo? All, whatever, that, which, this.

analyzed: paṭhama ggahaṇam uttara sutta ttham

analyzed: dvandaṭṭhāḥ vā

analyzed: tasmā sabbanāmakārataḥ yaḥ paṭhamaḥ vā
translated: Therefore, the first of the words of the class of all names ending in a vowel, or of those standing in dvanda compounds.

analyzed: katarakatame katarakatamāḥ vā

original: Sabbanāmāti kimatthaṃ? Devāsuranāga gandhabbamanussā.🔽Dvandaṭṭhāti kimatthaṃ te, sabbe.
analyzed: sabbanāmā ati kimattham deva asura nāga gandhabba manussā  dvandaṭṭhā ati kimattham te sabbe

analyzed: na aññam sabbanāmikam

analyzed: sabbanāmikānam dvandaṭṭhe na aññam kāriyam hoti

analyzed: pubba aparānam pubba uttarānam adhar uttarānam

analyzed: bahup bīhimhi ca

analyzed: piya pubbāya piya pubbānam piya pubbe piya pubbassa

original: Ceti kimatthaṃ? Sabbanāmavidhānaṃ hoti, dakkhiṇa pubbassaṃ, dakkhiṇapubbassā, uttarapubbassaṃ, uttarapubbassā.

analyzed: sabbatas nam sam sānam

analyzed: sabbesam sabbesānam sabbāsam sabbāsānam yesam yesānam yāsam yāsānam tesam

analyzed: tesānam tāsam tāsānam kesam kesānam kāsam kāsānam imesam imesānam imāsam

analyzed: etesu iti kimattham nesu tesu

analyzed: sabbakaḥ yakaḥ sakaḥ amukaḥ asukaḥ

analyzed: puna sabbatas gahaṇena aññasma api kakāra āgamaḥ hoti hīnako potako

analyzed: yapataḥ smiṃsānam saṃsā
translated: After yap, saṃ and sā after smiṃ and ā.

original: Sabbato sabbanāmato ghapasaññato smiṃsaiccetesaṃ saṃsā ādesā honti vā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ.
analyzed: sabbataḥ sabba nāmataḥ gha pa saññataḥ saṃsāḥ ādesāḥ honti vā yathāsaṅkhyam
translated: After sabba, the syllable saṃ is added to all nouns, optionally, in the locative case, after smiṃ and ā, in the following order.

original: Sabbassaṃ, sabbassā, sabbāyaṃ, sabbāya, imissaṃ, imissā, imāyaṃ, imāya, amussaṃ, amussā, amuyaṃ, amuyā.
analyzed: sabbassam sabbassā sabbāyam sabbāya imissam imissā imāyam imāya amussam amussā amuyam amuyā
translated: Sabbassaṃ, sabbassā, sabbāyaṃ, sabbāya, imissaṃ, imissā, imāyaṃ, imāya, amussaṃ, amussā, amuyaṃ, amuyā.

analyzed: sabbanāmataḥ ti kimattham itthiyam itthiyā
translated: What is the purpose of the word sabbanāma? Itthiyaṃ, itthiyā.

analyzed: smiṃsānam iti kimattham
translated: What is the purpose of the word smiṃsānaṃ? Amuyo.

analyzed: netāhi smimāya yā

original: Etehi sabbanāmehi ghapasaññehi smiṃvacanassa neva āya yāādesā honti.
analyzed: etehi sabbanāmehi gha pa saññehi smiṃvacanassa na iva ā ya yā ādesāḥ honti
translated: After these nouns sabba, etc., which are regarded as gha, the syllables yā and ā are added to the locative case, in the following order.

original: Etissaṃ, etāyaṃ, imissaṃ, imāyaṃ, amussaṃ, amuyaṃ.
analyzed: etissam etāyam imissam imāyam amussam amuyam
translated: Etassaṃ, etāyaṃ, imissaṃ, imāyaṃ, amussaṃ, amuyaṃ.

analyzed: smin ti kimattham tāya itthiyāḥ mukham
translated: Smiṃ, what is its meaning? The face of that woman.

original: Etāhīti kimatthaṃ? Kaññāya, vīṇāya, gaṅgāya, kapālikāya.
analyzed: etāhi iti kimattham kaññāya vīṇāya gaṅgāya kapālikāya
translated: Etāhī, what is its meaning? Of the maiden, of the lute, of the Ganges, of the skull-bearer.

analyzed: manas gaṇa āt itaḥ smin nāna miā

original: Tasmā manogaṇādito smiṃnāiccetesaṃ ikāraākārādesā honti vā yathāsaṅkhyaṃ.
analyzed: tasmāt manaḥ gaṇa āditaḥ ikāra ākāra ādesāḥ honti vā yathāsaṅkhyam
translated: Therefore, from the class man, etc., the vowels i and ā of these are optionally changed to i and i respectively.

original: Manasi, manusmiṃ, sirasi, sirasmiṃ, manasā, manena, vacasā, vacena, sirasā, sirena,
analyzed: manasi sirasi sirasmin manasā manena vacasā vacena sirasā sirena
translated: In the mind, in the man, on the head, on the head, with the mind, with the man, with speech, with the word, with the head, with the head,

original: sarasā, sarena, tapasā, tapena, vayasā, vayena, yasasā, yasena, tejasā, tejena, urasā,
analyzed: sarasā sarena tapasā tapena vayasā vayena yasasā yasena tejasā tejena urasā
translated: with the river, with the river, with austerity, with austerity, with youth, with youth, with fame, with fame, with splendour, with splendour, with the chest,

analyzed: urena thāmasā thāmena
translated: with the chest, with strength, with strength.

original: Smiṃnānamiti kimatthaṃ? Mano, siro, tamo, tapo, tejo.
analyzed: smiṃnānam iti kimattham manaḥ siraḥ tamaḥ tapo tejaḥ
translated: Smiṃnānam, what is its meaning? Mind, head, darkness, austerity, splendour.

original: Ādiggahaṇena aññāsmāpi smiṃnānaṃ ikāraākārādesā honti, bilasi, bilasā, padasi, padasā.
analyzed: ādi ggahaṇena smiṃnānam ikāra ākāra ādesāḥ honti bilasi bilasā padasi padasā
translated: By the word “etc.” the vowels i and ā of other smiṃnānam are also optionally changed to i and i, in the lotus, in the lotuses, in the foot, in the feet.

analyzed: sassa caḥ

original: Tasmā manogaṇādito sassa ca okāro hoti.
analyzed: tasmā manaḥ gaṇa āditaḥ sassa ca okāraḥ hoti
translated: Therefore, of the class man, etc., and of sassa, the vowel o is changed to o.

analyzed: manasaḥ thāmasaḥ tapasaḥ
translated: Of the mind, of strength, of austerity.

analyzed: e te samaḥ lope
translated: Etesam, in the elision of.

original: Etesaṃ manogaṇādīnaṃ anto ottamāpajjate vibhattilope kate.

analyzed: manaḥ mayam ayaḥ mayam tejaḥ samena tapaḥ guṇena siroruhena
translated: Mind-made, iron-made, like water, like fire, with the hair of his head, with the hair of his body.

analyzed: ādi ggahaṇam kimattham aññesam antaḥ ottama āpajjate āpo samena vāyosamena
translated: What is the purpose of the initial inclusion? The superlative is made at the end of other words. Like water, like air.

original: Lopeti kimatthaṃ? Padayā, tapasā, yasasā, vacasā, manasā, evamaññepi yojetabbā.
analyzed: lopa iti kimattham padayā tapasā yasasā vacasā manasā evam aññe pi yojetabbā

analyzed: sa sare
translated: , . The augment sa is optionally added.

original: Eteheva manogaṇādīhi vibhattādese sare pare sakārāgamo hoti vā.
analyzed: etehi iva manaḥ gaṇa ādīhi vibhatta ādese sare pare sakāra āgamaḥ hoti vā

analyzed: manasā vacasā manasi vacasi
translated: By mind, by speech, in the mind, in the speech.

analyzed: vāti kimattham manena tejena vasena
translated: What is the purpose of the word “optionally”? By mind, by glory, by power,

analyzed: sara iti kim attham mano tejaḥ yaso

original: Puna ādiggahaṇena aññasmimpi paccaye pare sakārāgamo hoti. Mānasikaṃ, vācasikaṃ.
analyzed: puna ādi ggahaṇena aññasmim pi paccaye pare sakāra āgamaḥ hoti mānasikam vācasikam

analyzed: santa saddassa saḥ te baḥ cante

original: Sabbassa santasaddassa sakārādeso hoti bhakāre pare, ante ca bakārāgamo hoti.

analyzed: sabbhikubbetha santhavam

analyzed: jīranti ve rāja rathā su cittā

analyzed: atha u sarīram pi jaram upeti

analyzed: satañca dhammaḥ na jaram upeti

analyzed: santaḥ have sabbhi pavedayanti

analyzed: bheti kimattham santehi pūjitaḥ bhagavā

original: Yakāravantānaṃ ta la ṇa dakārānaṃ byañjanāni ca la ña jakārattamāpajjante yathāsaṅkhyaṃ.

translated: The ya, va, ta, la, ṇa, and da of the preceding word take the form of the la, ña, and ja of the following word, respectively.

original: Bāhussaccaṃ, paṇḍiccaṃ, vepullaṃ, kāruññaṃ, kosallaṃ, nepuññaṃ, sāmaññaṃ, sohajjaṃ.
analyzed: bāhussaccam paṇḍiccam vepullam kāruññam kosallam nepuññam sāmaññam sohajjam

translated: The words amha, tumha, rāja, brahma, atta, sakha, satthu, pitu, etc., should be seen as having the reflexive ending -s.

original: Mayā, tayā, guṇavatā, raññā, brahmunā, attanā, sakhinā, satthārā, pitarā, mātarā, bhātarā, dhītarā, kattārā, vattārā.

analyzed: etehi iti kimattham purisā

analyzed: iti nāmakappe pañcamaḥ kaṇḍo

analyzed: nāmakappaḥ niṭṭhito  kāraka kappa

analyzed: chaṭṭha kaṇḍa
translated: The sixth chapter🔽Because of giving, because of taking, because of fear, because of origination,

original: 271, 88, 308. Yasmā dapeti bhayamādatte vā tadapādānaṃ.🔽Yasmā vā apeti, yasmā vā bhayaṃ jāyate, yasmā vā ādatte, taṃ kārakaṃ apādānasaññaṃ hoti.🔽Taṃ yathā? Gāmā apenti munayo, nagarā niggato rājā, corā bhayaṃ jāyate, ācariyupajjhāyehi sikkhaṃ gaṇhāti sisso.🔽Apādānamiccanena kvattho? Apādāne pañcamī.🔽272, 309. Dhātunā mānamupasaggayogādvīsvapi ca.
analyzed: yasmai bhayam ādatte vā tad apādānam  yasmai vā apeti yasmai vā bhayam jāyate yasmai vā ādatte tam kārakam apādāna saññam hoti  tam yathā gāmāḥ apenti munayaḥ nagarāḥ niggataḥ rājā corāḥ bhayam jāyate ācariya upajjhāyehi sikkham gaṇhāti sisso  apādānam iccanena kvatthaḥ apādāne pañcamī  dhātunā mānam upasagga yogāt vīsu api ca
translated: because of going, because of coming, because of being, because of being born,

original: Dhātunāmānaṃ payoge ca upasaggayogādīsvapi ca taṃ kārakaṃ apādānasaññaṃ hoti.
analyzed: dhātu nāmānam payoge ca upasagga yoga ādīsu api ca tam kārakam apādāna saññam hoti
translated: because of being made, because of being done, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because of being made to be, because of being made to do, because

original: Dhātūnaṃ payoge tāva jiiccetassa dhātussa parāpubbassa payoge yo asaho, so apādānasañño hoti.
analyzed: dhātūnam payoge tāva dhātussa parāpubbassa payoge yaḥ asahaḥ saḥ apādāna sañño hoti
translated: As regards the use of the words dhātu, etc., in the expression “from the Buddha” the word “from” is the word of separation.

analyzed: tam yathā parājenti añña titthiyā
translated: As in the case of the expression “the sectarians separated from the Buddha.”

original: Bhūiccetassa dhātussa papubbassa payoge yato acchinnappabhavo, so apādānasañño hoti.
analyzed: dhātussa pa pubbassa payoge yatas acchinna pabhavaḥ saḥ apādāna saññaḥ hoti
translated: As regards the use of the words bhū, etc., in the expression “from the Himalayas” the word “from” is the word of origin.

original: Taṃ yathā? Himavatā pabhavanti pañca mahānadiyo, anavatattamhā pabhavanti mahāsarā, aciravatiyā pabhavanti kunnadiyo.
analyzed: tam yathā himavatā pabhavanti pañca mahā nadiyaḥ pabhavanti mahā sarāḥ aciravatiyā pabhavanti kunnadiyaḥ
translated: As in the case of the expression “the five great rivers have their origin in the Himalayas,” “the great lakes have their origin in the Anavatatta,” “the streams have their origin in the Aciravatī.”

analyzed: nāma ppayoge pi tam kārakam apādāna saññam hoti
translated: In the expression “born of the breast” the word “of” is the word of separation.

original: Taṃ yathā? Urasmā jāto putto, bhūmito niggato raso, ubhato sujāto putto mātito ca pitito ca.
analyzed: tam yathā urasmā jātaḥ puttaḥ bhūmitaḥ niggataḥ rasaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ puttaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca
translated: As in the case of the expression “the son born of the breast,” “the juice extracted from the earth,” “the son well-born on both sides, on the mother’s side and on the father’s side.”

analyzed: upasagga yoge tam kārakam apādāna saññam hoti
translated: In the expression “coming from the village” the word “from” is the word of separation.

original: Taṃ yathā? Apasālāya āyanti vāṇijā, ābrahmalokā saddo abbhuggacchati upari pabbatā
analyzed: tam yathā apasālāya āyanti vāṇijāḥ ābrahmalokā saddaḥ abbhuggacchati upari pabbatā
translated: As in the case of the expression “the merchants came from the village,” “the sound arose from the Brahmā-world,” “from the top of the mountain,”

original: devo vassati, buddhasmā pati sāriputto dhammadesanāya bhikkhū ālapati temāsaṃ, ghatamassa
analyzed: devaḥ vassati buddhasma pati sāriputto dhamma desanāya bhikkhū ālapati temāsam ghatamassa
translated: “the rain fell from the sky,” “Sāriputta spoke to the bhikkhus about the Buddha’s teaching for three months,” “the pot is broken.”

original: telasmā pati dadāti, uppalamassa padumasmā pati dadāti, kanakamassa hiraññasmā pati dadāti.
analyzed: telasmai pati dadāti uppalamassa padumasmai pati dadāti kanakamassa hiraññasmai pati dadāti
translated: He gives a lamp to him, he gives a lotus to him, he gives gold to him.

original: Ādiggahaṇena kārakamajjhepi pañcamīvibhatti hoti. Ito pakkhasmā vijjhati migaṃ luddako, kosā vijjhati kuñjaraṃ, māsasmā bhuñjati bhojanaṃ.
analyzed: ādi ggahaṇena kāraka majjhe pi pañcamī vibhatti hoti itas pakkhasmā vijjhati migam luddakaḥ kosā vijjhati kuñjaram māsasmā bhuñjati bhojanam
translated: The fifth case is also used in the middle of a compound beginning with a preposition: “The hunter goes out for deer from here,” “The goad goes into the elephant,” “He eats food from the month.”

original: Apiggahaṇena nipātapayogepi pañcamīvibhatti hoti dutiyā ca tatiyā ca. Rahitā mātujā🔽puññaṃ katvā dānaṃ deti, rahitā mātujaṃ, rahitā mātujena vā. Rite saddhammā kuto
analyzed: apiggahaṇena nipāta payoge pi pañcamī vibhatti hoti dutiyā ca tatiyā ca rahitā mātu jā  puññam katvā dānam deti rahitā mātu jam rahitā mātu jena vā rite saddhammā kutas
translated: The fifth case is also used in a compound beginning with a preposition and ending with a preposition, and the second and third cases are also used: “Free from mother’s relatives,” “Free from mother’s relatives,” “Free from mother’s relatives.”🔽“Having made merit, he gives a gift,” “Free from mother’s relatives,” “Free from mother’s relatives.” “How can one obtain happiness without the true Dhamma?”

original: sukhaṃ labhati, rite saddhammaṃ, rite saddhammena vā. Te bhikkhū nānā kulā pabbajitā,🔽vinā saddhammā natthañño koci nātho loke vijjati, vinā saddhammaṃ, vinā saddhammena
analyzed: sukham labhati rite saddhammam rite saddhammena vā te bhikkhū nānā kulā pabbajitā  vinā saddhammā na tthaññaḥ koci nāthaḥ loke vijjati vinā saddhammam vinā saddhammena
translated: “Without the true Dhamma,” “Without the true Dhamma.” “Those monks are of various families,”

original: vā. Vinā buddhasmā, vinā buddhaṃ, vinā buddhena vā.
analyzed: vā vinā buddhasmai vinā buddham vinā buddhena vā
translated: “Without the true Dhamma, there is no other protector found in the world,” “Without the true Dhamma,” “Without the true Dhamma.” “Without the Buddha,” “Without the Buddha,” “Without the Buddha.”

original: Caggahaṇena aññatthāpi pañcamīvibhatti hoti. Yatohaṃ bhagini ariyāya jātiyā jāto.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena aññattha api pañcamī vibhatti hoti yatas ham bhagini ariyāya jātiyā jātaḥ
translated: The fifth case is also used elsewhere beginning with a preposition: “From the time, sister, that I was born into the noble birth,”

original: Yato sarāmi attānaṃ, yato pattosmi viññutaṃ, yatvādhikaraṇamenaṃ cakkhundriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ
analyzed: yatas sarāmi attānam yatas pattaḥ asmi viññutam yatvā adhikaraṇam enam cakkhu indriyam a saṃvutam
translated: because of which, if this eye faculty were left unrestrained,

original: viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāsaveyyuṃ.🔽273, 310. Rakkhaṇatthānamicchitaṃ.
analyzed: viharantam abhijjhā domanassāḥ pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ anvāsaveyyuṃ  rakkhaṇa tthānam icchitam
translated: evil unwholesome states of covetousness and grief might invade me,🔽the intended restraint is for the purpose of protection.

original: Rakkhaṇatthānaṃ dhātūnaṃ payoge yaṃ icchitaṃ, taṃ kārakaṃ apādānasaññaṃ hoti.
analyzed: rakkhaṇa atthānam dhātūnam payoge yam icchitam tam kārakam apādāna saññam hoti
translated: The instrument in the effort to protect the elements, which is intended, is the ablative case.

original: Kāke rakkhanti taṇḍulā, yavā paṭisedhenti gāvo.
analyzed: kāke rakkhanti taṇḍulāḥ yavāḥ paṭisedhenti gāvaḥ
translated: Rice is protected from crows, barley is guarded from cows.

analyzed: yena vā dassanam
translated: , . Or by which there is seeing.

original: Yena vā adassanamicchitaṃ, taṃ kārakaṃ apādānasaññaṃ hoti.
analyzed: yena vā a dassanam icchitam tam kārakam apādāna saññam hoti
translated: The instrument by which non-seeing is intended is the ablative case.

original: Upajjhāyā antaradhāyati sisso, mātarā ca pitarā ca antaradhāyati putto.
analyzed: upajjhāyā antaradhāyati sissaḥ mātarā ca pitarā ca antaradhāyati putto
translated: The pupil disappears from the preceptor, the son disappears from the mother and father.

original: Vāti kimatthaṃ? Sattamīvibhatyattaṃ. Jetavane antaradhāyati bhagavā.
analyzed: vāti kimattham jetavane antaradhāyati bhagavā
translated: What is the purpose of the locative case? The locative case is the seventh case. The Blessed One disappears in Jeta’s Wood.

original: 275, 312. Dūranti kaddha kāla nimmāna tvālopa disāyogavibhattārappayoga suddhappamocana hetu vivittappamāṇa pubbayogabandhana guṇavacana pañha kathana thokākattūsu ca.
translated: , . Far, near, time, creation, portion, direction, connection, separation, effort, purification, release, cause, solitude, measure, prior effort, bond, quality, question, statement, little, and so on.

original: Dūratthe, antikatthe, addhanimmāne, kālanimmāne, tvālope, disāyoge, vibhatte, ārappayoge,🔽suddhe, pamocane, hetvatthe, vivittatthe, pamāṇe, pubbayoge, bandhanatthe, guṇavacane,
analyzed: dūra atthe antika atthe addha nimmāne kāla nimmāne tu ā lope disā yoge vibhatte āra ppa yoge  suddhe pamocane hetu atthe vivitta atthe pamāṇe pubba yoge bandhana tthe guṇavacane
translated: In the case of farness, nearness, half-measure, time-measure, in the case of a mere indication, in the case of a direction, in the case of a case-ending, in the case of a preposition,

original: pañhe, kathane, thoke, akattari ca iccetesvatthesu, payogesu ca, taṃ kārakaṃ apādānasaññaṃ hoti.🔽Dūratthetāva – kīva dūro ito naḷakāragāmo, dūrato vā gamma, ārakā te moghapurisā🔽imasmā dhammavinayā. Dutiyā ca tatiyā ca, dūraṃ gāmaṃ āvato, dūrena gāmena vā āgato.🔽Ārakā imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, anena dhammavinayena vā iccevamādi.🔽Antikatthe – antikaṃ gāmā, āsannaṃ gāmā, samīpaṃ gāmā, samīpaṃ saddhammā. Dutiyā
analyzed: pañhe kathane thoke a kattari ca payogesu ca tam kārakam apādāna saññam hoti  kīva dūraḥ itas naḷakāra gāmaḥ dūratas vā te mogha purisā  imasmai dhamma vinayā dutiyā ca tatiyā ca dūram gāmaṃ āvataḥ dūrena gāmena vā āgato  ārakāḥ imam dhamma vinayam anena dhamma vinayena vā icca evamādi  antika atthe antikam gāmā āsannam gāmā samīpam gāmā samīpam saddhammā dutiyā
translated: in the case of a pure, in the case of a release, in the case of a reason, in the case of a separation, in the case of a measure, in the case of a prior-concord, in the case of a bond, in the case of a quality,

original: ca tatiyā ca, antikaṃ gāmaṃ, antikaṃ gāmena vā. Āsannaṃ gāmaṃ, āsannaṃ gāmena vā.
analyzed: ca tatiyā ca antikam gāmam antikam gāmena vā āsannam gāmam āsannam gāmena vā
translated: in the case of a question, in the case of a statement, in the case of a little, in the case of a non-doer, in these meanings and in the usages, that is a karaka with the name of an ablative.

original: Samīpaṃ gāmaṃ. Samīpaṃ gāmena vā. Samīpaṃ saddhammaṃ, samīpaṃ saddhammena vā iccevamādi.
analyzed: samīpam gāmam samīpam gāmena vā samīpam saddhammam samīpam saddhammena vā icca evamādi
translated: In the vicinity of a village: in the vicinity of a village, or with a village. In the vicinity of the true Dhamma: in the vicinity of the true Dhamma, or with the true Dhamma.

original: Addhanimmāne – ito mathurāya catūsu yojanesu saṅkassaṃ nāma nagaraṃ atthi, tattha bahū janā vasanti iccevamādi.
analyzed: addhanimmāne itas mathurāya catūsu yojanesu saṅkassam nāma nagaram atthi tattha bahū janāḥ vasanti icca evamādi
translated: In the case of a creation of distance: in the four yojanas from Mathura to Sankassa there are many people living.

original: Kālanimmāne – ito bhikkhave ekanavutikappe vipassī nāma bhagavā loke udapādi, ito tiṇṇaṃ māsānaṃ accayena parinibbāyissati iccevamādi.
analyzed: kāla nimmāne itas bhikkhave ekanavuti kappe vipassī nāma bhagavā loke udapādi itas tiṇṇam māsānam accayena parinibbāyissati icca evamādi
translated: In the case of a creation of time: ninety-one aeons ago, monks, the Lord named Vipassi arose in the world; in three months’ time he will attain final Nibbana.

original: Tvālope kammādhikaraṇesu – pāsādā saṅkameyya, pāsādaṃ abhiruhitvā vā. Pabbatā saṅkameyya,
analyzed: tu ālope kamma adhikaraṇesu pāsādā saṅkameyya pāsādam abhiruhitvā vā pabbatā saṅkameyya
translated: In the case of the verbal root kma meaning ‘to make an effort’: one should make an effort from a palace, or having mounted a palace. One should make an effort from a mountain,

original: pabbataṃ abhiruhitvā vā. Hatthikkhandhā saṅkameyya, hatthikkhandhaṃ abhiruhitvā vā.
analyzed: pabbatam abhiruhitvā vā hatthi khandhā saṅkameyya hatthi khandham abhiruhitvā vā
translated: or having mounted a mountain. One should make an effort from the back of an elephant, or having mounted the back of an elephant.

original: Āsanā vuṭṭhaheyya. Āsane nisīditvā vā iccevamādi.
analyzed: āsanā vuṭṭhaheyya āsane nisīditvā vā iti evamādi
translated: One should rise from one’s seat, or having sat down in one’s seat.

original: Disāyoge – avicito yāva uparibhavaggamantare bahū sattanikāyā vasanti, yato khemaṃ
analyzed: disā yoge avicitaḥ yāva upari bha vaggam antare bahū satta nikāyāḥ vasanti yatas
translated: In the case of a conjunction of directions: in the space between the Avici hell and the highest realm of becoming there are many kinds of beings living.

original: tato bhayaṃ, puratthimato, dakkhiṇato, pacchimato, uttarato aggī pajjalanti, yato
analyzed: tatas bhayam puratthimatas dakkhiṇatas pacchimatas uttaratas aggī pajjalanti yatas
translated: Then fear from the east, from the south, from the west, from the north, fires break out, from which

original: assosuṃ bhagavantaṃ, uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā iccevamādi.
analyzed: assosum bhagavantam uddham pāda talāḥ adho kesamatthakāḥ icc evamādi
translated: they heard of the Blessed One, from the soles of the feet upwards, from the hair of the head downwards, and so on.

original: Vibhatte – yato paṇītataro vā visiṭṭhataro vā natthi. Chaṭṭhī ca, channavutīnaṃ pāsaṇḍānaṃ, dhammānaṃ pavaraṃ yadidaṃ sugatavinayo iccevamādi.🔽Ārappayoge – gāmadhammā vasaladhammā asaddhammā ārati virati paṭivirati, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī iccevamādi.
analyzed: vibhatte yatas paṇītataraḥ vā visiṭṭhataraḥ vā natthi chaṭṭhī ca channavutīnam pāsaṇḍānam dhammānam pavaram yat idam sugata vinayaḥ icca evamādi  āra ppayoge gāma dhammāḥ vasala dhammāḥ asat dhammāḥ ārati virati paṭivirati pāṇa atipātā veramaṇī icca evamādi
translated: In the sixth case: ‘There is nothing higher or more excellent than this’ . And the sixth case: ‘The most excellent of the six heretical teachers’ doctrines is the doctrine of the Blessed One’ .🔽In the seventh case: ‘Village-dhamma, low-life-dhamma, false-dhamma, discontent, abstinence, abstention, abstention from killing breathing things’ .

original: Suddhe – lobhaniyehi dhammehi suddho asaṃsaṭṭho, mātito ca pitito ca suddho asaṃsaṭṭho anupakuddho agarahito iccevamādi.
analyzed: suddhe lobhaniyehi dhammehi suddhaḥ asaṃsaṭṭhaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca suddhaḥ asaṃsaṭṭhaḥ anupakuddhaḥ a garahitaḥ icca evamādi
translated: In the eighth case: ‘He is pure, unadulterated, by things that are a ground for greed, he is pure, unadulterated, by mother and father, uncensured, unblamed’ .

original: Pamocane – parimutto dukkhasmāti vadāmi, muttosmi mārabandhanā, na te muccanti maccunā iccevamādi.
analyzed: pamocane parimuttaḥ dukkhasma ati vadāmi muttaḥ asmi māra bandhanā na te muccanti maccunā icca evamādi
translated: In the ninth case: ‘I say he is released from suffering, I am released from Mara’s bonds, they are not released from death’ .

original: Hetvatthe – kasmā hetunā, kena hetunā, kissa hetunā, kasmā nu tumhaṃ daharā na mīyare, kasmā idheva maraṇaṃ bhavissati iccevamādi.
analyzed: hetu atthe kasmai hetunā kena hetunā kissa hetunā kasmai nu tumham daharāḥ na mīyare kasmai idha iva maraṇam bhavissati icc evamādi
translated: In the sense of cause: why by what cause, for what cause, why is it that you do not die young? why will death be here? In this way, etc.

original: Vivittatthe – vivitto pāpakā dhammā, vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi iccevamādi.
analyzed: vivitta atthe vivittaḥ pāpakāḥ dhammāḥ vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi icca evamādi
translated: In the sense of seclusion: secluded from unprofitable ideas, secluded from sensual desires, secluded from unprofitable ideas. In this way, etc.

original: Pamāṇe – dīghaso navavidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā pamāṇikā kāretabbā, majjhimassa purisassa aḍḍha teḷasahatthā iccevamādi.
analyzed: pamāṇe sugata vidatthiyā pamāṇikā kāretabbā majjhimassa purisassa icca evamādi
translated: In the sense of measure: nine fingerbreadths long by the breadth of a sugata-fingerbreadth, twelve cubits long for a man of medium height. In this way, etc.

analyzed: pubba yoge pubbā iva sammodhā icca evamādi
translated: In the sense of previous association: having first exchanged greetings. In this way, etc.

original: Bandhanatthe – satasmā bandho naro. Tatiyā ca, satena bandho naro raññā iṇatthena iccevamādi.
analyzed: bandhana atthe satasmā bandho naro tatiyā ca satena bandho naro raññā iṇ atthena iti ca evamādi
translated: In the sense of bondage: a man is bound by a hundred fetters. And in the third case: a man is bound by a hundred fetters. The king is bound by the fetter of debt. In this way, etc.

original: Guṇavacane – puññāya sugatiṃ yanti, cāgāya vipulaṃ dhanaṃ, paññāya vimuttimano, issariyāya janaṃ rakkhati rājā iccevamādi.
analyzed: guṇavacane puññāya sugatim yanti cāgāya vipulam dhanam paññāya vimutti manaḥ issariyāya janam rakkhati rājā icca evamādi
translated: In the sense of quality: for merit they go to a good destination, for generosity great wealth, for understanding the mind is freed, for sovereignty the king protects the people. In this way, etc.

original: Pañhe tvālope kammādhikaraṇesu – abhidhammā pucchanti, abhidhammaṃ sutvā, abhidhamme
analyzed: pañhe tu ālope kamma adhikaraṇesu abhidhammā pucchanti abhidhammam sutvā abhidhamme
translated: In the sense of question, in the sense of inquiry, in the sense of action, in the sense of legal case: they ask about the Abhidhamma, having heard the Abhidhamma, the Abhidhamma

original: ṭhatvā vā. Vinayā pucchanti, vinayaṃ sutvā, vinaye ṭhatvā vā. Dutiyā ca tatiyā ca,
analyzed: ṭhatvā vā vinayā pucchanti vinayam sutvā vinaye ṭhatvā vā dutiyā ca tatiyā ca
translated: or having stood. They ask the Vinaya, having heard the Vinaya, or having stood in the Vinaya. And the second and the third.

original: abhidhammaṃ, abhidhammena vā. Vinayaṃ, vinayena vā. Eva suttā, geyyā, gāthāya, veyyākaraṇā,
analyzed: abhidhammam abhidhammena vā vinayam vinayena vā eva suttāḥ geyyāḥ gāthāya veyyākaraṇā
translated: The Abhidhamma, or by the Abhidhamma. The Vinaya, or by the Vinaya. Thus the discourses, the verses, the explanations, the birth-stories,

original: udānā, itivuttakā, jātakā, abbhutadhammā, vedallā iccevamādi.
analyzed: udānāḥ itivuttakāḥ jātakāḥ abbhutadhammāḥ vedallāḥ icca evamādi
translated: the amazing truths, the panegyrics, and so on.

original: Kathane tvālope kammādhikaraṇesu – abhidhammā kathayanti, abhidhammaṃ sutvā, abhidhamme
analyzed: kathane tu ālope kamma adhikaraṇesu abhidhammā kathayanti abhidhammam sutvā abhidhamme
translated: But in the legal issues arising out of business, in the discussion—they discuss the Abhidhamma, having heard the Abhidhamma, or having stood in the Abhidhamma.

original: ṭhatvā vā. Vinayā kathayanti, vinayaṃ sutvā, vinaye ṭhatvā vā. Dutiyā ca tatiyā ca,
analyzed: vā kathayanti vinayam sutvā vinaye ṭhatvā vā dutiyā ca tatiyā ca
translated: They discuss the Vinaya, having heard the Vinaya, or having stood in the Vinaya. And the second and the third.

original: abhidhammaṃ, abhidhammena vā. Vinayaṃ vinayena vā. Evaṃ suttā, geyyā, gāthāya, veyyākaraṇā,
analyzed: abhidhammam abhidhammena vā vinayam vinayena vā evam suttāḥ geyyāḥ gāthāya veyyākaraṇā
translated: The Abhidhamma, or by the Abhidhamma. The Vinaya, or by the Vinaya. Thus the discourses, the verses, the explanations, the birth-stories,

original: udānā, itivuttakā, jātakā, abbhutadhammā, vedallā iccevamādi.
analyzed: udānāḥ itivuttakāḥ jātakāḥ abbhutadhammāḥ vedallāḥ icca evamādi
translated: the amazing truths, the panegyrics, and so on.

original: Thoke – thokā muccanti. Appamattakā muccanti, kicchā muccanti. Tatiyā ca. Thokena, appamattakena, kicchena vā iccevamādi.
analyzed: thoke  thokāḥ muccanti appamattakāḥ muccanti kicchāḥ muccanti tatiyā ca thokena appamattakena kicchena vā icca evamādi
translated: In the little—they are released in the little. They are released in the small, they are released with difficulty. And the third. In the little, in the small, in the difficult, and so on.

original: Akattarica – kammassa katattā upacitattā ussannattā vipulattā cakkhuviññāṇaṃ uppannaṃ hoti iccevamādi.
analyzed: kammassa kata ttā upacita ttā ussanna ttā vipula ttā cakkhu viññāṇam uppannam hoti icc evamādi
translated: and non-doing is the non-doing of the action, the non-accumulation, the non- swelling, the non-expansion, when eye-consciousness has arisen.

original: Caggahaṇena sesesupi ye mayā nopadiṭṭhā apādānapayogikā, te payogavicakkhaṇehi yathāyogaṃ yojetabbā.🔽276, 302. Yassa dātukāmo rocate dhārayate vā taṃ sampadānaṃ.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena sesesu pi ye mayā na upadiṭṭhāḥ apādāna payogikā te payoga vicakkhaṇehi yathāyogam yojetabbā  yassa dātu kāmaḥ rocate dhārayate vā tam sampadānam
translated: By the mention of the doing, the rest that are not shown by me as the means of taking what is not given should be construed by those who are skilled in the means of action as appropriate.🔽The giving is the giving, the approving, the bearing of what one wishes to give, what one approves, what one bears.

original: Yassa vā dātukāmo yassa vārocate, yassa vā dhārayate, taṃ kārakaṃ sampadānasaññaṃ hoti.
analyzed: yassa vā dātu kāmaḥ yassa vā ārocate yassa vā dhārayate tam kārakam sampadāna saññam hoti
translated: Or the doing is the giving, the approving, the bearing of what one wishes to give, what one approves, what one bears.

original: Samaṇassa cīvaraṃ dadāti, samaṇassa rocate saccaṃ, devadattassa suvaṇṇacchattaṃ dhārayate yaññadatto.
analyzed: samaṇassa cīvaram dadāti samaṇassa rocate saccam devadattassa suvaṇṇa chattam dhārayate yaññadattaḥ
translated: He gives robe-cloth to the recluse, he approves the truth, he bears the golden parasol for Devadatta, Yaññadatta.

analyzed: sampadānam iccanena kvatthaḥ sampadāne catutthī
translated: What is the purpose of the expression of giving? The fourth case is in giving.

original: Vāti vikappanatthaṃ, dhātunāmānaṃ payoge vā upasaggappayoge vā nipātappayoge vā sati atthavikappanatthaṃ vāti padaṃ payujjati.
analyzed: vā ati vikappana attham dhātu nāmānam payoge vā upasagga ppayoge vā nipāta ppayoge vā sati attha vikappana attham vā ati padam payujjati
translated: The word is used for the purpose of construing the meaning when there is a use of a noun, or a use of a prefix, or a use of a particle.

original: 277, 303. Silāgha hanu ṭhā sapa dhāra piha kudha duhissosūya rādhikkha paccāsuṇa
analyzed: silāgha hanu ṭhā sapa dhāra piha kudha duhissa usūya rādhikkha paccāsuṇa
translated: Sīlaghāna, ṭhāna, sapa, dhāra, piha, kudha, duhissosūya, rādhikka, pacchāsuṇa

original: anupatigiṇa pubbakattārocanattha tadattha tumatthālamattha maññānādarappāṇini, gatyatthakammani,
analyzed: anu pa ti giṇa pubba kattā rocanattha tadattha tumattha alamattha maññāna ādara ppāṇini gati attha kammani
translated: 277, 303. In the case of the roots silāgha, hanu, ṭhā, sapa, dhāra, piha, kudha, duha, issa, rādhik, paccāsuṇā, anupatigati, pubbakattā, ārocanattha, tadattha, tumattha, alamattha, maññati, anādara, appāṇini, gatyattha, kammani,

original: āsīsattha sammuti bhiyya sattamyatthesu ca.🔽Silāgha hanu ṭhā sapa dhāra piha kudha duha issaiccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ payoge, usūyatthānañca🔽payoge, rādhikkhappayoge, paccāsuṇaanupatigiṇānaṃ pubbakattari, ārocanatthe, tadatthe,
analyzed: āsīsattha sammuti bhiyya sattamī atthesu ca  silāgha hanu ṭhā sapa dhāra piha kudha duha dhātūnam payoge usūyatthānam ca  payoge rādhikkha ppayoge pacca āsuṇa anu pati giṇānam pubba kattari ārocana atthe tad atthe
translated: āsīsa, sammuti, bhiyya, sattamyattha, the nominative case is called the sampadanakāraka.

original: tumatthe, alamatthe, maññatippayoge anādare appāṇini, gatyatthānaṃ dhātūnaṃ kammani,
analyzed: tum atthe alam atthe mañña ti payoge an ādare ap pāṇini gati atthānam dhātūnam kammani
translated: In the case of the roots silāgha, hanu, ṭhā, sapa, dhāra, piha, kudha, duha, issa, rādhik, paccāsuṇā, anupatigati, pubbakattā, ārocanattha, tadattha, tumattha, alamattha, maññati, anādara, appāṇini, gatyattha, kammani,

original: āsīsatthe ca sammuti bhiyya sattamyatthesu ca, taṃ kārakaṃ sampadānasaññaṃ hoti.
analyzed: āsīsatthe ca sammuti bhiyya sattamī atthesu ca tam kārakam sampadāna saññam hoti
translated: āsīsa, sammuti, bhiyya, sattamyattha, the nominative case is called the sampadanakāraka.

original: Silāghappayoge tāva – buddhassa silāghate, dhammassa silāghate, saṅghassa silāghate, sakaṃupajjhāyassa silāghate, tava silāghate mama silāghate iccevamādi.
analyzed: silāgha ppayoge tāva buddhassa silāghate dhammassa silāghate saṅghassa silāghate sakaṃupajjhāyassa silāghate tava silāghate mama silāghate icca evamādi
translated: As regards the “stone-throwing” method: “A stone for the Enlightened One,” “A stone for the Dhamma,” “A stone for the Community,” “A stone for my own preceptor,” “A stone for you,” “A stone for me,” and so on.

original: Hanuppayoge – hanute tuyhameva, hanute mayhameva iccevamādi.
analyzed: hanuppayoge hanute tuyham eva hanute mayham eva iti evamādi
translated: As regards the “killing” method: “You are killed,” “I am killed,” and so on.

original: Ṭhāpayoge – upatiṭṭheyya sakyaputtānaṃ vaḍḍhakī, bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭheyya bhikkhunī iccevamādi.
analyzed: upatiṭṭheyya sakyaputtānam vaḍḍhakī bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭheyya bhikkhunī icc evamādi
translated: As regards the “standing-by” method: “He would stand by the Sakyan disciples’ builder,” “A bhikkhunī would stand by a bhikkhu eating to give him drinking water or fan him,” and so on.

original: Sapappayoge – tuyhaṃ sapate, mayhaṃ sapate iccevamādi.
analyzed: sapa ppayoge tuyham sapate mayham sapate iti ca evamādi
translated: As regards the “having-a-share” method: “You have a share,” “I have a share,” and so on.

analyzed: dhāra ppayoge suvaṇṇam te dhārayate icca evamādi
translated: As regards the “bearing” method: “Gold is borne by you,” and so on.

original: Pihappayoge – buddhassa aññatitthiyā pihayanti, devā dassanakāmā te, yato icchāmi bhaddantassa, samiddhānaṃ pihayanti daliddā iccevamādi.
analyzed: buddhassa añña titthiyā pihayanti devāḥ dassana kāmā te yatas icchāmi bhaddantassa samiddhānam pihayanti daliddāḥ icca evamādi
translated: As regards the “longing” method: “The sectarians long for the Enlightened One,” “The gods are eager to see you,” “Since I want, venerable sir,” “The poor long for the rich,” and so on.

original: Kudhaduhaissausūyappayoge – kodhayati deva dattassa, tassa kujjha mahāvīra, mā raṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: kodhayati deva dattassa tassa kujjha mahāvīra mā raṭṭham
translated: As regards the “anger-hate-displeasure” method: “He angers, god, the giver,” “He hates, great hero,” “Do not be angry,

original: vinassa idaṃ. Duhayati disānaṃ megho, titthiyā samaṇānaṃ issayanti guṇagiddhena,
analyzed: vinasse idam duhayati disānam meghaḥ titthiyā samaṇānam issayanti guṇa giddhena
translated: This is lost. The cloud of the directions is weeping, the sectarians of the ascetics are envious through being intoxicated with their own qualities,

original: titthiyā samaṇānaṃ issayanti lābhagiddhena, dujjanā guṇavantānaṃ usūyanti guṇagiddhena,
analyzed: titthiyā samaṇānam issayanti lābha giddhena dujjanāḥ guṇavantānam usūyanti guṇa giddhena
translated: the sectarians of the ascetics are envious through being intoxicated with their own gains, bad people of the virtuous are jealous through being intoxicated with their own qualities,

analyzed: kā usūyā vijānatam id ca evamādi
translated: what is jealousy of those who know? thus and so on.

original: Rādha ikkha iccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ payoge yassa akathitassa pucchanaṃ kammavikkhyāpanatthañca, taṃ kārakaṃ sampadānasaññaṃ hoti, dutiyā ca.
analyzed: rādhaḥ ikkhaḥ iti ca etesam dhātūnam payoge yassa a kathitassa pucchanam kamma vikkhyāpana attham ca tam kārakam sampadāna saññam hoti dutiyā ca
translated: Rādha ikkha iccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ payoge yassa akathitassa pucchanaṃ kammavikkhyāpanatthañca, taṃ kārakaṃ sampadānasaññaṃ hoti, dutiyā ca.

original: Ārādhohaṃ rañño, ārādhohaṃ rājānaṃ, kyāhaṃ ayyānaṃ aparajjhāmi, kyāhaṃ ayye aparajjhāmi,
analyzed: ārādhaḥ uham raññaḥ ārādhaḥ uham rājānam kyā aham ayyānam aparajjhāmi kyā aham ayye aparajjhāmi
translated: I am pleased with the King, I am pleased with the King, what do I offend against the masters, what do I offend against the lady,

original: cakkhuṃ janassa dassanāya taṃ viya maññe, āyasmato upālittherassa upasampadāpekkho
analyzed: cakkhum janassa dassanāya tam viya maññe āyasmataḥ upāli ttherassa upasampada apekkho
translated: as if the eye is for the seeing of the people, thus it seems, the one who is seeking higher ordination from the Elder Thera Upāli,

analyzed: upatisso āyasmantam vai iti evamādi
translated: Upatissa, the venerable one or thus and so on.

original: Paccāsuṇa anupatigiṇānaṃ pubbakattari suṇotissa paccāyoge yassa kammuno pubbassa yo kattā, so sampadānasañño hoti.
analyzed: pacca a suṇa anu pa ti giṇānam pubba kattari suṇotissa pacca āyoge yassa kammunaḥ pubbassa yaḥ kattā saḥ sampadāna saññaḥ hoti
translated: Paccāsuṇa anupatigiṇānaṃ pubbakattari suṇotissa paccāyoge yassa kammuno pubbassa yo kattā, so sampadānasañño hoti.

analyzed: tam yathā bhagavā bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: That is how? The Fortunate One said this to the monks.

original: Bhikkhūti akathīta kammaṃ, etanti kathitakammaṃ. Yassa kammuno pubbassa yo kattā,
analyzed: bhikkhu iti a kathīta kammam etat ti kathita kammam yassa kammunaḥ pubbassa yaḥ kattā
translated: ‘Bhikkhu’ is the one who does not speak the action; ‘that’ is the one who speaks the action.🔽The one who does the action that is the first of the two actions

original: so‘bhagavā’ti “yo karoti sa kattā”ti suttavacanena kattusañño. Evaṃ yassa kammuno
analyzed: so bhagavā iti yaḥ karoti sa kattā ati sutta vacanena kattu saññaḥ evam yassa kammuno
translated: is the one who has the idea of the doer. Thus the one who does

original: pubbassa yo kattā, so sampadānasañño hoti.
analyzed: pubbassa yaḥ kattā so sampadāna saññaḥ hoti
translated: the action that is the first of the two actions has the idea of the one who makes the action complete.

original: Taṃ yathā? Te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ, āsuṇanti buddhassa bhikkhū.
analyzed: tam yathā te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ paccassosuṃ āsuṇanti buddhassa bhikkhū
translated: How is that? Those bhikkhus listened to the Lord, the bhikkhus listened to the Buddha.

original: Giṇassa anupatiyoge yassa kammuno pubbassa yo kattā, so sampadānasañño hoti.
analyzed: giṇassa anupatiyoge yassa kammuno pubbassa yaḥ kattā saḥ sampadāna saññaḥ hoti
translated: The one who does the action that is the first of the two actions has the idea of the one who makes the action complete.

original: Taṃ yathā? Bhikkhu janaṃ dhammaṃ sāveti, tassa bhikkhuno jano anugiṇāti, tassa bhikkhuno jano patigiṇāti.🔽Yo vadeti sa‘kattā’ti,
analyzed: tam yathā bhikkhu janam dhammam sāveti tassa bhikkhunaḥ janaḥ anugiṇāti tassa bhikkhunaḥ janaḥ patigiṇāti  yaḥ vadeti sakattā ati
translated: How is that? The bhikkhu teaches the Dhamma to people, people listen to that bhikkhu, people accept that bhikkhu.🔽The one who speaks is the doer.

analyzed: vuttam kamman ti vuccati
translated: What is said is called the action.

analyzed: yaḥ paṭiggāhakaḥ tassa
translated: The one who accepts it

analyzed: sampadānam vijāniyā
translated: should know as the one who makes the action complete.

analyzed: it ca evamādi
translated: Thus and so on.

original: Ārocanatthe – ārocayāmi vo bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo bhikkhave, ārocayāmi te mahārāja, āmantayāmi te mahārāja, paṭivedayāmi te mahārāja iccevamādi.
analyzed: ārocana atthe ārocayāmi vaḥ bhikkhave āmantayāmi vaḥ bhikkhave paṭivedayāmi vaḥ bhikkhave ārocayāmi te mahā rāja āmantayāmi te mahā rāja paṭivedayāmi te mahā rāja icca evamādi
translated: In the sense of announcing: “I announce to you, monks, I inform you, monks, I make known to you, monks. I announce to you, great king, I inform you, great king, I make known to you, great king.”

original: Tadatthe – ūnassa pāripūriyā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ. Buddhassa atthāya, dhammassa atthāya, saṅghassa atthāya, jīvitaṃ pariccajāmi iccevamādi.
analyzed: tad atthe ūnassa pāripūriyā tam cīvaram nikkhipitabbam buddhassa atthāya dhammassa atthāya saṅghassa atthāya jīvitam pariccajāmi icca evamādi
translated: In the sense of for the sake of that: “That robe should be put aside for the sake of making up the deficiency. I give up my life for the sake of the Buddha, for the sake of the Dhamma, for the sake of the Sangha.”

original: Tumatthe -lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ buddho loke uppajjati. Bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya vinayo paññatto iccevamādi.🔽Alamatthappayoge-alamiti arahati paṭikkhittesu. Alaṃ me buddho, alaṃ me rajjaṃ, alaṃ
analyzed: tumun atthe loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam buddhaḥ loke uppajjati bhikkhūnam phāsu vihārāya vinayo paññatto icc evamādi  alam attha payoge alam iti arahati paṭikkhittesu alam me buddhaḥ alam me rajjam alam
translated: In the sense of sufficiency: “For the sake of the world’s welfare, for the sake of compassion for beings, for the sake of maturing beings, the Buddha arises in the world. The training rules are laid down for the bhikkhus’ ease, for the comfort of the Sangha.”

original: bhikkhu pattassa, alaṃ mallo mallassa, arahati mallo mallassa. Paṭikkhitte alaṃ te🔽rūpaṃ karaṇīyaṃ, alaṃ me hiraññasuvaṇṇena iccevamādi.
analyzed: bhikkhu pattassa alam mallaḥ mallassa arahati mallaḥ mallassa paṭikkhitte alam te 🔽rūpam karaṇīyam alam me hirañña suvaṇṇena icc evamādi
translated: In the sense of sufficiency in the sense of “enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough” in the sense of “I have had enough”

original: Maññatippayoge anādare appāṇini-kaṭṭhassa tuvaṃ maññe, kaliṅgarassa tuvaṃ maññe.
analyzed: mañña tippayoge anādare tuvam maññe kaliṅgarassa tuvam maññe
translated: In the case of the expression “he thinks” (maññati), the meaning is “you think of a piece of wood without sap” and “you think of a log of wood.”

original: Anādareti kimatthaṃ? Suvaṇṇaṃ viya taṃ maññe.
analyzed: anādara iti kimattham suvaṇṇam viya tam maññe
translated: In the case of the expression “without respect” (anādare), the meaning is “I think of him as if he were gold.”

original: Appāṇinīti kimatthaṃ? Gadrabhaṃ tuvaṃ maññe iccevamādi.
analyzed: appāṇinī iti kimattham gadrabham tuvam maññe icca evamādi
translated: In the case of the expression “without sap” (appāṇinī), the meaning is “you think of an ass.”

original: Gatyatthakammani-gāmassa pādena gato, nagarassa pādena gato, appo saggāya gacchati,🔽saggassa gamanena vā, mūlāya paṭikasseyya saṅgho. Dutiyā ca, gāmaṃ pādena gato, nagaraṃ
analyzed: gati attha kamma nigāmassa pādena gataḥ nagarassa pādena gataḥ appaḥ saggāya gacchati  saggassa gamanena vā mūlāya paṭikasseyya saṅghaḥ dutiyā ca gāmam pādena gataḥ nagaram
translated: In the case of the expression “in the sense of going” (gatyatthe), the meaning is “he has gone on foot to the village,” “he has gone on foot to the town,” “he goes to heaven,”🔽“by going to heaven,” “the Order would make amends to the root.” And again, the meaning is “he has gone on foot to the village,” “he has gone on foot to the town,”

original: pādena gato, appo saggaṃ gacchati, saggaṃ gamanena vā, mūlaṃ paṭikasseyya saṅgho iccevamādi.
analyzed: pādena gataḥ appo saggam gacchati saggam gamanena vā mūlam paṭikasseyya saṅghaḥ icca evamādi
translated: “he goes to heaven,” “by going to heaven,” “the Order would make amends to the root.”

original: Āsīsatthe-āyasmato dīghāyuko hotu, bhaddaṃ bhavato hotu, kusalaṃ bhavato hotu, anāmayaṃ
analyzed: dīgha āyukaḥ hotu bhaddam bhavataḥ hotu kusalam bhavataḥ hotu anāmayam
translated: In the case of the expression “in the sense of wishing” (āsīsatthe), the meaning is “May the venerable one live long,” “May there be good luck for you,” “May there be welfare for you,” “May there be health for you,”

original: bhavato hotu, sukhaṃ bhavato hotu, svāgataṃ bhavato hotu, attho bhavato hotu, hitaṃ🔽bhavato hotu iccevamādi.
analyzed: bhavataḥ hotu sukham bhavataḥ hotu svāgatam bhavataḥ hotu atthaḥ bhavataḥ hotu hitam 🔽bhavataḥ hotu id ca evamādi
translated: “May there be happiness for you,” “Welcome to you,” “May there be profit for you,” “May there be benefit for you.”

original: Sammutippayoge– aññatra saṅghasammutiyā bhikkhussa vippavatthuṃ na vaṭṭati, sādhu sammuti me tassa bhagavato dassanāya iccevamādi.
analyzed: sammuti ppayoge aññatra saṅgha sammutiyā bhikkhussa vippavatthum na vaṭṭati sādhu sammuti me tassa bhagavataḥ dassanāya icc evamādi
translated: In the sense of ‘agreement’ as in ‘agreement’ (sammuti) and ‘without the agreement of the Community’ (aññatra saṅghasammutiyā). It is not allowable for a monk to go on a journey without the agreement of the Community. It is good to have the agreement of the Community to see that Fortunate One.

analyzed: bhiyyappayoge iti ca evamādi
translated: In the sense of ‘more’ as in ‘more than’ (bhiyyoso) and so on.

original: Sattamyatthe – tuyhañcassa āvi karomi, tassa me sakko pāturahosi iccevamādi.
analyzed: sattamī atthe karomi tassa me sakko pātuḥ ahosi icca evamādi
translated: In the sense of the locative case as in ‘I will make it clear to you’ (tuyhañca assa āvi karomi) and ‘He appeared to me, Sakka’ (tassa me sakko pāturahosi).

analyzed: attha ggahaṇena bahūsu akkhara ppayogesu dissati
translated: It is seen in many verbal roots in the sense of the locative case.

original: Taṃ yathā? Upamaṃ mata karissāmi, dhammaṃ vo desessāmi.
analyzed: tam yathā upamam mata karissāmi dhammam vaḥ desessāmi
translated: How is that? I will make a simile, I will teach you the Dhamma.

original: Sāratthe ca – desetu bhante bhagavā dhammaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ. Tassa phāsu vihārāya hoti,
analyzed: sāra atthe ca desetu bhante bhagavā dhammam bhikkhūnam tassa phāsu vihārāya hoti
translated: And in the sense of the locative case as in ‘Let the Fortunate One teach the Dhamma to the monks, venerable Sir, it will be for their benefit and welfare for a long time’ (desetu bhante bhagavā dhammaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ. Tassa phāsu vihārāya hoti,

original: etassa pahiṇeyya, yathā no bhagavā byākareyya, tathāpi tesaṃ byākarissāma, kappati
analyzed: etassa pahiṇeyya yathā naḥ bhagavā byākareyya tathā api tesam byākarissāma kappati
translated: he should send it to him, just as the Fortunate One would explain it, so we will explain it to them, it is allowable

original: samaṇānaṃ āyogo, amhākaṃ maṇinā attho, kimattho me buddhena, seyyo me attho, bahūpakārā
analyzed: samaṇānam āyogaḥ amhākam maṇinā atthaḥ kimatthaḥ me buddhena seyyaḥ me atthaḥ bahu upakārā
translated: to give to the ascetics, we need a jewel, what is the use of a Buddha to me, my use is better, we are of much use,

original: bhante mahāpajā patigotamī bhagavato, bahūpakārā bhikkhave mātāpitaro puttānaṃ iccevamādi.
analyzed: bhante mahāpajā pati gotamī bhagavataḥ bahu upakārā bhikkhave mātā pitaraḥ puttānam icca evamādi
translated: “Venerable, Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī is a benefactor of the Blessed One’s, parents are a great help to their children” and so on.

original: Sesesu akkharappayogesupi aññepi payogā payogavicakkhaṇehi yojetabbā.
analyzed: sesesu akkhara ppayogesu pi aññe pi payogā payoga vicakkhaṇehi yojetabbā
translated: And in the other word-groups, other word-usages should be construed too by those skilled in word-usages.

original: Caggahaṇaṃ vikappanatthavāggahaṇānukaḍḍhanatthaṃ. Ye keci saddā sampadānappayogikā mayā nopadiṭṭhā, tesaṃ gahaṇatthaṃ idha vikappīyati vāsaddo.🔽Taṃ yathā? Bhikkhusaṅghassa pabhū ayaṃ bhagavā, desassa pabhū ayaṃ rājā. Khettassa
analyzed: ca ggahaṇam vikappana attha vāc gahaṇa anukaḍḍhana ttham ye keci saddāḥ sampadāna payogikāḥ mayā na upadiṭṭhā tesam gahaṇa attham idha vikappīyati vā saddaḥ  tam yathā bhikkhu saṅghassa pabhū ayam bhagavā desassa pabhū ayam rājā khettassa
translated: The mention of the first is for the purpose of including the mention of the meaning of the word-group. For the purpose of including the mention of those word-usages for the purpose of compounding that have not been demonstrated by me, the word vās is compounded here.🔽How is that? This Blessed One is the lord of the Community of Bhikkhus, this king is the lord of the country, this householder is the lord of the field, this hunter is the lord of the forest and so on.

original: pabhū ayaṃ gahapati, araññassa pabhū ayaṃ luddako iccevamādi. Kvaci dutiyā tatiyā
analyzed: pabhū ayam gahapati araññassa pabhū ayam luddako icc evamādi kvaci dutiyā tatiyā
translated: Sometimes in the second, third,

analyzed: pañcamī chaṭṭhī sattamī atthesu ca
translated: fifth, sixth, and seventh cases.

analyzed: yodhāraḥ tamaḥ kāsam
translated: The support is the place.

original: Yo ādhāro, taṃ okāsasaññaṃ hoti. Svādhāro catubbidho byāpiko, opasilesiko, vesayiko sāmīpiko cāti.
analyzed: yaḥ ādhāro tam okāsa saññam hoti su ādhāro catubbidhaḥ byāpikaḥ opasilesikaḥ vesayiko sāmīpiko ca ati
translated: That which is the support is the place-sign. The support is fourfold: the pervasive, the contaminating, the brothel-keeper, and the proximate.

original: Tattha byāpiko tāva–jalesu khīraṃ tiṭṭhati, tilesu telaṃ, ucchūsu raso.
analyzed: tattha byāpiko tāva jalesu khīram tiṭṭhati tilesu telam ucchūsu raso
translated: Herein, the pervasive is as follows: Milk stands in water, oil in sesamum seeds, juice in sugar-cane.

original: Opasilesiko–pariyaṅke rājā seti, āsane upaviṭṭho saṅgho.
analyzed: rājā seti āsane upaviṭṭhaḥ saṅghaḥ
translated: The king lies on a couch, the Order sits on seats.

original: Vesayiko–bhūmīsu manussā caranti, antalikkhe vāyū vāyanti. Ākāse sakuṇā pakkhandanti.
analyzed: vesayikobhūmīsu manussā caranti antalikkhe vāyū vāyanti ākāse sakuṇā pakkhandanti
translated: The king is in the city, men walk on the earth, the wind blows in the sky, birds fly in the air.

original: Sāmīpiko–vane hatthino caranti, gaṅgāyaṃ ghoso tiṭṭhati, vaje gāvo duhanti, sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane.
analyzed: sāmīpikovane hatthino caranti gaṅgā ayam ghosaḥ tiṭṭhati vaje gāvaḥ duhanti sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane
translated: Elephants walk in the forest, the sound of the river is in the Ganges, cows are milked in the pen, he lives in Savatthi in Jeta’s Wood.

analyzed: okāsam iccanena kvatthaḥ okāse sattamī
translated: When the meaning of “place” is intended, the locative case is used.

analyzed: yena vā tam karaṇam
translated: The place where something is done is the place of the action.
