translated: In a compound with a feminine noun, if the word for a woman is stated first, the word for a man should be taken. A brahmin girl, a khattiya maiden, a khattiya young woman.

original: Bhāsitapumeti kimatthaṃ? Khattiyabandhudārikā, brāhmaṇabandhudārikā.🔽333, 344. Attaṃ nassa tappurise.
analyzed: bhāsita pumā iti kimattham khattiya bandhu dārikā brāhmaṇa bandhu dārikā  attam nassa tappurise
translated: Why is the word bhāsita used? A girl who is a kinsman of a khattiya, a girl who is a kinsman of a brahmin.🔽The word attam is added to the word nassa in the masculine.

original: Nassa padassa tappurise uttarapade attaṃ hoti.
analyzed: nassa padassa tappurise uttara pade attam hoti
translated: The word attam is added to the word nassa in the masculine in the word that follows.

original: Nabrāhmaṇo abrāhmaṇo, avasalo, abhikkhu, apañcavassaṃ, apañcagavaṃ.
analyzed: na brāhmaṇaḥ a brāhmaṇaḥ a vasalaḥ a bhikkhu a pañca vassam a pañcagavam
translated: Not a brahmin, not a brahmin, not a low-caste person, not a monk, not less than five years, not less than five cows.

analyzed: sare ana
translated: The word ana is added to the word sare.

original: Nassa padassa tappurise ana ādeso hoti sare pare.
analyzed: nassa padassa tappurise anaḥ ādesaḥ hoti sare pare
translated: The word ana is added to the word nassa in the masculine in the word that follows, if the word sare is there.

original: Na asso anasso, anissaro, anariyo.🔽335, 346. Kada kussa.🔽Kuiccetassa kada hoti sare pare.
analyzed: na assaḥ an assaḥ anissaraḥ an ariyaḥ  kada kussa  ku it ca itassa ka da hoti sare pare
translated: Not a horse, not a horse, not a charioteer, not a noble person.🔽The word kada is added to the word kussa.🔽The word kada is added to the word kussa, if the word sare is there.

original: Kucchitaṃ annaṃ kadannaṃ, kucchitaṃ asanaṃ kadassanaṃ.
analyzed: kucchitam annam kadannam kucchitam asanam kadassanam
translated: Cooked food, food to be eaten, cooked rice, cooked curry.

original: Sareti kimatthaṃ? Kucchitā dārā yesaṃ (apuññakārānaṃ) te hontīti kudārā, kujanā. Evaṃ kuputtā, kugehā, kuvatthā, kudāsā.
analyzed: sara iti kimattham kucchitāḥ dārāḥ yesam apuñña kārānam te honti iti ku dārā ku janā evam ku puttā ku gehā ku vatthā ku dāsā
translated: What is the purpose of the word “or”? Those who have worthless wives are “having worthless wives” (kudārā), worthless people. So too, worthless sons, worthless houses, worthless things, worthless fields.

original: 336, 347. Kā’ppatthesu ca.🔽Kuiccetassa kā hoti appatthesu ca.
analyzed: kāppatthesu ca  ku icca itassa kā hoti appa tthesu ca
translated: And in the sense of “not being found”.🔽What is the purpose of the word “or”? It is to show that the form kā is also used in the sense of “not being found”.

analyzed: kālavaṇam kāpuppham
translated: Kālavaṇaṃ, kāpupphaṃ.

original: Bahuvacanaggahaṇaṃ kimatthaṃ? Kuiccetassa anappatatthesupi kvaci kā hoti, kāpurisā.
analyzed: bahuvacana ggahaṇam kimattham an appatatthesu pi kvaci kā hoti kāpurisā
translated: What is the purpose of the word “plural”? It is to show that the form kā is also used in the sense of “not being found” in the plural. Kāpurisā.

analyzed: kvaci samāsa anta gata anama kāra antaḥ
translated: And in the sense of “end of a compound”.

original: Samāsantagatānaṃ nāmānamanto saro kvaci akāro hoti.
analyzed: samāsa anta gatānam saraḥ kvaci akāraḥ
translated: The word kā is used in the sense of “end of a compound” in some cases.

original: Devānaṃ rājā devarājo, devarājā, devānaṃ sakhā devasakho, devasakhā, pañca ahāni pañcāhaṃ, sattāhaṃ, pañcagavaṃ, chattupāhanaṃ, upasaradaṃ, visālakkho, vimukho.🔽Kāraggahaṇaṃ kimatthaṃ? Ākāranta ikārantā ca honti, paccakkhā dhammā yassa soyanti
analyzed: devānam rājā devarājaḥ devarājā devānam sakhā devasakhaḥ devasakhā pañca ahāni pañca aham satta aham pañcagavam chattupāhanam upasaradam visālakkhaḥ vimukhaḥ  kāra ggahaṇam kimattham ākāra ante ikāra antā ca honti paccakkhāḥ dhammāḥ yassa soyanti
translated: Devānaṃ rājā = devarājā, devarājā, devānaṃ sakhā = devasakho, devasakhā, pañca ahāni = pañcāhaṃ, sattāhaṃ, pañcagavaṃ, chattupāhanaṃ, upasaradaṃ, visālakkho, vimukho.

original: paccakkhadhammā, surabhino gandho surabhigandhi, sundaro gandho sugandhi, pūtino
analyzed: paccakkha dhammā surabhinaḥ gandhaḥ surabhi gandhi sundaraḥ gandhaḥ sugandhi
translated: What is the purpose of the word “or”? It is to show that the forms ā and i are also used in the sense of “end of a compound”. Paccakkhā dhammā yassa so = paccakkhadhammā, surabhino gandho = surabhigandhi, sundaro gandho = sugandhi, pūtino

original: gandho pūtigandhi, kucchito gandho kugandhi, duṭṭhu gandho yassa soyanti dugandhi,
analyzed: gandho pūti gandhi kucchitaḥ gandho kugandhi duṭṭhu gandho yassa soyanti dugandhi
translated: The smell of a corpse is a “corpse-smell”. The smell of a belly is a “belly-smell”. The smell of a rotten thing is a “rotten smell”.

analyzed: pūti eva gandho pūtigandhi
translated: The smell of a corpse is a “corpse-smell”.

original: Nadīantā ca kattuantā ca kapaccayo hoti samāsante.
analyzed: nadī antā ca kattu antā ca ka paccayaḥ hoti samāsa ante
translated: The suffix -aka is added to the end of a river-name and to the end of a maker’s name.

original: Bahū nadiyo yasmiṃ soyaṃ bahunadiko, janapado. Bahavo kattāro yassa soyaṃ bahukattuko, puriso.
analyzed: bahū nadiyaḥ yasmin saḥ ayam bahu nadikaḥ janapadaḥ bahavaḥ kattāraḥ yassa saḥ ayam bahu kattukaḥ purisaḥ
translated: The country in which there are many rivers is called “the country of many rivers”. The man who has many makers is called “the man of many makers”.

analyzed: nadimhā ca
translated: And from a river-name.

analyzed: nadimhā ca ka paccayaḥ hoti samāsante
translated: The suffix -aka is added to the end of a river-name.

original: Bahū nadiyo yasmiṃ soyanti bahunadiko. Bahū kantiyo yassa soyanti bahukantiko. Bahunāriko.
analyzed: bahū nadiyaḥ yasmin soyanti bahu nadikaḥ bahū kantiyaḥ yassa soyanti bahu kantikaḥ bahu nāriko
translated: The country in which there are many rivers is called “the country of many rivers”. The man who has many wives is called “the man of many wives”.

original: 339, 358. Jāyāya tudaṃ jāni patimhi.🔽Jāyāiccetāya tudaṃ jāniiccete ādesā honti patimhi pare.
analyzed: jāyāya tudam patimhi  tudam jāni icca ite ādesāḥ honti patimhi pare
translated: And from a wife-name.🔽The suffixes -patī and -patī are added to the end of a wife-name.

analyzed: tudaṃpatī jāni patī
translated: The husband of Tudaṃ is called “Tudaṃpatī”. The husband of Jāni is called “Jānipatī”.

original: 340, 355. Dhanumhā ca.🔽Dhanumhā ca āpaccayo hoti samāsante.
analyzed: dhanumhā ca  dhanumhā ca ā paccayaḥ hoti samāsante
translated: And from a bow-name.🔽The suffix -dhanvā is added to the end of a bow-name.

analyzed: gāṇḍīvaḥ dhanu yaḥ sa saḥ ayam gāṇḍīvadhanvā
translated: The bow of Gāṇḍī is called “the bow of Gāṇḍī”.

analyzed: am vibhattī na makāra antāḥ abyayībhāvā
translated: And the indeclinable a is added to the end of a word in the oblique cases.

original: Tasmā akārantā abyayībhāvasamāsā parāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ kvaci aṃ hoti.
analyzed: tasmai akāra antāḥ abyayībhāva samāsā parāsam vibhattīnam kvaci am hoti
translated: Therefore, in the compound of the indeclinable class, the case-ending is sometimes changed to aṃ.

original: Adhicittaṃ, yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, upakumbhaṃ, yāvajīvaṃ, tiropabbataṃ, tiropākāraṃ, tirokuṭṭaṃ, antopāsādaṃ.
analyzed: adhicittam yathāvuḍḍham upakumbham yāvajīvam tiro pabbatam tiro pākāram tiro kuṭṭam anta upāsādam
translated: Adhicittaṃ, yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, upakumbhaṃ, yāvajīvaṃ, tiropabbataṃ, tiropākāraṃ, tirokuṭṭaṃ, antopāsādaṃ.

analyzed: kvaci iti kimattham adhicittassa bhikkhuno
translated: Why is the word kvacīti used? Adhicittassa bhikkhuno.

analyzed: saraḥ rassaḥ napuṃsake
translated: Saro rasso napuṃsake.

original: Napuṃsake vattamānassa abyayībhāvasamāsassa liṅgassa saro rasso hoti.
analyzed: napuṃsake vattamānassa abyayībhāva samāsassa liṅgassa saraḥ rassaḥ hoti
translated: The vowel of the gender of the compound of the indeclinable class, when it is neuter, is short.

original: Kumārīsu adhikicca pavattati kathā iti adhikumāri. Upavadhu, upagaṅgaṃ, upamaṇikaṃ.
analyzed: kumārīsu adhikicca pavattati kathā iti adhikumāri upavadhu upagaṅgam upamaṇikam
translated: Adhikumāri. Upavadhu, upagaṅgaṃ, upamaṇikaṃ.

analyzed: aññasmāt lopaḥ ca
translated: Aññasmā lopo ca.

original: Aññasmā abyayībhāvasamāsā anakārantā parāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo ca hoti.
analyzed: aññasmai abyayībhāva samāsāḥ an akāra antā parāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ ca hoti
translated: The case-ending of the compound of the indeclinable class, when it is not in the akārantā class, is elided.

analyzed: adhitthi adhikumāri upavadhu
translated: Adhitthi, adhikumāri, upavadhu.

analyzed: iti nāmakappe samāsakappaḥ sattamaḥ kaṇḍo
translated: Thus ends the seventh chapter in the great grammatical treatise called “The Port of Entry into the Science of Phonemes,” composed by the great sage Moggallāna.

analyzed: samāsakappaḥ niṭṭhito
translated: The chapter on compounds is finished.

analyzed: taddhita kappa
translated: The chapter on nominal affixes

analyzed: aṭṭhama kaṇḍa
translated: The eighth chapter

analyzed: vāṇa pacce
translated: Vāṇa’pacce.

analyzed: ṇa paccayaḥ hoti vā tassā pacca m iti itasmin atthe
translated: The affix ṇap is used in the sense of “tassāpacca”.

original: Vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vāsiṭṭho, vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vā, vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vāsiṭṭhī,🔽vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vāsiṭṭhaṃ. Evaṃ bhāradvājo, bhāradvājī, bhāradvājaṃ. Gotamo,🔽gotamī, gotamaṃ. Vāsudevo, vāsudevī, vāsudevaṃ. Bāladevo, bāladevī, bāladevaṃ. Vesāmitto,🔽vesāmittī vesāmittaṃ.
analyzed: vasiṭṭhassa apaccam vāsiṭṭhaḥ vasiṭṭhassa apaccam vā vasiṭṭhassa apaccam vāsiṭṭhī  vasiṭṭhassa apaccam vāsiṭṭham evam bhāradvājaḥ bhāradvājī bhāradvājam gotamaḥ  gotamī gotamam vāsudevaḥ vāsudevī vāsudevam bāladevaḥ bāladevī bāladevam vesāmittaḥ  vesāmittī vesāmittam
translated: Vasiṭṭha’s mother is a Vasiṭṭhī, Vasiṭṭha’s mother is a Vasi, Vasiṭṭha’s mother is a Vasi.🔽Vasiṭṭha’s mother is a Vasi. In the same way, Bhāradvāja’s mother is a Bhāradvājī, Bhāradvāja’s mother is a Bhāradvāja. Gotama’s mother is a Gotamī, Gotama’s mother is a Gotama. Vāsudeva’s mother is a Vāsudevī, Vāsudeva’s mother is a Vāsudeva. Bāladeva’s mother is a Bāladevī, Bāladeva’s mother is a Bāladeva. Vesāmitta’s mother is a Vesāmittī, Vesāmitta’s mother is a Vesāmitta.

original: 345, 366. Ṇāyana ṇāna vacchādito.🔽Tasmā vacchādito gottagaṇato ṇāyanaṇānapaccayā honti vā “tassāpacca”miccetasmiṃ atthe.🔽Vacchassa apaccaṃvacchāyano, vacchāno, vacchassa apaccaṃ vā, vacchassa apaccaṃ vacchāyanī,🔽vacchānī, vacchassa apaccaṃ vacchāyanaṃ, vacchānaṃ. Sakaṭassa apaccaṃ sākaṭāyano,🔽sākaṭāno, sakaṭassa apaccaṃ vā, sākaṭāyanī, sā kaṭānī, sākaṭāyanaṃ, sākaṭānaṃ. Evaṃ
analyzed: vacchādito 🔽tasmā vacchāditaḥ gotta gaṇataḥ ṇāyana ṇāna paccayāḥ honti vā tassā paccam icca itasmin atthe 🔽vacchassa apaccaṃvacchāyanaḥ vacchānaḥ vacchassa apaccam vā vacchassa apaccam vacchāyanī 🔽vacchānī vacchassa apaccam vacchāyanam vacchānam sakaṭassa apaccam sākaṭāyanaḥ 🔽sākaṭānaḥ sakaṭassa apaccam vā sākaṭāyanī sā kaṭānī sākaṭāyanam sākaṭānam evam

original: kaṇhāyano, kaṇhāno, kaṇhassa apaccaṃ vā. Kaṇhāyanī, kaṇhānī, kaṇhāyanaṃ, kaṇhānaṃ.
analyzed: kaṇhāyanaḥ kaṇhānaḥ kaṇhassa apaccam vā kaṇhāyanī kaṇhānī kaṇhāyanam kaṇhānam
translated: Kaṇhāyana, Kaṇhāno, Kaṇhassa apaccaṃ vā. Kaṇhāyanī, Kaṇhānī, Kaṇhāyanaṃ, Kaṇhānaṃ.

original: Aggivessāyano, aggivessāno, aggivessāyanī, aggivessānī, aggivessāyanaṃ, aggivessānaṃ.
analyzed: aggivessāyanaḥ aggivessānaḥ aggivessāyanī aggivessānī aggivessāyanam aggivessānam
translated: Aggivessāyana, Aggivessāno, Aggivessāyanī, Aggivessānī, Aggivessāyanaṃ, Aggivessānaṃ.

original: Gacchāyano, gacchāno, gacchāyanī, gacchānī, gacchāyanaṃ, gacchānaṃ. Kappāyano, kappāno,
analyzed: gacchāyanaḥ gacchānaḥ gacchāyanī gacchānī gacchāyanam gacchānam kappāyano kappānaḥ
translated: Gacchāyana, Gacchāno, Gacchāyanī, Gacchānī, Gacchāyanaṃ, Gacchānaṃ. Kappāyana, Kappāno,

original: kappāyanī, kappānī, kappāyanaṃ, kappānaṃ. Moggallāyano, moggallāno, moggallāyanī,
analyzed: kappāyanī kappānī kappāyanam kappānam moggallāyanaḥ moggallānaḥ moggallāyanī
translated: Kappāyanī, Kappānī, Kappāyanaṃ, Kappānaṃ. Moggallāyana, Moggallāno, Moggallāyanī,

original: moggallānī, moggallāyanaṃ, moggallānaṃ. Muñcāyano, muñcāno, muñcāyanī, muñcānī, muñcāyanaṃ,
analyzed: moggallānī moggallāyanam moggallānam muñcāyanaḥ muñcānaḥ muñcāyanī muñcānī muñcāyanam
translated: Moggallānī, Moggallāyanaṃ, Moggallānaṃ. Muñcāyana, Muñcāno, Muñcāyanī, Muñcānī, Muñcāyanaṃ,

original: muñcānaṃ. Saṅghāyano, saṅghāno, saṅghāyanī, saṅghānī, saṅghāyanaṃ, saṅghānaṃ. Lomāyano,
analyzed: muñcānam saṅghāyano saṅghāno saṅghāyanī saṅghānī saṅghāyanam saṅghānam lomāyano
translated: Muñcānaṃ. Saṅghāyana, Saṅghāno, Saṅghāyanī, Saṅghānī, Saṅghāyanaṃ, Saṅghānaṃ. Lomāyana,

original: lomāno, lomāyanī, lomānī, lomāyanaṃ, lomānaṃ, sākamāyano, sākamāno, sākamāyanī, sākamānī,
analyzed: lomānaḥ lomāyanī lomānī lomāyanam lomānam sākamāyanaḥ sākamānaḥ sākamāyanī sākamānī
translated: Lomāno, Lomāyanī, Lomānī, Lomāyanaṃ, Lomānaṃ, Sākamāyana, Sākamāno, Sākamāyanī, Sākamānī,🔽Sākamāyanaṃ, Sākamānaṃ.

original: sākamāyanaṃ, sākamānaṃ. Nārāyano, nārāno, nārāyanī, nārānī, nārāyanaṃ, nārānaṃ. Corāyanocorāno,
analyzed: sākamāyanam sākamānam nārāyanaḥ nārānaḥ nārāyanī nārānī nārāyanam nārānam corāyana ucorānaḥ
translated: Sākamāyanaṃ, sākamānaṃ. Nārāyano, nārāno, nārāyanī, nārānī, nārāyanaṃ, nārānaṃ. Corāyanacorāno,

original: corāyanī, corānī, corāyanaṃ, corānaṃ, āvasālāyano, āvasālāno, āvasālāyanī, āvasālānī,
analyzed: corāyanī corānī corāyanam corānam āvasālāyanaḥ āvasālānaḥ āvasālāyanī āvasālānī
translated: corāyanī, corānī, corāyanaṃ, corānaṃ, āvasālāyano, āvasālāno, āvasālāyanī, āvasālānī,

original: āvasālāyanaṃ, āvasālānaṃ. Dvepāyano, dvepāno, dvepāyanī, dvepānī, dvepāyanaṃ, dvepānaṃ.
analyzed: āvasālāyanam āvasālānam dvepāyanaḥ dvepānaḥ dvepāyanī dvepānī dvepāyanam dvepānam
translated: āvasālāyanaṃ, āvasālānaṃ. Dvepāyano, dvepāno, dvepāyanī, dvepānī, dvepāyanaṃ, dvepānaṃ.

original: Kuñcāyano, kuñcāno, kuñcāyanī, kuñcānī, kuñcāyanaṃ, kuñcānaṃ. Kaccāyano, kaccāno,
analyzed: kuñcāyano kuñcāno kuñcāyanī kuñcānī kuñcāyanam kuñcānam kaccāyano kaccāno
translated: Kuñcāyano, kuñcāno, kuñcāyanī, kuñcānī, kuñcāyanaṃ, kuñcānaṃ. Kaccāyano, kaccāno,

analyzed: kaccāyanī kaccānī kaccāyanam kaccānam
translated: kaccāyanī, kaccānī, kaccāyanaṃ, kaccānaṃ.

analyzed: ṇeyyaḥ kattikā ādīhi
translated: Ṇeyyo kattikādīhi.

original: Tehi gottagaṇehi kattikādīhi ṇeyyapaccayo hoti vā “tassāpacca”miccetasmiṃ atthe.
analyzed: tehi gotta gaṇehi kattikā ādīhi ṇeyya paccayaḥ hoti vā tassā paccam icca itasmin atthe
translated: With those clans beginning with Kattika, the ṇeyya affix is formed by the addition of the suffix -eyya, or by the addition of -o, in the sense of “having that as a source”.

original: Kattikāya apaccaṃ kattikeyyo, kattikāya apaccaṃ vā. Evaṃ venateyyo, rohiṇeyyo, gaṅgeyyo,
analyzed: kattikāya apaccam kattikeyyaḥ kattikāya apaccam vai evam venateyyaḥ rohiṇeyyaḥ gaṅgeyyaḥ
translated: Kattikāya apaccaṃ kattikeyyo, kattikāya apaccaṃ vā. Thus venateyyo, rohiṇeyyo, gaṅgeyyo,

original: kaddameyyo, nādeyyo, āleyyo, āheyo, kāmeyyo, suciyā apaccaṃ soceyyo, sāleyyo, bāleyyo, māleyyo, kāleyyo.
analyzed: kaddameyyaḥ nādeyyaḥ āleyyaḥ āheyaḥ kāmeyyaḥ suciyā apaccam soceyyaḥ sāleyyaḥ bāleyyaḥ māleyyaḥ kāleyyaḥ
translated: kaddameyyo, nādeyyo, āleyyo, āheyo, kāmeyyo, suciyā apaccaṃ soceyyo, sāleyyo, bāleyyo, māleyyo, kāleyyo.

analyzed: a taḥ ṇi vā
translated: After a, or.

original: Tasmā akārato ṇipaccayo hoti vā “tassāpacca”miccetasmiṃ atthe.
analyzed: tasmai akārataḥ ṇi paccayaḥ hoti vā tassā paccam iti itasmin atthe
translated: After a, the affix ṇi is added, or not, in the sense of “after that.”

original: Dakkhassa apaccaṃ dakkhi, dakkhassa apaccaṃ vā. Duṇassa apaccaṃ doṇi, duṇassa apaccaṃ
analyzed: dakkhassa apaccam dakkhi dakkhassa apaccam vā duṇassa apaccam doṇi duṇassa apaccam
translated: After dakkha, dakkhi, or not; after duṇa, doṇi, or not.

original: vā, evaṃ vāsavi, sakyaputti, nāṭaputti, dāsaputti, dāsavi, vāruṇi, gaṇḍi, bāladevi,
analyzed: vā evam vāsavi sakyaputti nāṭa putti dāsaputti dāsavi vāruṇi gaṇḍi bāladevi
translated: So vāsavi, sakyaputti, nāṭaputti, dāsaputti, dāsavi, vāruṇi, gaṇḍi, bāladevi,

original: pāvaki, jenadatti, buddhi, dhammi, saṅghi, kappi, anuruddhi.
analyzed: pāvaki jenadatti buddhi dhammi saṅghi kappi anuruddhi
translated: pāvaki, jenadatti, buddhi, dhammi, saṅghi, kappi, anuruddhi.

original: Vāti vikappanatthena ṇikapaccayo hoti “tassāpacca”miccetasmiṃ atthe. Sakyaputtassa apaccaṃ sakyaputtiko. Evaṃ nāṭaputtiko, jenadattiko.
analyzed: vā ati vikappana atthena ṇika paccayaḥ hoti tassa apaccam icca itasmin atthe sakyaputtassa apaccam sakyaputtikaḥ evam nāṭaputtikaḥ jenadattikaḥ
translated: The affix ṇik is added in the sense of “after that,” in the sense of “having made a distinction.” After sakyaputta, sakyaputtiko; so nāṭaputtiko, jenadattiko.

analyzed: pakva ādīhi
translated: Ṇavo after pakva, etc.

analyzed: upa ku it ca ivamādīhi ṇava paccayaḥ hoti vā atthe
translated: The affix ṇav is added, or not, after upaka, etc., in the sense of “after that.”

original: Upakussa apaccaṃ opakavo, upakussa apaccaṃ vā. Manuno apaccaṃ mānavo, manuno apaccaṃ
analyzed: upakussa apaccam opakavaḥ upakussa apaccam vā manunaḥ apaccam mānavaḥ manunaḥ apaccam
translated: After upakussa, opakavo, or not; after manusa, mānavo, or not.

original: vā. Bhaggussa apaccaṃ bhaggavo, bhaggussa apaccaṃ vā, paṇḍussa apaccaṃ paṇḍavo, paṇḍussa
analyzed: vā bhaggussa apaccam bhaggavaḥ bhaggussa apaccam vā paṇḍussa apaccam paṇḍavaḥ paṇḍussa
translated: Bhaggussa apaccaṃ bhaggavo, bhaggussa apaccaṃ vā, paṇḍussa apaccaṃ paṇḍavo, paṇḍussa

original: apaccaṃ vā, bahussa apaccaṃ bāhavo, bahussa apaccaṃ vā.
analyzed: apaccam vā bahussa apaccam bāhavaḥ bahussa apaccam vā
translated: apaccaṃ vā, bahussa apaccaṃ bāhavo, bahussa apaccaṃ vā.

analyzed: ṇeḥ a vidhavā āditaḥ
translated: , . Ṇera vidhavādito.

original: Tasmā vidhavādito ṇerapaccayo hoti vā “tassāpacca”miccetasmiṃ atthe.
analyzed: tasmā vidhavā āditaḥ ṇeḥ a paccayaḥ hoti vā tassā paccam iti itasmin atthe
translated: Therefore ṇera is the affix in the sense of ‘after’ (apaccaṃ) in the sense of ‘widow’ (vidhavā) and so on.

original: Vidhavāya apaccaṃ vedhavero, vidhavāya apaccaṃ vā. Bandhukiyā apaccaṃ bandhukero,
analyzed: vidhavāya apaccam vedhaveraḥ vidhavāya apaccam vā bandhukiyāḥ apaccam bandhukeraḥ
translated: Vidhavāya apaccaṃ vedhavero, vidhavāya apaccaṃ vā. Bandhukiyā apaccaṃ bandhukero,

original: bandhukiyā apaccaṃ vā. Samaṇassa apaccaṃ sāmaṇero, samaṇassa apaccaṃ vā. Evaṃ sāmaṇerī,
analyzed: bandhukiyā apaccam vā samaṇassa apaccam sāmaṇeraḥ samaṇassa apaccam vā evam sāmaṇerī
translated: bandhukiyā apaccaṃ vā. Samaṇassa apaccaṃ sāmaṇero, samaṇassa apaccaṃ vā. Thus sāmaṇerī,

analyzed: sāmaṇeram nāḷikeraḥ nāḷikerī nāḷikeram
translated: sāmaṇeraṃ, nāḷikero, nāḷikerī, nāḷikeraṃ.

original: 350, 373. Yena vā saṃsaṭṭhaṃ tarati carati vahati ṇiko.🔽Yena vā saṃsaṭṭhaṃ, yena vā tarati, yena vā carati, yena vā vahati iccetesvatthesu ṇikapaccayo hoti vā.
analyzed: yena vā saṃsaṭṭham tarati carati vahati  yena vā saṃsaṭṭham yena vā tarati yena vā carati yena vā vahati iti ca itesu atthesu ṇika paccayaḥ hoti vā
translated: , . Yena vā saṃsaṭṭhaṃ tarati carati vahati ṇiko.🔽Therefore ṇika is the affix in the sense of ‘that with which one is mixed up’ (saṃsaṭṭhaṃ), in the sense of ‘that by which one crosses’ (tarati), in the sense of ‘that by which one goes’ (carati), and in the sense of ‘that by which one carries’ (vahati).

original: Tilena saṃsaṭṭhaṃ bhojanaṃ telikaṃ, tilena saṃsaṭṭhaṃ vā. Evaṃ goḷikaṃ, ghātikaṃ.
analyzed: tilena saṃsaṭṭham bhojanam telikam tilena saṃsaṭṭham vā evam goḷikam ghātikam
translated: Tilena saṃsaṭṭhaṃ bhojanaṃ telikaṃ, tilena saṃsaṭṭhaṃ vā. Thus goḷikaṃ, ghātikaṃ.

original: Nāvāya taratīti nāviko, nāvāya tarati vā. Evaṃ oḷumpiko.
analyzed: nāvāya tarati iti nāvikaḥ nāvāya tarati vai evam oḷumpikaḥ
translated: One who crosses by boat is a nāviko, or he crosses by boat. So too oḷumpiko.

original: Sakaṭena caratīti sākaṭiko, sakaṭena carati vā. Evaṃ pattiko, daṇḍiko, dhammiko, pādiko.
analyzed: sakaṭena carati iti sākaṭikaḥ sakaṭena carati vā evam pattikaḥ daṇḍikaḥ dhammiko pādiko
translated: One who goes by cart is a sākaṭiko, or he goes by cart. So too pattiko, daṇḍiko, dhammiko, pādiko.

original: Sīsena vahatīti sīsiko, sīsena vahati vā. Aṃsena vahatīti aṃsiko, aṃsena vahati vā. Evaṃ khandhiko, aṅguliko.🔽Vāti vikappanatthena aññesupi ṇikapaccayo hoti. Rājagahe vasatīti rājagahiko, rājagahe
analyzed: sīsena vahati iti sīsikaḥ sīsena vahati vā aṃsena vahati iti aṃsikaḥ aṃsena vahati vā evam khandhikaḥ aṅgulikaḥ  vā ati vikappana atthena aññesu pi ṇika paccayaḥ hoti rāja gahe vasati iti rājagahikaḥ rājagahe
translated: One who carries on the head is a sīsiko, or he carries on the head. One who carries on the shoulder is an aṃsiko, or he carries on the shoulder. So too khandhiko, aṅguliko.

original: vasati vā. Rājagahe jāto rājagahiko, rājagahe jāto vā. Evaṃ māgadhiko, sāvatthiko,
analyzed: vasati vā rāja gahe jātaḥ rājagahikaḥ rājagahe jātaḥ vā evam māgadhikaḥ sāvatthikaḥ
translated: The ṇik affix is also used in the sense of “to be made” in other words. One who lives in Rājagaha is a rājagahiko, or he lives in Rājagaha. So too māgadhiko, sāvatthiko,

original: kāpila vatthiko, pāṭaliputtiko, vesāliko.🔽351, 374. Tamadhīte tenakatādi sannidhāna niyoga sippa bhaṇḍa jīvikatthesu ca.
analyzed: kāpila vatthiko pāṭaliputtiko vesāliko  tam adhīte tenakata ādi sannidhāna niyoga sippa bhaṇḍa jīvikatthesu ca
translated: kāpilavatthiko, pāṭaliputtako, vesāliko.🔽, . The ṇik affix is used in the sense of “to be learned,” “to be made,” “to be present there,” “to be employed there,” “to be a craft of that,” “to be goods of that,” and “to be a means of livelihood of that.”

original: Tamadhīte, tenakatādiatthe, tamhi sannidhānā, tattha niyutto, tamassa sippaṃ, tamassa bhaṇḍaṃ, tamassa jīvikaṃ iccetesvatthesu ca ṇikapaccayo hoti vā.
analyzed: tam adhīte tena kata ādi atthe tamhi sannidhānā tattha niyuttaḥ tamassa sippam tamassa bhaṇḍam tamassa jīvikam ca ṇika paccayaḥ hoti vā
translated: The ṇik affix is used in the sense of “to be learned,” “to be made,” “to be present there,” “to be employed there,” “to be a craft of that,” “to be goods of that,” and “to be a means of livelihood of that.”

original: Vinayamadhīte venayiko, vinayamadhīte vā. Evaṃ suttantiko, ābhidhammiko, veyyākaraṇiko.
analyzed: vinayam adhīte venayikaḥ vinayam adhīte vā evam suttantikaḥ ābhidhammikaḥ veyyākaraṇikaḥ
translated: One who has learnt the Vinaya is a vinayadhara, one who has learnt the Vinaya or is a vinayadhara. So too, a suttantadhara, an abhidhamma- dhara, a veyyakarana-dhara.

original: Kāyena kataṃ kammaṃ kāyikaṃ, kāyena kataṃ kammaṃ vā. Evaṃ vācasikaṃ, mānasikaṃ.
analyzed: kāyena katam kammam kāyikam kāyena katam kammam vā evam vācasikam mānasikam
translated: An action done by body is bodily, an action done by body or is bodily. So too, verbal, mental.

original: Sarīre sannidhānā vedanā sārīrikā, sarīre sannidhānā vā, evaṃ mānasikā.
analyzed: sarīre sannidhānā vedanā sārīrikā sarīre sannidhānā vai evam mānasikā
translated: A feeling that is present in the body is bodily, a feeling that is present in the body or is bodily. So too, mental.

original: Dvāre niyutto dovāriko, dvāre niyutto vā. Evaṃ bhaṇḍāgāriko, nāgariko, nāvakammiko.🔽Vīṇā assa sippaṃ veṇiko, vīṇā assa sippaṃ vā. Evaṃ pāṇaviko, modiṅgiko, vaṃsiko.🔽Gandho assa bhaṇḍaṃ gandhiko, gandho assa bhaṇḍaṃ vā. Evaṃ teliko, goḷiko.
analyzed: dvāre niyuttaḥ dovārikaḥ dvāre niyuttaḥ vā evam bhaṇḍāgārikaḥ nāgarikaḥ nāvakammiko  vīṇā assa sippam veṇikaḥ vīṇā assa sippam vā evam pāṇavikaḥ modiṅgikaḥ vaṃsikaḥ  gandhaḥ assa bhaṇḍam gandhikaḥ gandhaḥ assa bhaṇḍam vā evam telikaḥ goḷikaḥ
translated: One who is appointed to a door is a door-keeper, one who is appointed to a door or is a door-keeper. So too, a store-keeper, a town-dweller, a boat-man.🔽One whose craft is the lute is a veena-player, one whose craft is the lute or is a veena-player. So too, a panava-player, a modinga-player, a flute-player.🔽One whose merchandise is perfume is a perfumer, one whose merchandise is perfume or is a perfumer. So too, a dealer in oil, a dealer in salt.

original: Urabbhaṃ hantvā jīvatīti orabbhiko, urabbhaṃ hantvā jīvati vā. Magaṃ hantvā jīvatīti māgaviko, magaṃ hantvā jīvati vā. Evaṃ sokariko, sākuṇiko.
analyzed: urabbham hantvā jīvati iti orabbhikaḥ urabbham hantvā jīvati vā magam hantvā jīvati iti māgavikaḥ magam hantvā jīvati vā evam sokarikaḥ sākuṇikaḥ
translated: One who lives by killing goats is a goat-killer, one who lives by killing goats or is a goat-killer. One who lives by killing deer is a deer-killer, one who lives by killing deer or is a deer-killer. So too, a butcher, a fowler.

original: Ādiggahaṇena aññatthāpi ṇika paccayo yojetabbo. Jālena hato jāliko, jālena hato vā.
analyzed: ādi ggahaṇena aññattha api ṇika paccayaḥ yojetabbaḥ jālena hataḥ jālikaḥ jālena hataḥ vā
translated: One killed by a net is jāliko, or one killed by a net.

original: Suttena bandho suttiko, suttena bandho vā.🔽Cāpo assa āvudho cāpiko, cāpo assa āvudho vā. Evaṃ tomariko, muggariko, mosaliko.
analyzed: suttena bandhaḥ suttikaḥ suttena bandhaḥ vā  cāpaḥ assa āvudhaḥ cāpikaḥ cāpaḥ assa āvudhaḥ vai evam tomarikaḥ muggarikaḥ mosalikaḥ
translated: One bound with string is suttiko, or one bound with string.🔽One who has a bow as a weapon is cāpiko, or one who has a bow as a weapon. Likewise tomariko, muggariko, mosaliko.

original: Vāto assa ābādho vātiko, vāto assa ābādho vā. Evaṃ semhiko, pittiko.🔽Buddhe pasanno buddhiko, buddhe pasanno vā. Evaṃ dhammiko, saṅghiko.
analyzed: vātaḥ assa ābādhaḥ vātikaḥ vātaḥ assa ābādhaḥ vai evam semhikaḥ pittikaḥ  buddhe pasannaḥ buddhikaḥ buddhe pasannaḥ vā evam dhammikaḥ saṅghikaḥ
translated: One who has wind as a disease is vātiko, or one who has wind as a disease. Likewise semhiko, pittiko.🔽One who has faith in the Buddha is buddhiko, or one who has faith in the Buddha. Likewise dhammiko, saṅghiko.

original: Buddhassa santakaṃ buddhikaṃ, buddhassa santakaṃ vā. Evaṃ dhammikaṃ, saṅghikaṃ.
analyzed: buddhassa santakam buddhikam buddhassa santakam vā evam dhammikam saṅghikam
translated: What belongs to the Buddha is buddhika, or what belongs to the Buddha. Likewise dhammika, saṅghika.

original: Vatthena kītaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ vatthikaṃ, vatthena kītaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ vā. Evaṃ kumbhikaṃ, phālikaṃ, kiṃ kaṇikaṃ, sovaṇṇikaṃ.
analyzed: vatthena kītam bhaṇḍam vatthikam vatthena kītam bhaṇḍam vā evam kumbhikam phālikam kim kaṇikam sovaṇṇikam
translated: Goods bought with cloth are vatthika, or goods bought with cloth. Likewise kumbhika, phālika, kiṃ kaṇika, sovaṇṇika.

original: Kumbho assa parimāṇaṃ kumbhikaṃ, kumbho assa parimāṇaṃ vā.🔽Kumbhassa rāsi kumbhikaṃ, kumbhassa rāsi vā.
analyzed: kumbhaḥ assa parimāṇam kumbhikam kumbhaḥ assa parimāṇam vā  kumbhassa rāsi kumbhikam kumbhassa rāsi vā
translated: One who has a measure of a certain size is kumbhika, or one who has a measure of a certain size.🔽A heap of pots is kumbhika, or a heap of pots.

original: Kumbhaṃ arahatīti kumbhiko, kumbhaṃ arahati vā.
analyzed: kumbham arahati iti kumbhikā kumbham arahati vā
translated: One who deserves a pot is kumbhiko, or one who deserves a pot.

original: Akkhena dibbatīti akkhiko, akkhena dibbati vā. Evaṃ sālākiko, tindukiko, ambaphaliko. Kapiṭṭhaphaliko, nāḷikeriko iccevamādi.🔽352, 376. Ṇa rāgā tasse damaññatthesu ca.
analyzed: akkhena dibbati iti akkhikaḥ akkhena dibbati vā evam sālākikaḥ tindukikaḥ ambaphalikaḥ kapiṭṭhaphalikaḥ nāḷikerikaḥ icc evamādi  ṇa rāgā tasse damañña tthesu ca
translated: The eye is the eye’s own, as it were, thus it is an eye-eye . So too, a sugar-cane-eye , a wood-apple-eye , a mango-eye , a bread-fruit-eye , a coconut-eye , and so on.

original: Ṇapaccayo hoti vā rāgamhā “tena rattaṃ” iccetasmiṃ atthe, “tassedaṃ” aññatthesu ca.
analyzed: ṇa paccayaḥ hoti vā tena rattam iti ca itasmin atthe tassa idam aññatthesu ca
translated: Ṇa is a suffix in the sense of the paccayo, the cause, and in the sense of the damaññattha, the meaning of ‘being red with’.

original: Kasāvena rattaṃ vatthaṃ kāsāvaṃ, kasāvena rattaṃ vatthaṃ vā. Evaṃ kosumbhaṃ, hāliddaṃ, pāṭaṅgaṃ, rattaṅga, mañjiṭṭhaṃ, kuṅkumaṃ.
analyzed: kasāvena rattam vattham kāsāvam kasāvena rattam vattham vā evam kosumbham hāliddam pāṭaṅgam rattaṅga mañjiṭṭham kuṅkumam
translated: It is a suffix in the sense of the paccayo in the word kāsāvaṃ , which is derived from the word kāsāvaṃ , ‘red with kasāva’ , as in the expression ‘red with kasāva’ . So too, kosumbhaṃ , hāliddaṃ , pāṭaṅgaṃ , rattaṅgaṃ , mañjiṭṭhaṃ , kuṅkumaṃ .

original: Sūkarassa idaṃ maṃsaṃ sokaraṃ, sūkarassa idaṃ maṃsaṃ vā. Evaṃ māhisaṃ.
analyzed: sūkarassa idam maṃsam sokaram sūkarassa idam maṃsam vai evam māhisam
translated: It is a suffix in the sense of the damaññattha in the word sokaraṃ , which is derived from the word sūkaraṃ , ‘red with pig’ , as in the expression ‘red with pig’ . So too, māhisaṃ .

original: Udumbarassa avidūre pavattaṃ vimānaṃ odumbaraṃ, udumbarassa avidūre pavattaṃ vimānaṃ vā.
analyzed: udumbarassa avidūre pavattam vimānaṃ odumbaram udumbarassa avidūre pavattam vimānam vā
translated: It is a suffix in the sense of the paccayo in the word odumbaraṃ , which is derived from the word udumbaraṃ , ‘a mansion not far from an udumbara tree’ , as in the expression ‘a mansion not far from an udumbara tree’ .

original: Vidisāya avidūre nivāso vediso, vidisāya avidūre nivāso vā.🔽Mathurāya jāto māthuro, mathurāya jāto vā.
analyzed: vidisāya avidūre nivāsaḥ vedisaḥ vidisāya avidūre nivāsaḥ vā  mathurāya jātaḥ māthuraḥ mathurāya jātaḥ vā
translated: It is a suffix in the sense of the damaññattha in the word vedisaṃ , which is derived from the word vidisā , ‘a dwelling not far from the intermediate points of the compass’ , as in the expression ‘a dwelling not far from the intermediate points of the compass’ .

original: Mathurāya āgato māthuro, mathurāya āgato vā.
analyzed: mathurāya āgataḥ māthuraḥ mathurāya āgataḥ vā
translated: It is a suffix in the sense of the paccayo in the word māthuraṃ , which is derived from the word mathurā , ‘born in Mathurā’ , as in the expression ‘born in Mathurā’ .🔽It is a suffix in the sense of the damaññattha in the word māthuraṃ , which is derived from the word mathurā , ‘come from Mathurā’ , as in the expression ‘come from Mathurā’ .

original: Kattikāya niyutto māso kattiko, kattikāya niyutto māso vā. Evaṃ māgasiro, phusso, māgho, phagguno, citto, vesākho, jeṭṭho, āsaḷho, sāvaṇo, bhaddo, assayujo.
analyzed: kattikāya niyuttaḥ māso kattiko kattikāya niyuttaḥ māsaḥ vai evam māgasiraḥ phussaḥ māghaḥ phaggunaḥ cittaḥ vesākhaḥ jeṭṭhaḥ āsaḷhaḥ sāvaṇaḥ bhaddaḥ assayujaḥ
translated: The month appointed for Kattika is Kattika, or the month appointed for Kattika. So too, Magha, Phussa, Magha, Phagguna, Citta, Vesakha, Jeṭṭha, Āsāḷha, Sāvana, Bhadda, Assayuja.

analyzed: na paccaye saṇa kārake
translated: No growth, blue, yellow, etc., conditions, separate.

analyzed: phakāraḥ phussa saddassa vade
translated: The letter pha is the sound of Phussa, “head” is said of the head.

original: Sikkhānaṃ samūho sikkho, bhikkhānaṃ samūho bhikkho. Evaṃ kāpoto, māyūro, kokilo.
analyzed: sikkhānam samūhaḥ sikkhaḥ bhikkhānam samūhaḥ bhikkho evam kāpotaḥ māyūraḥ kokilo
translated: A collection of trainings is training, a collection of bhikkhus is a bhikkhu. So too, Kāpota, Māyūra, Kokila.

original: Buddhe, assa devatā buddho. Evaṃ bhaddo, māro, māhindo, vessavaṇo, yāmo, somo, nārāyaṇo.
analyzed: buddhe assa devatā buddhaḥ evam bhaddaḥ māraḥ māhindaḥ vessavaṇaḥ yāmaḥ somaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ
translated: In the Buddha, the god is Buddha. So too, Bhadda, Māra, Māhinda, Vessavaṇa, Yāma, Soma, Nārāyaṇa.

original: Saṃvaccharamadhīte saṃvaccharo. Evaṃ mohutto, nemitto, aṅgavijjo, veyyākaraṇo, chando, bhāsso, cando.
analyzed: saṃvaccharam adhīte saṃvaccharaḥ evam mohuttaḥ nemittaḥ aṅga vijjaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ chandaḥ bhāssaḥ cando
translated: Learned in the year is the year. So too, Mohutto, Nemitta, Aṅgavijja, Vevyākaraṇa, Chanda, Bhāsā, Canda.

original: Vasādānaṃ visayo deso vāsādo. Evaṃ kumbho, sākunto, ātisāro.
analyzed: vasā dānam visayaḥ desaḥ vāsādaḥ evam kumbhaḥ sākuntaḥ ātisāraḥ
translated: The country, the domain of the Vasas, is a Vasa. So too, Kumbha, Sākuṇṭa, Ātisāra.

original: Udumbarā asmiṃ padese santīti odumbaro. Sāgarehi nibbatto sāgaro. Sāgalamassa nivāso sāgalo. Mathurā assa nivāso māthuro. Mathurāya issaro māthuro. Iccevamādayo yojetabbā.🔽353, 378. Jātādīnamimiyā ca.
analyzed: udumbarāḥ asmin padese santi iti odumbaraḥ sāgarehi nibbatto sāgaraḥ sāgalam assa nivāso sāgalaḥ mathurā assa nivāsaḥ māthuraḥ mathurāya issaraḥ māthuraḥ icca evamādayaḥ yojetabbā  jāta ādi inamimiyā ca
translated: Udumbara is a tree, and the place where it is is called Udumbara. Sāgara is one born in the ocean. Sāgala is the abode of sāgalas. Māthura is the abode of Mathuras. Māthura is the lord of Mathurā. These are the ways of compounding.🔽And the suffix -iyo is added to jāta, etc.

analyzed: jāta e c ca ivamādīnam atthe imaiya paccayāḥ honti
translated: The suffixes -iyo, -iyo, -ika, -iyo are added to jāta, etc., in the sense stated.

original: Pacchā jāto pacchimo. Evaṃ antimo, majjhimo, purimo, uparimo, heṭṭhimo, gopphimo. Bodhisattajātiyā jāto bodhisattajātiyo, evaṃ assajātiyo, hatthijātiyo, manussajātiyo.
analyzed: pacchā jātaḥ pacchimaḥ evam antimaḥ majjhimaḥ purimaḥ uparimaḥ heṭṭhimaḥ gopphimaḥ bodhisatta jātiyā jātaḥ bodhisatta jātiyaḥ evam assa jātiyaḥ hatthi jātiyaḥ manussa jātiyaḥ
translated: Pacchimo is one born later. So too, antimo, majjhimo, purimo, uparimo, heṭṭhimo, gopphimo. Bodhisattajātiyo is one born in the birth of a bodhisatta. So too, assajātiyo, hatthijātiyo, manussajātiyo.

original: Ādiggahaṇena niyuttatthāditopi tadassatthāditopi ima iya ika iccete paccayā honti. Anto niyutto antimo. Evaṃ antiyo, antiko.
analyzed: ādi ggahaṇena niyutta attha āditaḥ api tad assattha āditaḥ api ime iyaḥ ikaḥ icca ete paccayāḥ honti antaḥ niyuttaḥ antimaḥ evam antiyaḥ antikaḥ
translated: By the word “beginning” the suffixes -iyo, -iyo, -iyo, -iyo, -iyo are added in the sense of “ten million,” etc., and in the sense of “having that,” etc. Antimo is one included within. So too, antiyo, antiko.

original: Putto assa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti puttimo. Evaṃ puttiyeva, puttiko, kappimo, kappiyo, kappiko.
analyzed: puttaḥ assa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti puttimaḥ evam puttiyā iva puttikaḥ kappimaḥ kappiyaḥ kappiko
translated: Puttimo is one who has a son, or one in whom a son exists. So too, puttiyo, puttiko, kappimo, kappiyo, kappiko.

original: Caggahaṇena kiyapaccayo hoti niyuttatthe. Jātiyaṃ niyutto jātikiyo, andhe niyutto andhakiyo, jātiyā andho jaccandho, jaccandhe niyutto jaccandhakiyo.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena kiya paccayaḥ hoti niyutta atthe jātiyam niyuttaḥ jātikiyaḥ andhe niyuttaḥ andhakiyaḥ jātiyā andhaḥ jat candhaḥ jat candhe niyuttaḥ jat candha kiyaḥ
translated: The affix -kiya is the instrumental case in the sense of “in relation to”. In the sense of “related to”, it is the instrumental case. “Related to birth” is jātikiya; “related to the blind” is andhakiya. “Blind from birth” is jaccandha; “related to the blind from birth” is jaccandhakiya.

analyzed: samūha atthe kaṇaḥ ṇā
translated: -kaṇa is the instrumental case in the sense of “collection”.

analyzed: samūha atthe ka ṇa ṇa e c ca ete paccayāḥ honti
translated: -kaṇa is the instrumental case in the sense of “collection”.

original: Rājaputtānaṃ samūho rājaputtako. Evaṃ rājaputto, mānussako, mānusso, māyūrako, māyūro, māhiṃsako, māhiṃso.
analyzed: rāja puttānam samūhaḥ rājaputtakaḥ evam rāja puttaḥ mānussakaḥ mānussaḥ māyūrakaḥ māyūraḥ māhiṃsakaḥ māhiṃsaḥ
translated: “Collection of princes” is rājaputtaka. “Collection of men” is mānussaka. “Collection of men” is mānussa. “Collection of peacocks” is māyūraka. “Collection of peacocks” is māyūra. “Collection of buffaloes” is māhiṃsaka. “Collection of buffaloes” is māhiṃsa.

original: 355, 380. Gāma jana bandhu sahāyādīhitā.🔽Gāma jana bandhu sahāyaiccevamādīhi tāpaccayo hoti samūhatthe.
analyzed: gāma jana bandhu sahāya ai c ca evamādīhi tāpa ccayaḥ hoti samūha tthe
translated: -tā is the instrumental case in the sense of “village, people, relatives, friends, etc.”🔽-tā is the instrumental case in the sense of “village, people, relatives, friends, etc.”

original: Gāmānaṃ samūho gāmatā. Evaṃ janatā, bandhutā, sahāyatā, nagaratā.🔽356, 381. Tadassa ṭhānamiyo ca.
analyzed: gāmānam samūhaḥ gāma tā evam jana tā bandhu tā sahāya tā nagara tā  tad assa ca
translated: “Collection of villages” is gāmatā. “Collection of people” is janatā. “Collection of relatives” is bandhutā. “Collection of friends” is sahāyatā. “Collection of cities” is nagaratā.🔽-iya is the instrumental case in the sense of “that is the place of that”.

analyzed: tat assa ṭhānam icca etasmin atthe iya paccayaḥ hoti
translated: -iya is the instrumental case in the sense of “that is the place of that”.

original: Madanassa ṭhānaṃ madaniyaṃ, bandhanassa ṭhānaṃ bandhaniyaṃ, mucchanassa ṭhānaṃ mucchaniyaṃ, evaṃ rajaniyaṃ, kamaniyaṃ, gamaniyaṃ, dussaniyaṃ, dassaniyaṃ.🔽357, 382. Upamatthāyitattaṃ.
analyzed: madanassa ṭhānam madaniyam bandhanassa ṭhānam bandhaniyam mucchanassa ṭhānam mucchaniyam evam rajaniyam kamaniyam gamaniyam dussaniyam dassaniyam  upamatthāyitattam
translated: The place of passion is the passionate, the place of bondage is the bond, the place of release is the release, so too the place of delighting, the place of being worthy of service, the place of going, the place of being blameworthy, the place of being worth seeing.🔽The meaning of simile is the cause.

analyzed: upama atthe āyi tatta paccayaḥ hoti
translated: The cause is the cause of the meaning of simile.

original: Dhūmo viya dissati aduṃ vanaṃ tadidaṃ dhūmāyitattaṃ, timiraṃ viya dissati aduṃ vanaṃ tadidaṃ timirāyitattaṃ.
analyzed: dhūmaḥ viya dissati adum vanam tat idam dhūmāyi tattam timiram viya dissati adum vanam tat idam timirāyi tattam
translated: The forest appears as if it were smoke, that is the cause of the appearance of smoke; the forest appears as if it were darkness, that is the cause of the appearance of darkness.

analyzed: tad nissita tthe laḥ
translated: The meaning of what is dependent on that is the cause.

original: “Tannissitatthe, tadassa ṭhāna”miccetasmiṃ atthe ca lapaccayo hoti.
analyzed: tad nissita atthe tat assa ṭhānam icca etasmin atthe ca la pa cayaḥ hoti
translated: “The meaning of what is dependent on that is the place of that,” in this meaning the cause is la.

original: Duṭṭhu nissitaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ, vedaṃ nissitaṃ vedallaṃ, duṭṭhu ṭhānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ, vedassa ṭhānaṃ vedallaṃ.
analyzed: duṭṭhu nissitam duṭṭhullam vedam nissitam vedallam duṭṭhu ṭhānam duṭṭhullam vedassa ṭhānam vedallam
translated: What is dependent on the wicked is wicked, what is dependent on the Veda is Vedalla; the place of the wicked is wicked, the place of the Veda is Vedalla.

analyzed: ālu tap bahule
translated: The meaning of frequent is the cause.

analyzed: ā lu paccayaḥ hoti tat bahula tthe
translated: The cause is the cause of the meaning of frequent.

original: Abhijjhā assa pakati abhijjhālu, abhijjhā assa bahulā vā abhijjhālu. Evaṃ sītālu, dhajālu, dayālu.
analyzed: abhijjhā assa pakati abhijjhālu abhijjhā assa bahulā vā abhijjhālu evam sītālu dhajālu dayālu
translated: His nature is full of greed, he is greedy; greed is frequent in him, he is greedy. So too: full of cold, full of flags, full of pity.

analyzed: ṇya t ta tā bhāve tu
translated: The meaning of being in the state of is the cause.

original: Ṇyattatāiccete paccayā honti bhāvatthe.🔽Alasassa bhāvo ālasyaṃ, arogassa bhāvo ārogyaṃ. Paṃsukūlikassa bhāvo paṃsukūlikattaṃ,
analyzed: ṇi yat tatā ic ca ite paccayāḥ honti bhāvatthe  alasassa bhāvaḥ ālasyam arogassa bhāvaḥ ārogyam paṃsukūlikassa bhāvaḥ paṃsukūlika ttam
translated: These are the suffixes in the sense of state.🔽The state of laziness is laziness; the state of health is health; the state of one who wears rag-robes is rag-robe-wearing;

original: anodarikassa bhāvo anodarikattaṃ. Saṅgaṇikārāmassa bhāvo saṅgaṇikārāmatā, niddārāmassa bhāvo niddārāmatā.
analyzed: anodarikassa bhāvaḥ anodarika ttam saṅgaṇikā ārāmassa bhāvaḥ saṅgaṇikā ārāma tā niddārāmassa bhāvaḥ niddārāma tā
translated: the state of one who is not over-full is not being over-full; the state of one who delights in society is delighting in society; the state of one who delights in sleep is delighting in sleep.

analyzed: tu k gahaṇena ttana paccayaḥ hoti puthujjana ttanam vedana ttanam
translated: The suffix -tva is a suffix in the sense of nature. The nature of an ordinary man is ordinary manhood; the nature of feeling is feelinghood.

analyzed: ṇa visamādīhi
translated: The suffix -na is a suffix in the sense of unevenness, etc.

analyzed: ṇa paccayaḥ hoti visama ādīhi tassa atthe
translated: The suffix -na is a suffix in the sense of the state of that, in the sense of unevenness, etc.

original: Visamassa bhāvo vesamaṃ, sucissa bhāvo socaṃ.
analyzed: visamassa bhāvaḥ vesamam sucissa bhāvaḥ socam
translated: The state of unevenness is unevenness; the state of sorrow is sorrow.

analyzed: ramaṇīya āditas kaṇa
translated: The suffix -ya is a suffix in the sense of pleasant, etc.

original: Ramaṇīyaiccevamādito kaṇa paccayo hoti “tassa bhāvo”iccetasmiṃ atthe.
analyzed: kaṇa paccayaḥ hoti tassa atthe
translated: The suffix -ya is a suffix in the sense of the state of that, in the sense of pleasant, etc.

original: Ramaṇīyassa bhāvo rāmaṇīyakaṃ, manuññassa bhāvo mānuññakaṃ.🔽363, 390. Visese taratamisikiyiṭṭhā.
analyzed: ramaṇīyassa bhāvaḥ rāmaṇīyakam manuññassa bhāvaḥ mānuññakam  visese tara tami sikiyiṭṭhā
translated: The state of what is pleasant is pleasantness; the state of what is desirable is desirability.🔽The suffix -tva is a suffix in the sense of distinction, etc.

original: Visesatthe tara tama isika iya iṭṭhaiccete paccayā honti.
analyzed: visesa atthe tara tama isika iya iṭṭha e c ca ete paccayāḥ honti
translated: The suffixes -tva, -tama, -isi, -ika, -iya, and -ittha are suffixes in the sense of distinction.

original: Sabbe ime pāpā, ayamimesaṃ visesena pāpoti pāpataro. Evaṃ pāpatamo, pāpisiko, pāpiyo, pāpiṭṭho.🔽364, 398. Tadassatthīti vī ca.
analyzed: sabbe ime pāpāḥ ayam imesam visesena pāpo ti pāpataraḥ evam pāpatamaḥ pāpisikaḥ pāpiyaḥ pāpiṭṭho  tad assa atthi iti vī ca
translated: Vī is from tadassatthi.

analyzed: atthe vīpaccayaḥ hoti
translated: The affix vī is added to the base ending in -tthi in the sense of “that exists”.

original: Medhā yassa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatītimedhāvī. Evaṃ māyāvī.
analyzed: medhā yassa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti medhāvī evam māyāvī
translated: Medhāvī is from medhā; māyāvī is from māyā.

original: Caggahaṇena sopaccayo hoti. Sumedhā yassa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti sumedhaso.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena sa upaccayaḥ hoti sumedhā yassa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti sumedhaso
translated: The affix -vī is added to the base ending in -a in the sense of “possessing”. Sumedhaso is from sumedhā.

analyzed: tapa āditaḥ sī
translated: Sī is from tapādito.

analyzed: tapa āditaḥ sī paccayaḥ hoti tad assa tthi it ca itasmin atthe
translated: The affix sī is added to the base ending in -tap in the sense of “that exists”.

original: Tapo yassa atthi tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti tapassī. Evaṃ yasassī, tejassī.
analyzed: tapaḥ yassa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti tapassī evam yasassī tejassī
translated: Tapassī is from tapa; yasassī is from yasa; tejassī is from teja.

analyzed: daṇḍa āditaḥ i ka ī
translated: Ikaī is from daṇḍādito.

original: Daṇḍādito ika īiccete paccayā honti “tadassatthi”iccetasmiṃ atthe.
analyzed: daṇḍa āditaḥ i kaḥ ī it ca ete paccayāḥ honti tad assa tthi it ca etasmin atthe
translated: The affixes ika and ī are added to the base ending in -daṇḍa in the sense of “that exists”.

original: Daṇḍo yassa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti daṇḍiko, daṇḍī. Evaṃ māliko, mālī.
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ yassa atthi tasmim vā vijjati iti daṇḍikaḥ daṇḍī evam mālikaḥ mālī
translated: Daṇḍiko is from daṇḍa; daṇḍī is from daṇḍa. Māliko is from māla; mālī is from māla.

analyzed: madhu āditaḥ ro
translated: Ro is from madhvādito.

analyzed: madhu it ca evamāditaḥ rapat cayaḥ hoti atthe
translated: The affix ro is added to the base ending in -madhu in the sense of “that exists”.

original: Madhu yassa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti madhuro. Evaṃ kuñjaro, muggaro, mukharo, susiro, (sīsaro, sukaro, suṅkaro), subharo, suciro, ruciro.
analyzed: madhu yassa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti madhuraḥ evam kuñjaraḥ muggaraḥ mukharaḥ susiraḥ sīsaraḥ sukaraḥ suṅkaraḥ subharaḥ suciraḥ ruciraḥ
translated: Madhuro is derived from madhu, honey, in the sense of “having honey” or “being in honey.” Similarly, kuñjaro, muggaro, mukharo, susiro, (sīsaro, sukaro, suṅkaro), subharo, suciro, ruciro.

analyzed: vantu
translated: Guṇādito vantu.

analyzed: guṇa e t ca evamāditaḥ vantu paccayaḥ hoti atthe
translated: Vantu is the augment to guṇa, etc., in the sense of “having that.”

original: Guṇo yassa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti guṇavā. Evaṃ yasavā, dhanavā, paññavā, balavā, bhagavā.
analyzed: guṇaḥ yassa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti guṇavā evam yasavā dhanavā paññavā balavā bhagavā
translated: Guṇavā is derived from guṇa, virtue, in the sense of “having virtue” or “being in virtue.” Similarly, yasavā, dhanavā, paññavā, balavā, bhagavā.
Satyādīhi mantu.

analyzed: sati id ca evamādīhi mantu paccaya ho ti tad assa tthi iti ca etasmin atthe
translated: Mantu is the augment to sati, etc., in the sense of “having that.”

original: Sati yassa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti satimā, evaṃ jutimā, rucimā, thutimā, dhitimā, matimā, bhāṇumā.
analyzed: sati yassa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti satimā evam jutimā rucimā thutimā dhitimā matimā bhāṇumā
translated: Satimā is derived from sati, mindfulness, in the sense of “having mindfulness” or “being in mindfulness.” Similarly, jutimā, rucimā, thutimā, dhitimā, matimā, bhāṇumā.

analyzed: sad ha ādi taḥ ṇa
translated: Saddhāditoṇa.

analyzed: ṇa paccayaḥ hoti atthe
translated: Na is the augment to saddhā, etc., in the sense of “having that.”

original: Saddhā yassa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatībhi saddho, evaṃ pañño, amaccharo.
analyzed: saddhā yassa atthi tasmin vā saddhaḥ evam paññaḥ amaccharaḥ
translated: Saddho is derived from saddhā, faith, in the sense of “having faith” or “being in faith.” Similarly, pañño, amaccharo.

analyzed: āyussu kārāsa mantumhi
translated: Āyussukārāsa mantumhi.

original: Āyussa anto ukāro asādeso hotimantumhi paccaye pare.
analyzed: āyussa antaḥ ukāraḥ as ādesaḥ hoti mantumhi paccaye pare
translated: The letter u is substituted for the final a of āyu when the following word begins with a vowel.

original: Āyu assa atthi, tasmiṃ vā vijjatīti āyasmā.🔽372, 385. Tappakativacane mayo.
analyzed: āyu assa atthi tasmin vā vijjati iti āyasman  tad pakativacane ma yaḥ
translated: He has life, or it exists in him, is āyasmā.🔽The suffix maya is used to denote “made of.”

analyzed: tad pakativacana tthe maya paccayaḥ hoti
translated: The suffix maya is used to denote “made of.”

original: Suvaṇṇena pakataṃ kammaṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ. Evaṃ rūpiyamayaṃ jatumayaṃ, rajatamayaṃ, iṭṭhakamayaṃ, ayomayaṃ, mattikā mayaṃ, dārumayaṃ, gomayaṃ.
analyzed: suvaṇṇena pakatam kammam sovaṇṇa mayam evam rūpiya mayam jatu mayam rajata mayam iṭṭhaka mayam ayaḥ mayam mattikā mayam dāru mayam gomayam
translated: An ornament made of gold is sovaṇṇamaya. Likewise rūpiyamaya, jatumaya, rajatamaya, iṭṭhakamaya, ayomaya, mattikāmaya, dārumaya, gomaya.

analyzed: saṅkhyā pūraṇe mo
translated: The suffix mo is used to denote “full number.”

analyzed: saṅkhyā pūraṇa atthe ma paccayaḥ hoti
translated: The suffix mo is used to denote “full number.”

original: Pañcannaṃ pūraṇo pañcamo, evaṃ sattamo, aṭṭhamo, navamo, dasamo.🔽374, 408. Sa chassavā.
analyzed: pañcannam pūraṇo pañcamaḥ evam sattamaḥ aṭṭhamaḥ navamaḥ dasamaḥ  sa chassavā
translated: The fifth is the full number of five, likewise the seventh, the eighth, the ninth, the tenth.

analyzed: chassa sakāra ādesaḥ hoti vā saṅkhyā pūraṇa tthe
translated: The letter sa is substituted for ch in the sense of “full number.”

original: Channaṃ pūraṇo saṭṭho, chaṭṭho vā.🔽375, 412. Ekādito dasassī.
analyzed: channam pūraṇaḥ saṭṭhaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ vā  eka āditaḥ dasassī
translated: The sixty is the full number of sixty, or the sixth.

original: Ekādito dasassa ante īpaccayo hoti vā saṅkhyāpūraṇatthe.
analyzed: eka āditaḥ dasassa ante īp accayaḥ hoti vā saṅkhyā pūraṇa atthe
translated: The suffix ī is added to the words for one, two, three, four, five, ten in the sense of “full number.”

original: Eko ca dasa ca ekādasa, ekādasannaṃ pūraṇī ekādasī. Pañcaca dasa ca pañcadasa, pañcadasannaṃ pūraṇī pañcadasī. Cattāro ca dasa ca catuddasa, catuddasannaṃ pūraṇī cātuddasī.
analyzed: ekaḥ ca dasa ca ekādasaḥ ekādasannam pūraṇī ekādasī pañca ca dasa ca pañcadasa pañcadasannam pūraṇī pañcadasī cattāraḥ ca dasa ca catuddasa catuddasannam pūraṇī cātuddasī
translated: One and ten are eleven. Eleven of eleven are eleven times. Five and ten are fifteen. Fifteen of fifteen are fifteen times. Four and ten are fourteen. Fourteen of fourteen are fourteen times.

original: Pūraṇeti kimatthaṃ? Ekādasa, pañcadasa.🔽376, 257. Dase so niccañca.
analyzed: pūraṇa iti kimattham ekādasa pañcadasa  dase saḥ nit can ca
translated: What is the meaning of pūraṇī? Eleven, fifteen.🔽And ten is always.

original: Dasasadde pare niccaṃ chassa so hoti.
analyzed: dasa sadde pare niccam chassa saḥ hoti
translated: After the word dasa (ten), so is always changed to ch.

analyzed: soḷasa
translated: Sixteen.

analyzed: ante niggahitam ca
translated: And at the end, when checked.

analyzed: tāsam saṅkhyānam ante niggahita āgamaḥ hoti
translated: The ending of these numerals is checked at the end.

analyzed: pañcadasi cātuddasi
translated: Fifteen, fourteen.

analyzed: ti ca
translated: And ti.

original: Tāsaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ ante tikārāgamo hoti. Vīsati, tiṃsati.
analyzed: tāsam saṅkhyānam ante tikāra āgamaḥ hoti vīsati tiṃsati
translated: The letter ti is added at the end of these numerals. Twenty, thirty.

analyzed: ra
translated: And la for the dakaras and rakars.

original: Dakāra rakārānaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ lakārādeso hoti. Soḷasa, cattālīsaṃ.🔽380, 255. Vīsati dasesu bā dvissa tu.🔽Vīsati dasaiccetesu dvissa bā hoti.
analyzed: saṅkhyānam lakāra ādesaḥ hoti soḷasa cattālīsam  vīsati dasesu bā dvis sa tu  vīsati dasa et ca etesu dvis sa bā hoti
translated: The letter la is substituted for the dakaras and rakars of these numerals. Sixteen, forty.🔽And bā dvissa tu for twenty in the tens.🔽Bā is used for dvissa in the tens.

analyzed: bāvīsati indriyāni bārasa manussā
translated: The faculties are twenty-two, humans are twelve.

original: Tuggahaṇena dvissa du di do ādesā ca honti. Durattaṃ, dirattaṃ, diguṇaṃ, dohaḷinī.
analyzed: tuk gahaṇena dvissa du di do ādesā ca honti durattam dirattam diguṇam dohaḷinī
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

original: 381, 254. Ekādito dassa ra saṅkhyāne.🔽Ekādito dasassa dakārassa rakāro hoti vā saṅkhyāne.🔽Ekārasa, ekādasa, bārasa, dvādasa.
analyzed: eka ādeḥ dassa ra saṅkhyāne  eka āditaḥ dasassa dakārassa rakāraḥ hoti vā saṅkhyāne  ekārasa ekādasa bārasa dvādasa
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

analyzed: saṅkhyānā iti kimattham dvādasa āyatanāni  aṭṭha āditaḥ ca
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

original: Aṭṭhaiccevamādito ca dasasaddassa dakārassa rakārādeso hoti vā saṅkhyāne.🔽Aṭṭhārasa, aṭṭhadasa.
analyzed: ca dasa saddassa dakārassa rakāra ādesaḥ hoti vā saṅkhyāne  aṭṭhārasa aṭṭhadasa
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

original: Aṭṭhāditoti kimatthaṃ? Pañcadasa, soḷasa.🔽Saṅkhyāneti kimatthaṃ? Aṭṭhadasiko.
analyzed: aṭṭha āditas ti kimattham pañcadasa soḷasa  saṅkhyāna iti kimattham aṭṭhadasikaḥ
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

original: 383, 253. Dvekaṭṭhānamākāro vā.🔽Dvi eka aṭṭhaiccetesamanto ākāro hoti vā saṅkhyāne.🔽Dvādasa, ekādasa, aṭṭhārasa.🔽Saṅkhyāneti kimatthaṃ? Dvidanto, ekadanto, ekacchanno, aṭṭhatthambho.
analyzed: ākāraḥ hoti vā saṅkhyāne  dvādasa ekādasa aṭṭhārasa  saṅkhyānā iti kimattham dvi dantaḥ eka dantaḥ eka channaḥ aṭṭhatthambho
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

analyzed: catur che hī tha ṭhā
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.🔽The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

original: Catu chaiccetehi tha ṭhaiccete paccayā honti saṅkhyāpūraṇatthe.
analyzed: catu chaic cetehi tha ṭhaic cete paccayāḥ honti saṅkhyā pūraṇa tthe
translated: The augment -t is added, and the vowels of the last two are shortened, and the vowel of the first is lengthened.

original: Catuttho, chaṭṭho.🔽385, 409. Dvitīhi tiyo.🔽Dvi tiiccetehi tiyapaccayo hoti saṅkhyāpūraṇatthe.
analyzed: catutthaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ  dvitīyaḥ tiyaḥ  dvi ti i cca i tehi tiya paccayaḥ hoti saṅkhyā pūraṇa tthe
translated: The fourth, the sixth.

analyzed: dutiyaḥ tatiyaḥ
translated: The second, the third.

original: 386, 410. Tiye dutāpi ca.🔽Dvi tiiccetesaṃ du taiccete ādesā honti tiyapaccaye pare.
analyzed: tiye du tā api ca  dvi ti i c ca itesam du ta i c ca ite ādesāḥ honti tiya paccaye pare
translated: The second, the third.

original: Caggahaṇena dviiccetassa dikāro hoti. Dirattaṃ, diguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ pārupetvā.
analyzed: ca ggahaṇena dvi it ca itassa di kāraḥ hoti di rattam di guṇam saṅghāṭim pārupetvā
translated: The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.

analyzed: tesam aṭ ḍh upapadena aḍḍhuḍḍha divaḍḍha diyaḍḍhaḍḍhatiyā
translated: The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.

original: Tesaṃ catuttha dutiya tatiyānaṃ aḍḍhūpapadānaṃ aḍḍhaḍḍhudivaḍḍha diyaḍḍha aḍḍhatiyādesā honti, aḍḍhūpapadena sahanippajjante.
analyzed: tesam catuttha dutiya tatiyānam aḍḍhu upapadānam aḍḍhaḍḍhu divaḍḍha diyaḍḍha aḍḍhatiya ādesāḥ honti aḍḍhu upapadena saha nippajjante
translated: The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.🔽The second, the third.

original: Aḍḍhena catuttho aḍḍhuḍḍho, aḍḍhena dutiyo divaḍḍho, aḍḍhena dutiyo diyaḍḍho, aḍḍhena tatiyo aḍḍhatiyo.
analyzed: aḍḍhena catutthaḥ aḍḍhuḍḍhaḥ aḍḍhena dutiyaḥ divaḍḍhaḥ aḍḍhena dutiyaḥ diyaḍḍhaḥ aḍḍhena tatiyaḥ aḍḍhatiyaḥ
translated: The second, the third.

analyzed: sa rūpa ānam eka se sva sa kim
translated: The

original: Sarūpānaṃ padabyañjanānaṃ ekaseso hoti asakiṃ. Puriso ca puriso ca purisā.
analyzed: sarūpānam pada byañjanānam ekasesaḥ hoti asakim purisaḥ ca purisaḥ ca purisā
translated: There is a single ending for the words of the same form, not for the different. Man and man and men.

original: Sarūpānamiti kimatthaṃ? Hatthī ca asso ca ratho ca pattiko ca hatthiassarathapattikā,
analyzed: sarūpānam iti kimattham hatthī ca assaḥ ca rathaḥ ca pattikaḥ ca hatthi assa ratha pattikā
translated: What is the meaning of the words of the same form? Elephant and horse and chariot and foot-soldier are elephant-horse-chariot-foot-soldier.

analyzed: asakinti kimattham puriso
translated: What is the meaning of not for the different? Man.

original: 389, 413. Gaṇane dasassa dviticatupañcachasattaaṭṭhanavakānaṃ vī ti cattāra paññā cha sattāsanavā yosu, yonañcīsamāsaṃ ṭhi ri tī tuti.
analyzed: gaṇane dasassa dvi ti catu pañca cha satta aṭṭha navakānam vī ti cattāra paññā cha satta asa navā yosu yo nañcī samāsam ṭhi ri tī tu ti
translated: In the counting of ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety, the words vī ti cattāra paññā cha satta asa nava are the endings.

original: Gaṇane dasassa dvika tika catukka pañcaka chakka sattakaaṭṭhaka navakānaṃ sarūpānaṃ
analyzed: gaṇane dasassa dvika tika catukka pañcaka chakka sattaka aṭṭhaka navakānam sarūpānam
translated: In the counting of ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety, the words of the same form

original: katekasesānaṃ yathāsaṅkhyaṃ vī ti cattāra paññā cha satta asa navaiccādesā honti
analyzed: kata ikasesānam yathāsaṅkhyam vi ti cattāra paññā cha satta asa navā eva ca ādesāḥ honti
translated: have a single ending, namely, vī ti cattāra paññā cha satta asa nava respectively.

original: asakiṃ yosu, yonañca īsaṃ āsaṃ ṭhi ri ti īti utiiccādesā honti. Pacchā puna nippajjante.
analyzed: asakim yosu yonan ca īsam āsam ṭhi ri ti īti uti icca ādesāḥ honti pacchā puna nippajjante
translated: In the words yosu, yonañca, īsaṃ, āsaṃ, ṭhi ri, the words ī ti uti are the endings. They are formed again later.

original: Vīsaṃ, tiṃsaṃ, cattālīsaṃ, paññāsaṃ, saṭṭhi, sattari, sattati, asīti, navuti.
analyzed: vīsam tiṃsam cattālīsam paññāsam saṭṭhi sattari sattati asīti navuti
translated: Twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, seventy, eighty, ninety.

analyzed: asakinti kimattham dasa
translated: What is the meaning of not for the different? Ten.

original: Gaṇaneti kimatthaṃ? Dasadasakā purisā.🔽390, 256. Catūpapadassa lopo tuttarapadādicassa cucopi navā.
analyzed: gaṇanā iti kimattham dasa dasakā purisā  catu upapadassa lopaḥ tu tara pada ādi cassa cu caḥ pi navā
translated: What is the purpose of the word “counting”? —Ten times ten men.🔽In counting by fours, the first syllable is dropped, and the first syllable of the second is substituted, and the final is changed to -a.

original: Catūpapadassa gaṇane pariyāpannassa tukārassa lopo hoti, uttarapadādicakārassa cucopi ādesā honti navā.
analyzed: catu upapadassa gaṇane pariyāpannassa tukārassa lopaḥ hoti uttara pada ādi cakārassa ādesāḥ honti navā
translated: In counting by fours, when the counting is included in the word “counting”, the first syllable is dropped, and the first syllable of the second is substituted, and the final is changed to -a.

analyzed: cuddasa coddasa catuddasa
translated: Fourteen, fifteen, fourteen,🔽By the word “also” the first syllable of the second is substituted, and the final is changed to -a, in the case of counting by fours that is not included in the word “counting”.

original: Apiggahaṇena anupapadassāpi padādicakārassa. Lopohoti navā, cassa cucopi honti. Tālīsaṃ, cattālīsaṃ, cuttālīsaṃ, cottālīsaṃ.
analyzed: api ggahaṇena an upapadassa api pada ādi cakārassa navā cassa cu caḥ pi honti tālīsam cattālīsam cuttālīsam cottālīsam
translated: Thirty, forty, forty, forty.

analyzed: yat anupapannāḥ nipātanāḥ sijjhanti
translated: The nipāta-s are established in the way not included in the counting.

original: Ye saddā aniddiṭṭhalakkhaṇā, akkharapadabyañjanato, itthipumanapuṃsakaliṅgato, nāmupasagganipātato,
analyzed: ye saddāḥ an iddiṭṭha lakkhaṇāḥ akkhara pada byañjanataḥ itthi puma napuṃsaka liṅgataḥ nāma upasagga nipātataḥ
translated: Those sounds whose characteristics are not specified, by way of letter, word, and syllable, by way of feminine, masculine, and neuter gender, by way of prefix, indeclinable, and nipāta,

analyzed: abyayībhāva samāsa taddhita ākhyātataḥ gaṇana saṅkhyā kāla kāra kappa yoga saññātaḥ sandhi pakati vuddhi lopa āgama vikāra viparitataḥ
translated: by way of indeclinable, compound, derivative, and verbal, by way of counting, number, time, agent, and instrument, by way of sandhi, elision, augment, and change,

analyzed: vibhatti vibhajanataḥ ca te nipātanā sijjhanti
translated: and by way of case-ending and division, those are established by the nipāta-s.

analyzed: dva āditaḥ kaḥ na ekatthe ca
translated: From two onwards, and in the case of more than one.

original: Dviiccevamādito kapaccayo hoti anekatthe ca, nipātanā sijjhanti.
analyzed: dvi i t ca evamāditaḥ ka paccayaḥ hoti anekatthe ca nipātanāḥ sijjhanti
translated: The dual is formed from the singular in this way, and the plural from the dual.🔽The hundred is formed by adding -ka to the number, and the thousand by adding -saha.

original: Satassa dvikaṃ dvisataṃ, satassa tikaṃ tisataṃ, satassa catukkaṃ catusataṃ, satassa
analyzed: satassa dvikam dvisatam satassa tikam tisatam satassa catukkam catusatam satassa
translated: The hundred is formed by adding -ka to the number: of one, two; of two, two hundred; of three, three hundred; of four, four hundred;

original: pañcakaṃ pañcasataṃ, satassa chakkaṃ chasataṃ, satassa sattakaṃ sattasataṃ, satassa
analyzed: pañcakam pañca satam satassa chakkam cha satam satassa sattakam satta satam satassa
translated: of five, five hundred; of six, six hundred; of seven, seven hundred; of eight, eight hundred;

original: aṭṭhakaṃ aṭṭhasataṃ, satassa navakaṃ navasataṃ, satassa dasakaṃ dasasataṃ, sahassaṃ hoti.
analyzed: aṭṭhakam aṭṭha satam satassa navakam nava satam satassa dasakam dasa satam sahassam hoti
translated: of nine, nine hundred; of ten, a thousand.

original: 393, 415. Dasadasakaṃ sataṃ dasakānaṃ sataṃ sahassañca yomhi.
analyzed: dasa dasakam satam dasakānam satam sahassam ca yomhi
translated: I am a hundred of ten tens, a thousand of ten hundreds.

original: Gaṇane pariyāpannassa dasadasakassa sataṃ hoti, satadasakassa sahassaṃ hoti yomhi pare.
analyzed: gaṇane pariyāpannassa dasa dasakassa satam hoti sata dasakassa sahassam hoti yomhi pare
translated: In counting, a hundred is formed by adding -ka to ten tens, and a thousand is formed by adding -saha to ten hundreds, I am to others.

analyzed: satam sahassam
translated: A hundred, a thousand.🔽The hundred and the thousand are formed from the dual and so on by adding -ka and -saha respectively.

original: Dvikādīnaṃ taduttarapadānañca nippajjante yathāsaṅkhyaṃ. Satassa dvikaṃ (tadidaṃ
analyzed: dvika ādīnam tad uttara padānam ca nippajjante yathāsaṅkhyam satassa dvikam tat idam
translated: The hundred is formed by adding -ka to the number: of one, two; (this is formed) two hundred;

original: hoti) dvisataṃ, evaṃ tisataṃ, catusataṃ, pañcasataṃ, chasataṃ, sattasataṃ, aṭṭhasataṃ,
analyzed: hoti dvisatam evam tisatam catusatam pañcasatam chasatam sattasatam aṭṭhasatam
translated: thus three hundred, four hundred, five hundred, six hundred, seven hundred, eight hundred,

analyzed: nava satam dasa satam sahassam hoti
translated: nine hundred, a thousand.

original: 394, 416. Yāva taduttari dasaguṇitañca.🔽Yāva tāsaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ uttari dasaguṇitañca kātabbaṃ.🔽Taṃ yathā? Dasassa gaṇanassa dasaguṇitaṃ katvā sataṃ hoti, satassa dasaguṇitaṃ katvā🔽sahassaṃ hoti, sahassassa dasaguṇitaṃ katvā dasasahassaṃ hoti, dasasahassassa dasaguṇitaṃ🔽katvāsatasahassaṃ hoti, satasahassassa dasaguṇitaṃ katvādasasatasahassaṃ hoti, dasasatasahassassadasaguṇitaṃ🔽katvā koṭi hoti, koṭisatasahassassa sataguṇitaṃ katvā pakoṭi hoti. Evaṃ sesāpi yojetabbā.
analyzed: yāva tāsam saṅkhyānam uttari dasa guṇitam ca kātabbam  tam yathā dasassa gaṇanassa dasa guṇitam katvā satam hoti satassa dasa guṇitam katvā  sahassam hoti sahassassa dasa guṇitam katvā dasa sahassam hoti dasa sahassassa dasa guṇitam  katvā sata sahassam hoti sata sahassassa dasa guṇitam katvā dasa sata sahassam hoti dasa sata sahassassa dasa guṇitam  katvā koṭi hoti koṭi sata sahassassa sata guṇitam katvā pakoṭi hoti evam sesā api yojetabbā
translated: Up to a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand of those.

original: Caggahaṇaṃ visesanatthaṃ.🔽395, 417. Sakanāmehi.🔽Yāsaṃ pana saṅkhyānaṃ aniddiṭṭhanāmadheyyānaṃ sakehi sakehi nāmehi nippajjante.🔽Satasahassānaṃ sataṃ koṭi, koṭisatasahassānaṃ sataṃ pakoṭi, pakoṭisatasahassānaṃ
analyzed: ca ggahaṇam visesana attham 🔽saka nāmā ihi 🔽yāsam pana saṅkhyānam an iddiṭṭha nāmadheyyānam sakehi sakehi nāmehi nippajjante 🔽sata sahassānam satam koṭi koṭi sata sahassānam satam pakoṭi pakoṭi sata sahassānam
