original: pūjetabboti mānito, apacīyateti apacito, vandīyateti vandito, vandīyitthāti vandito,
analyzed: pūjetabbo ti mānitaḥ apacīyateti apacitaḥ vandīyateti vanditaḥ vandīyittha ati vanditaḥ
translated: ‘Is worshipped’ means is honoured, ‘is respected’ means is revered, ‘is venerated’ means is revered, ‘is revered’ means is revered,

analyzed: sakkarīyata iti sakkāritaḥ sakkarīyittha ati sakkāritaḥ
translated: ‘is honoured’ means is honoured, ‘is honoured’ means is honoured.

original: 644, 661. Vepu sī dava vamu ku dā bhū hvādīhi thu ttima ṇimā nibbatte.
translated: Vepu sī dava vamu ku dā bhū hvādīhi thu ttima ṇimā nibbatte.

original: Vepu sī dava vamu ku dā bhū huiccevamādīhi dhātūhi yathāsambhavaṃ thu ttima ṇimapaccayā honti nibbattatthe.
analyzed: vepu sī dava vamu ku dā bhū hu it ca evamādīhi dhātūhi yathāsambhavam thu ttima ṇima paccayāḥ honti nibbatta tthe
translated: Vepu sī dava vamu ku dā bhū huiccevamādīhi dhātūhi yathāsambhavaṃ thu ttima ṇimapaccayā honti nibbattatthe.

original: Vepanaṃ vepo, tena nibbatto vepathu, sayanaṃ sayo, tena nibbatto sayathu, davanaṃ
analyzed: vepanam vepaḥ tena nibbattaḥ vepathu sayanam sayaḥ tena nibbattaḥ sayathu davanam
translated: Vepanaṃ vepo, tena nibbatto vepathu, sayanaṃ sayo, tena nibbatto sayathu, davanaṃ

original: davo, tena nibbatto davathu. Vamanaṃ vamo, tena nibbatto vamathu. Kutti karaṇaṃ,
analyzed: davaḥ tena nibbattaḥ davathu vamanam vamaḥ tena nibbattaḥ vamathu kutti karaṇam
translated: davo, tena nibbatto davathu. Vamanaṃ vamo, tena nibbatto vamathu. Kutti karaṇaṃ,

original: tena nibbattaṃ kuttimaṃ. Dāti dānaṃ, tena nibbattaṃ dattimaṃ. Bhūti bhavanaṃ, tena
analyzed: tena nibbattam kuttimam dāti dānam tena nibbattam dattimam bhūti bhavanam tena
translated: tena nibbattaṃ kuttimaṃ. Dāti dānaṃ, tena nibbattaṃ dattimaṃ. Bhūti bhavanaṃ, tena

original: nibbattaṃ bhottimaṃ. Avahuti avahanaṃ, tena nibbattaṃ ohāvimaṃ.
analyzed: nibbattam bhottimam avahuti avahanam tena nibbattam ohāvimam
translated: nibbattaṃ bhottimaṃ. Avahuti avahanaṃ, tena nibbattaṃ ohāvimaṃ.🔽, . Akkose namhāni.

analyzed: akkose namhāni
translated: “We will not speak ill of them.”

original: Akkosaiccetasmiṃ atthe namhi paṭisedhayutte ānipaccayo hoti dhātūhi.
analyzed: akkosa e c ca itasmin atthe namhi paṭisedha yutte ā ni paccayaḥ hoti dhātūhi
translated: In the case of the word akkosa, the vowel of the first syllable is not prohibited by the rule, because of the element dhātu.

original: Na gamitabbaṃ agamāni te jamma desaṃ, na kattabbaṃ akarāṇi te jamma kammaṃ.
analyzed: na gamitabbam agamāni te jamma desam na kattabbam akarāni te jamma kammaṃ
translated: You should not go to the place where you were born, you should not do the deed which you did.

original: Namhīti kimatthaṃ? Vipatti te jamma, vikati te jamma.
analyzed: namhi iti kimattham
translated: Why namhi? Vipatti te jamma, vikati te jamma.

original: Akkoseti kimatthaṃ? Na gantabbā agati te.🔽646, 419. Ekādito sakissa kkhattuṃ.🔽Ekādito sakissa kkhattuṃ hoti.
analyzed: akkoseti kimattham na gantabbā te  eka āditaḥ sakissa kkhattum  eka āditaḥ sakissa kkhattum hoti
translated: Why akkose? Na gantabbā agati te.🔽, . Ekādito sakissa kkhattuṃ.🔽Ekādito sakissa kkhattuṃ is a word formed by adding the suffix kkhattuṃ to the numeral words beginning with eka.

original: Ekassa padatthassa sakiṃ vāraṃ ekakkhattuṃ, dvinnaṃ padatthānaṃ sakiṃ vāraṃ dvikkhattuṃ,
analyzed: ekassa padatthassa sakim vāram eka khattum dvinnam padatthānam sakim vāram dvi khattum
translated: To the numeral word eka is added the suffix kkhattuṃ to make ekakkhattuṃ, meaning “once.”🔽To the numeral words dvā and tīṇi is added the suffix kkhattuṃ to make dvikkhattuṃ and tikkhattuṃ, meaning “twice” and “thrice.”

original: tiṇṇaṃ padatthānaṃ sakiṃ vāraṃ tikkhattuṃ, evaṃ catukkhattuṃ, pañcakkhattuṃ, chakkhattuṃ,
analyzed: tiṇṇam padatthānam sakim vāram ti khattum evam catu khattum pañca khattum cha khattum
translated: In the same way catukkhattuṃ, pañcakkhattuṃ, chakkhattuṃ,

original: sattakkhattuṃ, aṭṭhakkhattuṃ, navakkhattuṃ, dasakkhattuṃ. Iccevamādayo saddā yojetabbā.
analyzed: satta kkhattum aṭṭha kkhattum nava kkhattum dasa kkhattum icca evamādayaḥ saddāḥ yojetabbā
translated: sattakkhattuṃ, aṭṭhakkhattuṃ, navakkhattuṃ, dasakkhattuṃ. In this way these words should be combined.

original: 647, 663. Sunassunassoṇa vānuvānūnunakhunānā.🔽Sunaiccetassa pāṭipadikassa unassa oṇa vāna uvāna ūna unakha una ā ānādesā honti.
analyzed: sunas sunas soṇa vānu vānu unu nakhu nānā 🔽su na i c ca itassa pāṭipadikassa unassa oṇa vāna uvāna ūna unakha una ā āna ādesāḥ honti
translated: , . Sunassunassoṇa vānuvānūnunakhunānā.🔽In the case of the word sunassu, the vowel of the first syllable is not prohibited by the rule, because of the element unassa.

original: Sāmikassa saddaṃ suṇātīti soṇo, sāmikassa saddaṃ suṇātīti svāno, evaṃ suvāno, sūno, sunakho, suno, sā, sāno.
analyzed: sāmikassa saddam suṇāti iti soṇaḥ sāmikassa saddam suṇāti iti svānaḥ evam suvānaḥ sūno sunakhaḥ sunaḥ sā sāno
translated: Soṇo, svāno: the former is from so, the latter from sva, the meaning being “hearing the sound of the master.”

analyzed: taruṇassa su su ca
translated: Susu is also used for the young.

analyzed: taruṇa e t ca itassa pāṭipadikassa su su ādesaḥ hoti
translated: Susu is the augment for the young of the animal denoted by the root.

analyzed: susu kāḷakeso
translated: Susu kāḷakeso: the young one with black hair.

original: 649, 665. Yuvassuvassuvuvānunūnā.🔽Yuvaiccetassa pāṭipadikassa uvassa uvauvāna unaūnādesā honti.
analyzed: yuvas suvas suvuvā anunūnā  yuva e c ca itassa pāṭipadikassa uvassa uva ovānaḥ una ūna ādesāḥ honti
translated: Yuvassuvassuvuvānunūnā.🔽Uva, uvauvāna, una, ūna are the augmentations for the young of the animal denoted by the root.

analyzed: yuvā yuvānaḥ yunaḥ yūnaḥ
translated: Yuvā, yuvāno, yuno, yūno.

analyzed: kāle vattamāna atīte ṇu ādayaḥ
translated: Kāle vattamānātīte ṇvādayo.

original: Kāle vattamānatthe ca atītatthe ca ṇu yu tapaccayā honti.
analyzed: kāle vattamāna tthe ca atīta tthe ca ṇu yu ta paccayāḥ honti
translated: The augmentations ṇu, yu, ta are used for the present and the past.

original: Akāsi, karotīti kāru, agacchi, gacchatīti, vāyu, abhavi, bhavatīti bhūtaṃ.
analyzed: akāsi karoti iti kāru agacchi gacchati iti vāyu abhavi bhavati iti bhūtam
translated: Akāsi, karotīti kāru: the maker. Agacchi, gacchatīti vāyu: the wind. Abhavi, bhavatīti bhūtaṃ: the past.

analyzed: tavissati gama ādīhi ṇī ghi ṇa
translated: Tavissati gamādīhi ṇī ghiṇa.

original: Bhavissatikālatthe gamu bhaja su ṭhāiccevamādīhi dhātūhi ṇī ghiṇa paccayā honti.
analyzed: bhavissati kāla tthe gamu bhaja su ṭhā i c ca evamādīhi dhātūhi ṇī gh iṇa paccayāḥ honti
translated: The augmentations ṇī, ghi, ṇa are used for the future.

original: Āyatiṃ gamituṃ sīlaṃ yassa, so hotīti gāmī, āyatiṃ bhajituṃ sīlaṃ yassa, so hotīti
analyzed: āyatim gamitum sīlam yassa saḥ hoti iti gāmī āyatim bhajitum sīlam yassa saḥ hoti iti
translated: Gāmī: one who has the habit of going in the future. Bhamī: one who has the habit of enjoying in the future.

original: bhājī, āyatiṃ passāpituṃ sīlaṃ yassa, so hotīti passāvi, āyatiṃ paṭṭhāyituṃ sīlaṃ🔽yassa, so hotīti paṭṭhāyi.🔽652, 648. Kriyāyaṃ ṇvu tavo.
analyzed: bhājī āyatim passāpitum sīlam yassa saḥ hoti iti passāvi āyatim paṭṭhāyitum sīlam  yassa saḥ hoti iti paṭṭhāyi  ṇvu tavaḥ
translated: He who has the habit of supporting in the future is a paṭṭhāyi.🔽The ṇvu and tavo are suffixes in the sense of action.

original: Kriyāyamatthe ṇvu tuiccete paccayā honti bhavissatikāle.
analyzed: kriyā ayam atthe ṇvu tu it ca ete paccayāḥ honti bhavissati kāle
translated: The suffixes ṇvu and tu are used in the sense of action in the future tense.

analyzed: karissanti kārakaḥ vajati bhuñjissanti bhottā vajati
translated: One who goes saying “I will do” is a kārako. One who goes saying “I will eat” is a bhottā.

analyzed: bhāva vācimhi catutthī
translated: The fourth case is used in the sense of the state.

analyzed: bhāva vācimhi catutthī vibhatti hoti bhavissati kāle
translated: The fourth case is used in the sense of the state in the future tense.

original: Pacissate, pacanaṃ vā pāko, pākāya vajati. Bhuñjissate, bhojanaṃ vā bhogo, bhogāya vajati. Naccissate, naccanaṃ vā naccaṃ, naccāya vajati.🔽654, 649. Kammani ṇo.
analyzed: pacissate pacanam vā pākaḥ pākāya vajati bhuñjissate bhojanam vā bhogaḥ bhogāya vajati naccissate naccanam vā naccam naccāya vajati  kammani ṇaḥ
translated: He goes for the cooking, or for the cooking which is the act of cooking. He goes for the eating, or for the eating which is the act of eating. He goes for the dancing, or for the dancing which is the act of dancing.🔽The ṇo is used in the sense of the action.

analyzed: kammani upapade ṇa paccayaḥ hoti bhavissati kāle
translated: The suffix ṇo is used in the sense of the action in the future tense.

original: Nagaraṃ karissati nagarakāro vajati, sāliṃ lāvissati sālilāvo vajati, dhaññaṃ vapissati dhaññavāpo vajati, bhogaṃ dadissati bhogadāyo vajati, sindhuṃ pivissati sindhupāyo vajati.
analyzed: nagaram karissati nagara kāraḥ vajati sālim lāvissati sāli lāvaḥ vajati dhaññam vapissati dhañña vāpaḥ vajati bhogam dadissati bhoga dāyaḥ vajati sindhum pivissati sindhu pāyaḥ vajati
translated: He will make a town, a town-maker goes; he will thresh paddy, a paddy-thrasher goes; he will sow seed, a sower goes; he will give an enjoyment, a giver-of-enjoyment goes; he will drink the river, a river-drinker goes.

analyzed: se se ssam n tu mā nānā
translated: , . In the rest, ssaṃ ntu māna āna.

original: Sesaiccetasmiṃ atthe ssaṃ ntu māna āna iccete paccayā honti bhavissatikāle kammūpapade.
analyzed: sesa e c ca itasmin atthe ssam ntu māna āna iti ete paccayāḥ honti bhavissati kāle kamma upapade
translated: In the rest of this matter, ssaṃ ntu māna āna are the conditions for the future tense in the case of the verbal noun.

original: Kammaṃ karissati kammaṃ karissaṃ, evaṃ kammaṃ karonto, kammaṃ kurumāno, kammaṃ karāno🔽vajati. Bhojanaṃ bhuñjissati bhojanaṃ bhuñjissaṃ, evaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjanto, bhojanaṃ🔽bhuñjamāno, bhojanaṃ bhuñjāno vajati. Khādanaṃ khādissati khādanaṃ khādissaṃ, evaṃ
analyzed: kammam karissati kammam karissam evam kammam karontaḥ kammam kurumānaḥ kammam karānaḥ  vajati bhojanam bhuñjissati bhojanam bhuñjissam evam bhojanam bhuñjantaḥ bhojanam  bhuñjamānaḥ bhojanam bhuñjānaḥ vajati khādanam khādissati khādanam khādissam evam
translated: He will do the work, he will do the work, thus he is doing the work, he is doing the work, he is doing the work

original: khādanaṃ khādanto, khādanaṃ khādamāno, khādanaṃ khādāno vajati. Maggaṃ carissati
analyzed: khādanam khādantaḥ khādanam khādamānaḥ khādanam khādānaḥ vajati maggam carissati
translated: goes. He will eat the food, he will eat the food, thus he is eating the food, he is eating the food, he is eating the food goes. He will chew the cud, he will chew the cud, thus he is chewing the cud, he is chewing the cud, he is chewing the cud goes. He will travel the road,

original: maggaṃ carissaṃ, evaṃ maggaṃ caranto, maggaṃ caramāno, maggaṃ carāno vajati. Bhikkhaṃ
analyzed: maggam carissam evam maggam carantaḥ maggam caramānaḥ maggam carānaḥ vajati bhikkham
translated: He will go on the road thus. While going on the road, while going on the road, while going on the road he goes.

original: bhikkhissati bhikkhaṃ bhikkhissaṃ, evaṃ bhikkhaṃ bhikkhanto, bhikkhaṃ bhikkhamāno,🔽bhikkhaṃ bhikkhāno vajati.
analyzed: bhikkhissati bhikkham bhikkhissam evam bhikkham bhikkhantaḥ bhikkham bhikkhamānaḥ  bhikkham bhikkhānaḥ vajati
translated: He will go for alms thus. While going for alms, while going for alms, while going for alms he goes.

analyzed: cha vā ādi iti tatra ṇa
translated: , . Chavādīti tatraṇa.

original: Cha da ci ti su nī vi da pada tanu yata ada mada yuja vatumida mā pu ka la vara ve pu gupa dā iccevamādīhi dhātūhi tatraṇa iccete paccayā honti yathāsambhavaṃ.
analyzed: cha da ci ti su nī vi da pada tanu yata ada mada yuja vatumida mā pu ka la vara ve pu gupa dā iti ca evamādīhi dhātūhi tatraṇaḥ icca ete paccayāḥ honti yathāsambhavam
translated: Cha da ci ti su nī vi da pada tanu yata ada mada yuja vatumida mā pu ka la vara ve pu gupa dā iccevamādīhi dhātūhi tatraṇa iccete paccayā honti yathāsambhavaṃ.

original: Ātapaṃ chādetīti chattaṃ, chatraṃ. Ārammaṇaṃ cintetīti cittaṃ, citraṃ. Cintenti sampayuttadhammā
analyzed: ātapam chādeti iti chattam chatram ārammaṇam cinteti iti cittam citram cintenti sampayutta dhammā
translated: It covers from the heat thus it is an umbrella, an umbrella. It thinks about the object thus it is the mind, the mind. Associated states think about it

original: ethenāti vā cittaṃ, citraṃ. Atthe abhissavetīti suttaṃ, sutraṃ. Atthe sūcetīti vā
analyzed: ethena ati vā cittam citram atthe abhissaveti iti suttam sutram atthe sūceti iti vā
translated: or it is the mind, the mind. It is woven into the thread thus it is a thread, a thread. It is woven into the thread or

original: suttaṃ, sutraṃ. Satte netīti nettaṃ, netraṃ. Satte icchitaṭṭhānaṃ nenti etenāti vā
analyzed: suttam sutram satte neti iti nettam netram satte icchita ṭṭhānam nenti etena ati vā
translated: it is a thread, a thread. It leads the beings thus it is a guide, a guide. It leads the beings to the place they wish to go or

original: nettaṃ, netraṃ. Pakārena vidatīti pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ. Vividhena ākārena maṅga pāpaṃ
analyzed: nettam netram pakārena vidati iti pavittam pavitram vividhena ākārena maṅga pāpam
translated: Nettaṃ, netraṃ. Pakārena vidatīti pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ. Vividhena ākārena maṅga pāpaṃ

original: punāti, sodhetīti pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ. Sucibhāvaṃ vā pāpuṇātīti pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ.
analyzed: punāti sodheti iti pavittam pavitram suci bhāvam vā pāpuṇāti iti pavittam pavitram
translated: Nettaṃ, netraṃ. It cleanses by means of the process of cleansing , thus it is pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ. It cleanses by means of the various processes of cleansing , thus it is pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ. It cleanses by means of the various processes of cleansing , thus it is pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ. It reaches purity , thus it is pavittaṃ, pavitraṃ.

original: Padati pāpuṇātīti patto, patro. Āhārā patanti ettha bhājaneti pattaṃ, patraṃ. Padati🔽pavattatīti vā pattaṃ, patraṃ. Tanoti vitthāretīti tantaṃ, tantraṃ, tanitabbaṃ vitthāretabbanti🔽vā tantaṃ, tantra. Yatatīti yattaṃ, yatraṃ. Yatati vīriyaṃ karoti etenāti vā yattaṃ,🔽yatraṃ. Yatanaṃ vā yattaṃ, yatraṃ. Sukhadukkhaṃ adati bhakkhatīti attā, atrā. Madatīti
analyzed: padati pāpuṇāti iti pattaḥ patraḥ āhārā patanti ettha bhājane iti pattam patram padati  pavattati iti vā pattam patram tanoti vitthāreti iti tantam tantram tanitabbam vitthāretabbanti  vā tantam tantra yatati iti yattam yatram yatati vīriyam karoti etena ati vā yattam  yatram yatanam vā yattam yatram sukha dukkham adati bhakkhati iti attā atrā madati iti
translated: Padati pāpuṇāti, thus it is patto, patro. Food falls into this vessel , thus it is pattaṃ, patraṃ. It falls , thus it is pattaṃ, patraṃ. It spreads out , thus it is tantaṃ, tantraṃ. It should be spread out , thus it is tantaṃ, tantraṃ.

original: mattaṃ, matraṃ. Vatthuṃ yujjanti etenāti yottaṃ, yotraṃ. Vattatīti vattaṃ, vatraṃ.🔽Midati sinehaṃ karotīti mittaṃ. Mitraṃ. Midati sinehati etāyāti mettā, metrā. Pari
analyzed: mattam matram vatthum yujjanti etena ati yottam yotram vattati iti vattam vatram 🔽midati sineham karoti iti mittam mitram midati sinehati etā āyāti mettā metrā pari
translated: Yatatīti yattaṃ, yatraṃ. It is made by effort , thus it is yattaṃ, yatraṃ. It is the making of effort , thus it is yattaṃ, yatraṃ. It is the place of effort , thus it is yattaṃ, yatraṃ. It eats , consumes, pleasure and pain , thus it is attā, atrā. It is intoxicated , thus it is mattaṃ, matraṃ.🔽Yujjanti vatthū etena, thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ, yotraṃ. It is the place of the yoke , thus it is yottaṃ

original: samanta to sabbākārena minanti etāyāti mattā, matrā. Mānanaṃ vā mattaṃ, matraṃ. Attano
analyzed: samanta sabba ākārena minanti mattāḥ matrāḥ mānanam vā mattam matram
translated: It is a measure in that it measures all round, in every way: thus it is a measure, a measure. Or it is a measure in that it is a measure of honouring: a measure.🔽It is a son in that it purifies, it cleans, one’s own family: a son, a son.

original: kulaṃ punāti sodhetīti putto, putro. Kalitabbaṃ saṅkhyātabbanti kalattaṃ, kalatraṃ.🔽Saṃsuṭṭhu vāreti etenāti varattaṃ, varatraṃ. Vepati kampatīti vettaṃ, vetraṃ. Gopitabbaṃ
analyzed: kulam punāti sodheti iti putto putro kalitabbam saṅkhyātabbanti kalattam kalatram  saṃsuṭṭhu vāreti etena ati varattam varatram vepati kampati iti vettam vetram gopitabbam
translated: It is a wife in that it is to be reckoned, it is to be counted: a wife, a wife.🔽It is a staff in that it wards off well: a staff, a staff. It is a cane in that it trembles, it shakes: a cane, a cane. It is a guard in that it is to be guarded, it is to be protected: a guard, a guard, a guard, a guard.

original: rakkhitabbanti guttaṃ. Gutraṃ, gottaṃ, gotraṃ. Dāti avakhaṇḍati etenāti dāttaṃ, dātraṃ iccevamādi.
analyzed: rakkhitabbanti guttam gutram gottam gotram dāti avakhaṇḍati etena ati dāttam dātram icca evamādi
translated: It is a gift in that it is given, it is distributed: a gift, a gift. So too with the rest.

original: 657, 667. Vadādīhi ṇitto gaṇe.🔽Vada cara varaiccevamādīhi dhātūhi ṇittapaccayo hoti gaṇatthe.
analyzed: vad ādīhi ṇ ittaḥ gaṇe  vada cara vara e t ca evamādīhi dhātūhi ṇ itta paccayaḥ hoti gaṇa atthe
translated: The ṇit group with vad and so on.🔽The ṇit affix is used to form the noun in the sense of a collection with the verbs vad , cara , vara , and so on.

original: Vāditānaṃ gaṇo vādittaṃ. Evaṃ cārittaṃ, vārittaṃ, iccevamādi.
analyzed: vāditānam gaṇaḥ vādittam evam cārittam vārittam iti ca evamādi
translated: The collection of those who play musical instruments is a musical instrument. So too with the rest.

original: 658, 668. Midādīhi ttitiyo.🔽Mida pada ranja tanu dhāiccevamādīhi dhātūhi tti ti iccete paccayā honti.
analyzed: mit ādīhi ttitiyaḥ  m ida pada ranja tanu dhāic ca evamādīhi dhātūhi tti ti it ca ete paccayāḥ honti
translated: The tti group with mid and so on.🔽The tti affix is used to form the noun in the sense of a collection with the verbs mid , pada , ranja , tanu , dhā , and so on.

original: Midati sinehatīti metti, padati gacchatīti patti, ranjati etthāti ratti, tanoti vitthāretīti
analyzed: midati sinehati iti metti padati gacchati iti patti ranjati etthā ati ratti tanoti vitthāreti iti
translated: It is a friendship in that it is friendly, it is affectionate: a friendship. It is a path in that it is gone, it is gone along: a path. It is a night in that it shines here: a night. It is a spreading in that it spreads, it extends:

original: tanti, attano kulaṃ tanoti vitthāretīti vā tanti, paresaṃ itthīnaṃ puttaṃ dhāretīti
analyzed: tanti attano kulam tanoti vitthāreti iti vā tanti paresam itthīnam puttam dhāreti iti
translated: Tanti is so called because it extends, spreads, its own family, or because it extends, spreads, the son of other women.

original: dhāti, khīraṃ dhāretīti vā dhāti, attano sabhāvaṃ dhāretīti vā dhāti iccevamādi.
analyzed: dhāti khīram dhāreti iti vā dhāti attano sabhāvam dhāreti iti vā dhāti icc evamādi
translated: Dhāti is so called because it carries, bears, the son, or because it carries, bears, milk, or because it carries, bears, its own nature.

original: 659, 669. Usu ranja daṃsānaṃ daṃsassa daḍḍhoḍha ṭhā ca.
analyzed: usu ranja daṃsānam daṃsassa daḍḍha ūḍha ṭhā ca
translated: Usu ranja daṃsānaṃ daṃsassa daḍḍhoḍha ṭhā ca:

original: Usu ranja daṃsaiccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ daṃsassa daḍḍhādeso hoti, ḍha ṭhapaccayā ca honti.
analyzed: usu ranja daṃsa e c ca itesam dhātūnam daṃsassa daḍḍha ādeso hoti ḍha ṭha paccayā ca honti
translated: The form daḍḍha, etc., is the form of the root daṃsa, to bite, when it is followed by the suffixes ḍha, ṭha, and the suffixes -u and -a of the words usu, to burn, and ranja, to delight.

original: Usīyate uḍḍho, ranjanti etthāti raṭṭhaṃ, daṃsīyateti daḍḍho.🔽660, 670. Sūvusānamūvusānamatothoca.
analyzed: usīyate uḍḍhaḥ ranjanti ettha ati raṭṭham daṃsīyate iti daḍḍhaḥ  sūvusānam ūvusānam atas thā u ca
translated: The form uḍḍha is derived from usu, to burn, and the form raṭṭha from ranja, to delight. The form daḍḍha is derived from daṃsa, to bite.🔽Sūvusānamūvusānamatothoca:

original: Sūvu asaiccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ ūuasānaṃ atādeso hoti, thapaccayo ca.
analyzed: sū vu asa e c ca itesam dhātūnam ū u asānam a t ādesaḥ hoti tha paccayaḥ ca
translated: The form attha is the form of the root as, to be, when it is followed by the suffixes -u and -a of the words sūvu, to be born, and ūvu, to be born, and by the suffix -tha.

original: Savati hiṃsati etenāti satthaṃ, hirottappaṃ saṃvarati etenātivatthaṃ, saddānurūpaṃ asatibhavatīti attho,
analyzed: savati hiṃsati etena ati sattham hirottappam saṃvarati etena ativattham sadda anurūpam asati bhavati iti
translated: The form sattha is derived from the root hiṃs, to injure, the form vattha from the root saṃvara, to restrain, and the form attha from the root as, to be, in the sense of “non-existence” .

original: 661, 671. Ranjudādīhi dha didda kirā kvaci jadalopoca.
analyzed: ran ju da ādīhi dha di da ki rā kvaci ja da lopa uca
translated: Ranjudādīhi dha didda kirā kvaci jadalopoca:

original: Ranja uda idi cadi madi khuda chidi rudi dala susa suca vaca vaja iccevamādīhi dhātūhi dha da idda ka iraiccete paccayā honti, kvaci ja da lopo ca, puna nippajjante.🔽Rañjitabbanti randhaṃ, ranjayitthāti vā randhaṃ, attani sannissitānaṃ macchamakarānaṃ🔽pītisomanassaṃ undati pasavati janetīti samuddo, indati paramissariyaṃ karotīti indo,
analyzed: ranjaḥ udaḥ idi cadi madi khuda chidi rudi dala susa suca vaca vajaḥ it ca evamādīhi dhātūhi dha da id da ka i ra it ca ete paccayāḥ honti kvaci ja da lopaḥ ca puna nippajjante  rañjitabbanti randham ranjayittha iti vā randham attani sannissitānam maccha makarānam  pīti somanassam undati pasavati janeti iti samuddaḥ indati paramissariyam karoti iti indo
translated: The suffixes dha, da, idda, ka, ira, and icc are formed from the roots ranja, uda, idi, madi, khuda, chidi, rudi, dala, susa, suca, vaca, and vaja, etc.,🔽and the suffixes ja, da, and lopa are formed from the roots nippajjati, etc.🔽The sea is so called because it is that which causes the fish and other creatures living in it to be delighted (randha) or because it is that which delights (randha) them.🔽The ocean is so called because it is that which causes the waves to flow (undati) or because it is that which flows (undati) with water. The moon is so called because it is that which moves (indati) or because it is that which moves (indati) in the sky.

original: indattaṃ adhipatibhāvaṃ karotīti vā indo, canditabbo icchitabboti cando, mandati🔽hāsetīti mando, maditabbo hāsetabboti vā mando, khudati pipāsetīti khuddo, chinditabboti🔽chiddo, rudati hiṃsatīti ruddo, dalati duggatabhāvaṃ gacchatīti daliddo, sussatīti🔽sukkaṃ, sucatītisoko, vacitabbanti vakkaṃ, appaṭihato hutvā vajati gacchatīti vajiraṃ iccevamādi.
analyzed: indattam adhipati bhāvam karoti iti vai indo canditabbaḥ icchitabbaḥ iti candaḥ mandati 🔽hāseti iti mandaḥ maditabbaḥ hāsetabbo uti vā mandaḥ khudati pipāseti iti khuddo chinditabbo ti 🔽chiddaḥ rudati hiṃsati iti ruddaḥ dalati duggata bhāvam gacchati iti daliddaḥ sussati iti 🔽sukkam sucati iti sokaḥ vacitabbanti vakkam a paṭihataḥ hutvā vajati gacchati iti vajiram icca evamādi
translated: The following are the prepositions that are formed by the addition of the suffixes -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o, -u, -e, -a, -i, -e, -o

analyzed: paṭitaḥ hissa heraṇa hīraṇa
translated: He is called a heraṇa hīraṇa because he has fallen down.

original: Paṭiiccetasmā hissa dhātussa heraṇa hīraṇa ādesā honti.
analyzed: paṭi icca itasmā hissa dhātussa heraṇa hīraṇa ādesāḥ honti
translated: The forms heraṇa hīraṇa are substituted for the base because of the falling down.

analyzed: paṭipakkhemadditvā āgacchati pavattati iti pāṭiheram pāṭihīram
translated: He comes, he goes, having been struck by the opposite, thus it is a pāṭiheraṃ, pāṭihīraṃ.

analyzed: kaḍi ādi hi kaḥ
translated: Kaḍi and so on have ko.

original: Kaḍi ghaḍi vaḍi karaḍi maḍi saḍi kuṭhi bhaḍi paḍi daḍi raḍi taḍi isiḍi caḍi gaḍi
analyzed: kaḍi ghaḍi vaḍi karaḍi maḍi saḍi kuṭhi bhaḍi paḍi daḍi raḍi taḍi isiḍi caḍi gaḍi
translated: Kaḍi, ghaḍi, vaḍi, karaḍi, maḍi, saḍi, kuṭhi, bhaḍi, paḍi, daḍi, raḍi, taḍi, isiḍi, caḍi, gaḍi,

original: aḍi laḍi meḍi eraḍi khaḍi iccevamādīhi dhātūhi kapaccayo hoti saha paccayena ca nippajjante yathāsambhavaṃ.🔽Kaṇḍitabbo chinditabboti kaṇḍo, ghaṇḍitabbo ghaṭetabboti ghaṇḍo, vaṇḍanti etthāti🔽vaṇḍo, karaṇḍitabbo bhājetabboti karaṇḍo, maṇḍīyate vibhūsīyate etenāti maṇḍo, saṇḍanti
analyzed: aḍi laḍi meḍi eraḍi khaḍi iti ca evamādīhi dhātūhi ka paccayaḥ hoti saha paccayena ca nippajjante yathāsambhavam  kaṇḍitabbaḥ chinditabbaḥ iti kaṇḍaḥ ghaṇḍitabbaḥ ghaṭetabbaḥ iti ghaṇḍaḥ vaṇḍanti ettha ati  vaṇḍaḥ karaṇḍitabbaḥ bhājetabbaḥ iti karaṇḍaḥ maṇḍīyate vibhūsīyate etena ati maṇḍo saṇḍanti
translated: aḍi, laḍi, meḍi, eraḍi, khaḍi—these and other such bases have the affix ka added to them, and they are formed with the conditions as appropriate.🔽He is to be cut, he is to be split, thus kaṇḍo; he is to be pounded, he is to be beaten, thus ghaṇḍo; they are pounded here, thus vaṇḍo; he is to be divided, he is to be distributed, thus karaṇḍo; he is made to shine, he is made to be adorned, thus maṇḍo; they are pounded here, thus saṇḍo;

original: gumbanti etthāti saṇḍo, aṅgamaṅgāni kuṇṭhati chindatīti kuṭṭhaṃ, bhaṇḍitabbanti bhaṇḍaṃ,
analyzed: ettha ati saṇḍaḥ aṅgam aṅgāni kuṇṭhati chindati iti kuṭṭham bhaṇḍitabbanti bhaṇḍam
translated: they are heaped up here, thus gumbho; he breaks up, he cuts up the limbs, thus kuṭṭhaṃ; it is to be pounded, thus bhaṇḍaṃ;

original: paṇḍati liṅgavekallabhāvaṃ gacchatīti paṇḍako. Daṇḍati āṇaṃ karoti etenāti daṇḍo,
analyzed: paṇḍati liṅga vekalla bhāvam gacchati iti paṇḍakaḥ daṇḍati āṇam karoti etena ati daṇḍaḥ
translated: He is called a paṇḍaka because he goes to the state of being a neuter by the loss of his sex. He is called a daṇḍa because he is punished with a staff.

original: raṇḍati hiṃsatīti raṇḍo, visesena taṇḍati cāleti paresaṃ viññūnaṃ hadayaṃ kampetīti🔽vitaṇḍo, isiṇḍati paresaṃ maddatīti isiṇḍo, caṇḍati caṇḍikkabhāvaṃ karotīti caṇḍo,🔽gaṇḍati sannicayati samūhaṃ karoti etthāti gaṇḍo, aṇḍīyati nibbattīyatīti aṇḍo, laṇḍitabbo🔽jigucchitabboti laṇḍo, meṇḍati kuṭilabhāvaṃ gacchatīti meṇḍo, eraṇḍati rogaṃ hiṃsatīti🔽eraṇḍo, khaṇḍitabbo chinditabboti khaṇḍo iccevamādi.🔽664, 674. Khādāmagamānaṃ kha ndha’ndha gandhā.

translated: He is called a raṇḍa because he is a man who is fond of women. He is called a vitaṇḍa because he is a man who is fond of men. He is called an isiṇḍa because he is a man who is fond of both. He is called a caṇḍa because he is a man who is fond of women and men.

analyzed: khāda ama gamu icca itesam dhātūnam khandha andha gandha ādesāḥ honti ka paccayaḥ ca hoti 🔽jāti jarā maraṇa ādīhi saṃsāra dukkhehi khāditabbaḥ ti khandhaḥ amati aṅgam aṅgassa rujjana bhāvam

original: gacchatīti andho, cakkhunā amati rujjatīti vā andho, taṃ taṃ ṭhānaṃ vātena gacchatīti
analyzed: gacchati iti andho cakkhunā amati rujjati iti vā andho tam tam ṭhānam vātena gacchati iti
translated: he goes (thus) he is blind, or the eye is destroyed in him thus he is blind, he goes to this and that place by means of the wind,

analyzed: gandhaḥ evam khandhakaḥ andhakaḥ gandhakaḥ
translated: “He goes” (gacchati) = blind (andha). Or “he is torn by the eye” (mati rujjati) = blind (andha). “He goes by wind to this and that place” (vātena gacchati) = smell (gandha). Thus “part” (khandha), “blind” (andha), “smell” (gandha).
, . “Cloth” (paṭa) and so on.

original: Paṭa kala kusa kada bhaganda mekha vakka takka palla sadda mūla bila vida caḍaṃ pañca
analyzed: pañca
translated: Cloth (paṭa), mud (kala), kusha grass (kusa), a boil (kada), a boil (bhaganda), a line (mekha), a testicle (vakka), a stick (takka), a lump (palla), a sound (sadda), a root (mūla), a hole (bila), a split (vida), a step (caḍa), five (pañca),

original: vā vasa paci maca musa gotthu puthu bahu maṅga baha kamba samba aggaiccevamādīhi
analyzed: vā vasa paci maca musa gotthu puthu bahu maṅga baha kamba samba
translated: or “skin” (vamsa), “cook” (pāca), “die” (maca), “lie” (muda), “a bundle” (gotthu), “many” (bahu), “a limb” (maṅga), “a branch” (baha), “a joint” (kambala), “a top” (agga) - in this way,

original: dhātūhi pāṭi padikehi ca uttarapadesu alapaccayo hoti, pacchā puna nippajjante.🔽Paṭe alanti paṭalaṃ, kale alanti kalalaṃ, pāpake akusale dhamme kusati chindatīti
analyzed: dhātūhi pāṭi padikehi ca uttara padesu ala paccayaḥ hoti pacchā puna nippajjante  paṭe alanti paṭalam kale alanti kalalam pāpake akusale dhamme kusati chindati iti
translated: with these and other roots, and with the prefixes beginning with “paṭi”, the dependent state arises again later, when the word is formed.

original: kusalaṃ, kusabhūte yathāsabhāvadhamme alanti vā kusalaṃ, kuse uddissa dāne alanti
analyzed: kusalam kusa bhūte yathā sabhāva dhamme alanti vā kusalam kuse uddissa dāne alanti
translated: “They rub on cloth” (alanti paṭe) = a cloth (paṭala). “They rub on mud” (alanti kale) = mud (kalala). “It cuts off” (kusati) bad, unwholesome states (pāpake akusale dhamme) = wholesome (kusala). Or “they rub on kusha grass” (kusabhūte) as they are in their own nature (yathāsabhāvadhamme) = wholesome (kusala). Or “they rub for the sake of kusha grass” (kusabhūte uddissa dāne),

original: vā kusalaṃ, kuse sañcaye dhammasamudāye alanti vā kusalaṃ, kadde madde alanti kadalaṃ,
analyzed: vā kusalam kuse sañcaye dhamma samudāye alanti vā kusalam kadde madde alanti kadalam
translated: or “they rub on kusha grass” (kusabhūte sañcaye), or “they rub on a collection of states” (dhamma-samudāye), or “they rub on a boil” (kadde), or “they rub on a lump” (madde) = a boil (kadala).

original: bhagande secane alanti bhagandalaṃ, bhagande muttakarīsaharaṇe alanti vā bhagandalaṃ,🔽mekhe kaṭivicitte alanti mekhalaṃ, vakke rukkhatace alanti vakkalaṃ, takke rukkhasilese🔽alanti takkalaṃ, palle ninnaṭṭhāne alanti pallalaṃ, sadde harite alanti saddalaṃ,
analyzed: bhagande secane alanti bhagandalam bhagande mutta karīsa haraṇe alanti vā bhagandalam  mekhe kaṭi vicitte alanti mekhalam vakke rukkha tace alanti vakkalam takke rukkha silese  alanti takkalam palle ninna ṭṭhāne alanti pallalam sadde harite alanti saddalam
translated: In the anus, in the rectum, it is called a fissure. In the anus, in the carrying of urine and excrement, it is called a fissure.🔽In the groin, in the hip-bone, it is called a girdle. In the armpit, in the bark of a tree, it is called a bark. In the shoulder, in the remains of a tree,🔽it is called a splinter. In a hollow, in a low place, it is called a marsh. In a sound, in green grass, it is called a sound.

original: mūle patiṭṭhāne alanti mulālaṃ, biḷe nissaye alanti bilālaṃ, vide vijjamāne alanti
analyzed: mūle patiṭṭhāne alanti mulālam biḷe nissaye alanti bilālam vide vijjamāne alanti
translated: At the root, in a foundation, it is called a root. In a hollow, in a support, it is called a hollow. In a void, in what exists, it is called

original: vidalaṃ, caṇḍe alanti caṇḍālo, pañcannaṃ rājūnaṃ alanti pañcālo, vā gatigandhanesu🔽alanti vālaṃ, vā padagamane alanti vā vāḷo, vase acchādane alanti vasalo, pace vitthāre
analyzed: vidalam caṇḍe alanti caṇḍālo pañcannam alanti pañcālaḥ vā gati gandhanesu  alanti vālam vā pada gamane alanti vā vāḷaḥ vase acchādane alanti pace vitthāre
translated: a cleft. In a fierce (animal), it is called a fierce animal. In the five kings, it is called a group of five. In going, in smell,🔽it is called a hair. In a foot, in going, it is called a foot. In a house, in covering, it is called a house. In a place, in an extensive (place),

original: alanti pacalo, mace corakamme alanti macalo, muse theyye, muse pāṇacāge vā alanti
analyzed: alanti pacalaḥ mace cora kamme alanti macalaḥ muse theyye muse pāṇa cāge vā alanti
translated: it is called a place. In a thief, in a criminal act, it is called a thief. In a snare, in a snare for catching animals, it is called a snare.

original: musalo, gotte vaṃse siṅgālajātiyaṃ alanti gotthulo, puthumhi vitthāre alanti puthulo,
analyzed: musalaḥ gotte vaṃse siṅgāla jātiyam alanti gotthulo puthumhi vitthāre alanti puthulo
translated: In a family, in a lineage, in a cat's species, it is called a family. In a new, in an extensive (place), it is called a new (place).

original: bahumhi saṅkhyāne alanti bahulo, bahumhi vuddhimhi alanti vā bahulo, maṅgamhi gamane
analyzed: bahumhi saṅkhyāne alanti bahulaḥ bahumhi vuddhimhi alanti vā bahulaḥ maṅgamhi gamane
translated: In the sense of “many” it is “abundant” (bahulo); in the sense of “increase” it is “abundant” (bahulo); in the sense of “going” it is “abundant” (bahulo);

original: alanti maṅgalaṃ, bahumhi vuddhimhi alanti bahalaṃ, kambamhi sañcalane alanti kambalaṃ.
analyzed: alanti maṅgalam bahumhi vuddhimhi alanti bahalam kambamhi sañcalane alanti kambalam
translated: In bahu, the numeral, al means much, or in bahu, the growth, al means much; in maṅga, the going, al means auspicious; in bahu, the growth, al means dense; in kambala, the moving, al means blanket.

original: Sambamhi maṇḍale alanti sambalaṃ, agge gatikoṭille alanti aggaḷaṃ. Iccevamādayo aññepi saddā bhavanti.
analyzed: sambamhi maṇḍale alanti sambalam agge gati koṭille alanti aggaḷam icca evamādayaḥ aññe pi saddāḥ bhavanti
translated: In sambala, the circle, al means a bundle; in agga, the tip, al means a bolt. Thus these and other words are formed.

analyzed: puthassa puthu pathā maḥ vā
translated: Puthassa puthu pathā mo vā.

original: Puthaiccetassa pāṭipadikassa puthu pathādesā honti, kvaci amapaccayo hoti.
analyzed: putha ai c ca itassa pāṭipadikassa puthu patha ādesāḥ honti kvaci ama paccayaḥ hoti
translated: Puthaiccetassa pāṭipadikassa puthu pathādesā honti, kvaci amapaccayo hoti.

original: Putha hutvā jātanti puthavī pathame jāto pathamo, pathavī, paṭhamo vā, puthu kilese janetīti puthujjano, puthu hutvā jātanti pathavī, pathavī vā.
analyzed: hutvā jātanti puthavī pathame jātaḥ pathamaḥ pathavī paṭhamaḥ vā puthu kilese janeti iti puthujjanaḥ puthu hutvā jātanti pathavī pathavī vā
translated: Putha hutvā jātanti puthavī pathame jāto pathamo, pathavī, paṭhamo vā, puthu kilese janetīti puthujjano, puthu hutvā jātanti pathavī, pathavī vā.

analyzed: tu
translated: , . Sasvādīhi tu davo.

original: Sasu dada ada madaiccevamādīhi dhātūhi tu duiccete paccayā honti.
analyzed: sa su dada ada mada e c ca evamādīhi dhātūhi tu du i c ca ete paccayāḥ honti
translated: Sasu dada ada madaiccevamādīhi dhātūhi tu duiccete paccayā honti.

original: Aññe satte sasati hiṃsatīti sattu, dukkhaṃ dadātīti daddu, dukkhena adati bhakkhati🔽etthāti addu, dukkhaṃ adati anubhavati jano etenāti vā addu, dukkhaṃ bhājanaṃ ādhāraṃ
analyzed: aññe satte sasati hiṃsati iti sattu dukkham dadāti iti daddu dukkhena adati bhakkhati  ettha ati addu dukkham adati anubhavati janaḥ etena ati vā addu dukkham bhājanam ādhāram
translated: He kills other beings, thus he is a killer (sattu); he gives pain, thus he is a giver of pain (daddu); he takes away by means of pain, he devours by means of pain, thus he is a devourer (addu); or he is a devourer because people take away, experience, pain by means of him; or he is a devourer because he is a receptacle, a support, for pain.

original: bhāvatīti vā addu, madati ummattaṃ karotīti maddu, madati maddabhāvaṃ karotīti vā maddu.
analyzed: bhāvati iti vā addu madati ummattam karoti iti maddu madati madda bhāvam karoti iti vā maddu
translated: Or he is a devourer because he is a container for pain; he makes drunk, thus he is a maker of drunkenness (maddu); or he is a maker of drunkenness because he makes the state of drunkenness .

analyzed: īvaro
translated: The words beginning with jhā are formed with īvara.

analyzed: ci pā dhā i t ca evamādīhi dhātūhi
translated: The words beginning with cī, pā, dhā are formed with īvara.

original: Cīyatīti cīvaraṃ, pivatīti pīvaro, pātabbaṃ rakkhitabbanti vā pīvaraṃ. Dhāreti dhāretvā jīvitaṃ kappetīti dhīvaro, dhīvaraṃ.
analyzed: cīyati iti cīvaram pivati iti pīvaraḥ pātabbam rakkhitabbanti vā pīvaram dhāreti dhāretvā jīvitam kappeti iti dhīvaraḥ dhīvaram
translated: He is clothed, thus he is a wearer of robes (cīvara); he drinks, thus he is a drinker (pīvara); or the drink is to be guarded, thus it is a drink ; he supports, he maintains life by supporting, thus he is a supporter (dhīvara), a supporter .

original: 669, 679. Munādīhi ci.🔽Muna yata agga pata kava suca ruca mahāla bhaddāla manaiiccevamādīhi dhātūhi, pāṭipadikehi ca ipaccayo hoti.
analyzed: munā ādīhi ci  muna yata agga pata kava suca ruca mahāla bhaddāla manaiicca ivamādīhi dhātūhi pāṭipadikehi ca i paccayaḥ hoti
translated: The words beginning with mun are formed with ci.

original: Atthānatthaṃ munāti, ñeyyadhammaṃ lakkhaṇādivasena vā jānātīti muni, yatati vīriyaṃ
analyzed: attha anattham munāti ñeyya dhammam lakkhaṇa ādi vasena vā jānāti iti muni yatati vīriyam
translated: He measures the meaning of the text, he knows the Dhamma to be known by means of the characteristics, etc., thus he is a measurer (muni); he strives, he exerts energy, thus he is a striver (yatati);

original: karotīti yati, aggati kuṭilabhāvaṃ gacchatīti aggi, patati seṭṭho hutvā purato gacchatīti🔽pati, kabyaṃ bandhatīti kavi, kantaṃ manāpavacanaṃ vadatīti vā kavi. Sucati parisuddhaṃ🔽bhavatīti suci, rucati dibbatīti ruci, mahantaṃ vibhāvaṃ bhogakkhandhaṃ lātīti mahāli,
analyzed: karoti iti kuṭila bhāvam gacchati iti patati seṭṭhaḥ hutvā puratas gacchati iti  pati kabyam bandhati iti kavi kantam manāpa vacanam vadati iti vā kavi sucati parisuddham  bhavati iti suci rucati dibbati iti ruci mahantam vibhāvam bhogakkhandham lāti iti mahāli
translated: He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.🔽He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.🔽He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.🔽He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.

original: bhaddaṃ yasaṃ lātīti bhaddāli, manaṃ tattha ratane nayatīti maṇi.🔽670, 680. Vidādīhyūro.🔽Vida valla masa sida dukukapu maya udi khajja kuraiccevamādīhi dhātūhi, pāṭipadikehi ca ūrapaccayohoti.
analyzed: bhaddam yasam lāti iti bhaddāli manam tattha ratane nayati iti maṇi  vid ādi hi ūro  vida valla masa sida dukukapu maya udi khajja kuraic ca evamādīhi dhātūhi pāṭipadikehi ca ūra paccaya ūho ti
translated: He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.🔽He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.🔽He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.🔽He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.🔽He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.

original: Vidituṃ alanti vidūro, vidūraṭṭhāne jāto vedūro, vallati vallabhāvena bhavatīti vallūro,
analyzed: viditum alanti vidūraḥ vidūra ṭṭhāne jātaḥ vedūraḥ vallati valla bhāvena bhavati iti vallūro
translated: He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to the front, he binds, he speaks, he is pure, he shines, he takes, he is good, he is precious.

original: vallati aññamaññaṃ bandhatīti vā vallūro, āmasitabboti masūro, sindati siṅgārabhāvaṃ
analyzed: vallati aññam aññam bandhati iti vā vallūraḥ sindati siṅgāra bhāvam
translated: He makes, he strives, he goes, he goes crookedly, he goes to

original: gacchatīti sindūro, sindati virocatīti vā sindūro, gamituṃ alaṃ anāsannattāti dūro,🔽kuti saddaṃ karotīti kūro, attano gandhena aññaṃ gandhaṃ kapati hanati hiṃsatīti🔽kappūro, kappati rogāpanayane samatthetīti vā kappūro, mahiyaṃ ravatīti mayūro, mahiyaṃ🔽yāti gacchatīti mayūro, paṃsuṃ undati pasavatīti undūro, khajjitabbo khāditabboti
analyzed: gacchati iti sindūraḥ sindati virocati iti vā sindūraḥ gamitum alam dūraḥ  kuti saddam karoti iti kūraḥ attanaḥ gandhena aññam gandham kapati hanati hiṃsati iti  kappūraḥ kappati roga apanayane samattheti iti vā kappūraḥ mahiyam ravati iti mayūraḥ mahiyam  yāti gacchati iti mayūro paṃsum undati pasavati iti undūro khajjitabbo khāditabbo iti
translated: It goes, thus it is a “sindūra” (red lead). Or it is a sindūra because it “shines” (sindati). It is far because it is not near, thus it is a “dūra” (far).

analyzed: khajjūraḥ kurati akkosati iti kurūraḥ
translated: It makes a sound in a hut, thus it is a “kūra” (a kind of bird). It covers, it destroys, it harms another’s smell with its own smell, thus it is a “kappūra” (camphor). Or it is a kappūra because it is suitable for the removal of disease. It cries out in the sky, thus it is a “mayūra” (peacock). It goes, it moves in the sky, thus it is a mayūra. It produces, it causes, dust, thus it is an “undūra” (dust-raiser). It should be eaten, it should be chewed, thus it is a “khajjūra” (date). It makes, it abuses, thus it is a “kurūra” (a kind of bird).

original: 671, 681. Hanādīhi nu ṇutavo.🔽Hana jana bhāri khanu ama ve vedhā siki hi iccevamādīhi dhātūhi nu ṇu kuiccete paccayā honti.🔽Bhojanaṃ hanati hiṃsati etenāti haṇu, hanu vā. Gamanaṃ janetītī jāṇu, bhāṇu dibbatīti
analyzed: nu  hana jana bhāri khanu ama ve vedhā siki hi iti evamādīhi dhātūhi nu ṇu ku icca ete paccayāḥ honti  bhojanam hanati hiṃsati etena ati haṇu hanu vā gamanam janeti iti bhāṇu dibbati iti
translated: Nu, ṇu, ku, i, etc., are the suffixes in the sense of “by means of” with the roots han, etc.

original: bhāṇu, nivāte riti gacchatītī reṇu, khaṇitabbo avadāritabboti khāṇu. Aṅgamaṅgassa
analyzed: nivāte gacchati iti reṇu khaṇitabbaḥ avadāritabbaḥ iti khāṇu aṅgam aṅgassa
translated: It harms, it destroys, it injures food by means of this, thus it is a “hanu” (jaw). Or it is a hanu. It produces, it causes, going, thus it is a “jāṇu” (knee). It shines, it glows, thus it is a “bhāṇu” (sun). It goes, it moves in a windless place, thus it is a “reṇu” (dust). It should be dug, it should be excavated, thus it is a “khāṇu” (tree stump). A limb of the body,

original: rujjanabhāvaṃ vijjhanabhāvaṃ amati gacchatīti aṇu, veṇu, veti tantasantāne bhavatītī🔽veṇu, bahisārealantivāveṇu vacchaṃ, pāyetītī dhenu, atthaṃ dhāretītī dhātu, gamanapacanādikaṃ🔽kriyaṃ dhāretītī vā dhātu, sīyatī bandhīyatītī setu, uddhaṃ gacchati pavattatītī
analyzed: rujjana bhāvam vijjhana bhāvam amati gacchati iti aṇu veṇu vā iti tanta santāne  veṇu vaccham attham dhāreti itī dhātu gamana pacana ādikam  kriyam vā dhātu sīyatī setu uddham gacchati pavattati itī
translated: It is a particle because it goes to the state of being rubbed and the state of being pierced.🔽It is a bamboo because it is in a bamboo-frame. It is a calf because it is a young cow. It is a cow because it is a milker. It is an element because it bears a meaning. Or it is an element because it bears an action such as going, cooking, etc. It is a bridge because it is bound and stretched. It goes upwards, it proceeds.

original: ketu, attano phalaṃ hinoti pavattatītī hetu.
analyzed: ketu attanaḥ phalam hinoti pavattati itī hetu
translated: It goes to the state of being pierced, thus it is a needle (aṇu); it is in a bamboo (veṇu), it is woven in a thread-line (veti tantasantāne), thus it is a bamboo (veṇu); it is a calf (vacchaṃ), it is a cow (dhenu) that gives milk; it is an element (dhātu) that holds a meaning; or it is an element (dhātu) that holds an action such as going, cooking, etc.; it is a dam (setu) that is stretched (sīyati), that is bound; it is a banner (ketu) that goes up (uddhaṃ gacchati), that is raised; it is a cause (hetu) that causes (hinoti) its own fruit to go (pavatta).

original: 672, 682. Kuṭādīhi ṭho.🔽Kuṭa kusa kaṭaiccevamādīhi dhātūhi, pāṭipadikehi ca ṭhapaccayo hotī.
analyzed: kuṭa ādīhi ṭhaḥ  kuṭa kusa kaṭa e t ca evamādīhi dhātūhi pāṭipadikehi ca ṭha paccayaḥ hoti
translated: , . Kuṭa, etc., have ṭha.🔽Kuṭa, kusa, kaṭa, etc., and the causative verbs have the affix ṭha.

original: Aṅgamaṅgaṃ kuṭati chindatītī kuṭṭhaṃ, dhaññena chādetabbo pūretabbotī koṭṭho, kaṭitabbaṃ madditabbanti, kaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: aṅgam aṅgam kuṭati chindati itī kuṭṭham dhaññena chādetabbo pūretabbaḥ itī koṭṭhaḥ kaṭitabbam madditabbam iti kaṭṭham
translated: It is a leprosy (kuṭṭha) that cuts (kuṭati) limb by limb; it is a granary (koṭṭha) that can be covered (chādetabba) with grain, that can be filled (pūretabba); it is wood (kaṭṭha) that should be cut (kaṭitabba), that should be pounded (madditabba).

analyzed: manu pūra suṇa ādīhi ussa nu sisā
translated: , . Manu, pūra, suṇa, etc., have ussa, nusa, isa.

original: Manu pūra suṇa kusu ila ala maha si ki iccevamādīhi dhātūhi, pāṭipadikehi ca usa nusa isaiccete paccayā honti, puna nippajjante.
analyzed: manu pūra suṇa kusu ila ala maha si ki iti ca evamādīhi dhātūhi pāṭipadikehi ca usa nusa isa e ca ete paccayāḥ honti puna nippajjante
translated: Manu, pūra, suṇa, kusa, ila, ala, maha, si, ki, etc., and the causative verbs have the affixes ussa, nusa, isa, etc., again.

original: Kusalākusale dhamme manati jānātīti manusso, mānuso. Kāraṇā kāraṇaṃ manati jānātīti
analyzed: kusala akusale dhamme manati jānāti iti manussaḥ mānusaḥ kāraṇā kāraṇam manati jānāti iti
translated: He is a man because he thinks of profitable and unprofitable ideas.🔽Or he is a man because he thinks of a cause as a cause.🔽Or he is a man because he thinks of what is beneficial and what is not.

original: vā manusso, mānusso. Atthānatthaṃ manati jānātīti vā manusso, mānusso. Mātāpitūnaṃ
analyzed: vā manussaḥ mānussaḥ attha anattham manati jānāti iti vā manussaḥ mānussaḥ mātā pitūnam
translated: Or he is a man because he satisfies his parents’ heart.🔽Or he is a man because he satisfies his own desire.

original: hadayaṃ pūretīti puriso, attano manorathaṃ pūretīti vā puriso, pūretīti vā poso,
analyzed: hadayam pūreti iti purisaḥ attanaḥ manoratham pūreti iti vā puriso pūreti iti vā posaḥ
translated: Or he is a man because he satisfies .🔽She is a wife because she is to be listened to and served by her parents-in-law.

original: sasurehi suṇitabbā hiṃsitabbāti suṇisā, dvinnaṃ jānānaṃ kulasantānaṃ karotīti vā🔽suṇisā, kucchitabbanti karīsaṃ, gabbhaṃ vimocetīti suriso, tamandhakāravidhamanena
analyzed: sa surehi suṇitabbā hiṃsitabbā ati suṇisā dvinnam jānānam kula santānam karoti iti vā  suṇisā karīsam gabbham vimoceti iti surisaḥ tam andhakāra vidhamanena
translated: Or she is a wife because she makes the continuity of the family known to two .🔽She is a woman because she is to be despised .🔽He is a man because he releases the womb.🔽Or he is a man because he is a sun because he removes the darkness and because he is a delight and a terror to creatures.

original: sattānaṃ bhayaṃ surati hiṃsatīti sūriyo, rogaṃ hiṃsatīti sirīso, ilati kampatīti
analyzed: sattānam bhayam surati hiṃsati iti sūriyaḥ rogam hiṃsati iti sirīsaḥ ilati kampati iti
translated: He is a man because he is a glory .🔽He is a man because he is a disease .🔽He is a man because he is a trembling .

original: illiso, taṇhāya dubbalo hutvā ilati kampatīti vā illigho, pāpakaraṇe alati samatthetīti
analyzed: illisaḥ taṇhāya dubbalaḥ hutvā ilati kampati iti vā illigho pāpa karaṇe alati samattheti iti
translated: Or he is a man because he is a trembling because he is weak with craving.🔽He is a man because he is a lazy .🔽He is a man because he is a great .🔽He is a man because he is a head .

original: alaso, mahitabbo pūjetabboti mahiso, sīyati bandhīyatīti sīsaṃ, kitabbaṃ hiṃsitabbanti kisaṃ, iccevamādi.
analyzed: alasaḥ pūjetabbo iti mahisaḥ sīyati bandhīyati iti sīsam kitabbam hiṃsitabbam iti kisam icca evamādi
translated: He is a man because he is a despised .

original: Iti kibbidhānakappe uṇādikappo chaṭṭho kaṇḍo.🔽Uṇādikappo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: iti kip bidhāna kappe uṇ ādi kappaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ kaṇḍaḥ  uṇ ādi kappaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the various forms of declension, the sixth chapter of the Suttaniddesa.🔽The chapter on the uṇ-class is finished.

analyzed: kaccāyana pakaraṇam niṭṭhitam
translated: The Kaccāyana grammar is finished.
